Reviews.Title: “Cost/quality mismatch”
Reviews.Author: dkvacay
Reviews.Content: We needed 3 beds and this was one of the few hotels big enough to accomodate that request. The suite was sweet, it had 3 bedrooms, full kitchen, etc, but I thought I left the dust bunnies at home and yet here they were under the furniture. The master bath tub is either dirty or has paint dripped in it, either way, very unappealing. It is a very nice room, I guess for what we paid, I expect perfection. I also got my nose out of joint because they allow smoking around the pool. Nothing like relaxing in the fresh ocean air and taking a big sniff of cigarette smoke. Staff was helpful at the front desk and concierge, but water sport guys super stressed and disorganized. Location is also suboptimal, 3 miles from Duval St. Although the name says "beachside" you would be hard pressed to call what they have a beach.

Reviews.Title: “they should be ashamed”
Reviews.Author: lizzie a
Reviews.Content: we booked with points expecting a decent sized room with a sliding door to an outside view of something. we got a small, basic room, no carpet, tv on wall since there was no place to put it; we were tucked into a corner with a small window we had to keep covered so people walking by couldnt see us; the tub was so high my husband could barely step into it. what service?? we barely saw staff; info, acknowledgement, friendliness barely existed. The woman at the front desk was colder than an ice cube. She told us we could only upgrade to a larger size room if we paid 75 or 150.00 per night. The restaurant was overpriced - and you had to tip someone to deliver ice to your room. We never, ever had this kind of experience at any Marriott before. Management needs to be addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: Laurel W
Reviews.Content: We arrived to this property after the long drive through the Keys and were warmly welcomed by the gentleman at the front desk with a smile and a glass of complimentary champagne. The room was very well appointed, large and very clean. The pool and bar area were lovely as were the cabanas near the pool. Our balcony was actually pretty private and had great late afternoon sun. The bed and the linens were the usual great quality I have come to expect from the Marriott. We stayed for 5 nights and didn't want to leave, and would definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful property in key west”
Reviews.Author: Bones57
Reviews.Content: Had a great weekend stay at the marriott in Key west. The rooms are fantastic. Two bedroom suite was wonderful. The staff was very accomodating, and they offer free transportation form the hotel every hour to downtown key west. the bus drops you right off at margaritaville, The hotel pool and bar was very spacious, and they have a small sand beach also. The hotel restaurant was jammed saturday night, and it is 5 minutes from the airport. I higly recommedn this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room like a cave”
Reviews.Author: Suzy575
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in the room and noisy restaurant!! We had stayed at the other Marriott on the beach many years agonow the Casa Marina, and thought this would be similar. What a mistake!! Their idea of a beach was some sand dumped in a small area with a few chairs and a sea wall.. We did not realize we would have to request a suite to get a view and a large room. This hotel was definitely not up to Marriott standards--more like a Holiday Inn!! We asled for a different room but they said they were all sold out except rooms like ours.. It was almost impossible to find our room among the maze. of hallways. They should sell this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Remark72
Reviews.Content: Celebrating our 40th Wedding anniversary with another couple married one week prior to us, we headed to Key West, Florida, and stayed at the Key West Marriott Beachside Hotel. What a great choice! We were treated upon arrival to a complimentary champagne toast (thanks, Jake Mir) prior to checking into our suite with two bedrooms, a spacious living area, and a well-supplied kitchen. The view from our balcony was a bit limited of the ocean being off to the left, but it was still a great place. The rooms were clean and all accommodations were very comfortable. The concierge, a woman who had family roots in Key West, was able to provide us with bicycles, as well as great restaurant choices, and places to go while in Key West. She was wonderful and had a great sense of humor, making the trip even more enjoyable. Aside from biking all over the key for 6 days, we also made use of the shuttle from the hotel which took people on the hour to Margaritaville and picked them up at the same place at 20 minutes after the hour. One driver (Ken) provided huge amounts of information in his whimsical manner which served us well throughout the stay. While we did not make use of the dinner options at the hotel, we did have wonderful breakfasts in the hotel. We chose the buffet option but my wife, due to gluten intolerance, elected to have omelets made for a small upcharge. I should also note that the cooks were cognizant of what she could eat, which made us more comfortable that no reactions would be experienced. We spent time in Key West in the morning, returned in the afternoon and spent time at the pool and in the hot-tub, and then ventured out again in the evening. And despite the spring break crowd, we only heard noise one night, and that was promptly stopped. We truly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and felt we were treated so well by the staff. Be aware that the rooms are made up any time before 5:00, just something one needs to be aware of and which the hotel notifies its guests about in the room. We worked around it well. And did I mention that the master bedroom (great tub and shower) always had the bed turned down and a complimentary chocolate placed on the pillow. A nice touch to a great day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Spacious Suites right on the water!”
Reviews.Author: GazzaGirlSeattle
Reviews.Content: I was the group travel coordinator for a business group and selected this hotel for our 3 day conference in Key West. We all had one bedroom Oceanfront suites. The hotel seems older and dated from the outside, but upon entering the guest room suite, I was very pleased! There was a full kitchen, with granite countertops, a dining room, living room, large bedroom, bath and patio complete with lounging chairs and a staircase out to the beach. The furnishings were very tasteful, beautiful beachy colors, in theme with Key West. Everyone in the group loved their rooms and said I had picked the right hotel. I spent many hours considering several Key West hotels and the Marriott Beachside was the best value by far. It is a ways from downtown, but offers comfortable, complimentary shuttle buses every 30 minutes. I actually preferred being away from all the noise and bustle of town - the resort is a nice, quiet, restful spot - perfect for relaxing at the pool or sitting on their dock over the water.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our choice of hotels”
Reviews.Author: KMart3307
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went down to Key West for a long weekend. I have stayed with Marriott for many business trips and felt that these hotels could be trusted and reliable. We got way more than we expected when we arrived. The outside of the hotel looks older, however, the interior of the hotel is absolutely beautiful. The choice of decor throughout the hotel makes it feel very nice and as though we should have paid more for what we got. The staff was very friendly and very receptive to our needs. There are two things that you must be aware of though: 1. This hotel is not close to the downtown Key West area, you must take a shuttle or taxi. 2. Many of the rooms don't have a view. We were aware that we did not pay for a view and we didn't expect one. This hotel was absolutely wonderful and we will look forward to staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Great Upscale hotel, without the upscale $$$$$”
Reviews.Author: beentheredonethat92
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice and clean hotel. The people were nice, except for the breakfast servers... The rooms were spotless and the beds were perfect. I am extremely picky and very hard to please. The only problem I had with this room was my view(but that was my husbands fault) This is a great hotel and would absolutely stay again and again. It was a bit far from Duval street and Mallory Square, but right near the marina for deep sea fishing and even closer to Dion's Chicken. (my kids love it) you will be pleasantly shocked. The pool is fantastic and the workers around the pool even fix your towles and make sure you are comfortable. The guys that rent the waverunners and run the excursions are cool and very nice. Key West is a great place, as was this Hotel. It was a real gem. You must see Mallory square during sun set and take a schooner boat ride. Breathtaking!!!!! I love it!

Reviews.Title: “Average, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: rnbbhs
Reviews.Content: Thought we booked for a good price for the area. Once we checked in they charged our card a second time and told us it would take up to five business days to get our money back. We got to our room and it felt like a box with no view at all and one window. For the price I don't believe it was worth it. They did offer a free shuttle into town to Duval St. which was nice. Other than that not too much more.

Reviews.Title: “First class place”
Reviews.Author: 11Travelbum
Reviews.Content: Only spent one night but great room and nice lounge. Easy check in, check out. Will go back again

Reviews.Title: “Key West luxury”
Reviews.Author: 1972Firebird
Reviews.Content: Other than feeling like a cast member of Lost while trying to find our room (a 200 number that was, strangely enough, on level one), this place has a lot in which to pamper its guests: Modern rooms with tiled flooring and top-quality bedding, a spacious pool area that leads to a small, man-made beach and pier with a scenic water view, extremely friendly and attentive staff, a free shuttle that leaves on the hour to Duval Street (OK, there is a $17 daily parking charge that undoubtedly allows the hotel to offer this service), two-hour nightly happy hours and a lively scene in the lounge. Just the wife and I made the trip, and it looked like most of the guests were adults. A great place to build a vacation around.

Reviews.Title: “Keys vacatio”
Reviews.Author: Melanieinvermont
Reviews.Content: This was a very clean and easy to find hotel. However, the charge for parking was 17.50 per day. A shuttle provided transportation to downtown Key West which was nice. The grounds were beautiful and well maintained. A disapointment was that there was not a free breakfast or coffee offered which you will find at many comparable hotels for the price. And the hotel was huge, a long walk to where your room is located or to the front of the facility. Nice outside tiki bar and beach. We stayed two days and the maids did a very poor job cleaning the second day. And the room was very expensive, as are most places in Key West. All in all, I would stay there again as it was clean, which is very important.

Reviews.Title: “A must place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HappyamI
Reviews.Content: We had 6 adults, infant, and one year old. We were in a three bedroom waterfront condo and loved every minute of it. We found the property and room to be very luxurious and felt very pampered! The breakfast meals were fantastic. I do agree with another reviewer that the pool staff could have been more consumer friendly. They wore sun glasses with mirrors and basically sat and watched others. We all commented on their behavior. The bar pool staff did make the rounds often and found them helpful. We took the shuttle from downtown and there was not enough room for all. The shuttle driver immediately called a taxi to get the remaining people. We thought this was above and beyond. However, that is one reason we like the Marriott. Another item we agree with another reviewer is that the breakfast staff were not consistent. Some help went out of their way to see if we needed anything while others did not.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: BeachyBoots
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised when we checked in and realized we were in a three bedroom waterfront condo for just the two of us. A bit of overkill- but I suppose those are the only oceanfront rooms available. It was furnished beautifully and the view was great even if it was almost $500 a night. I am glad we were not in the heart of Key West. Very quiet. It was a short drive to the dock in Key West or the hotel provided a shuttle. Excellent Pina Coladas at poolbar.

Reviews.Title: “A Sheraton in Marriott clothing.”
Reviews.Author: Uraway
Reviews.Content: As a Gold Member, we expected to have our room preferences honored, but were given an outside, ground floor suite upon late check in, even though we can confirmed with them via email and phone call we would be late on arriving. Next day, they made it right and moved us to an inside facing suite on the 3rd floor. So, now we're happy. The suites are very nice, and a great value. But as the trip wore on, we were increasingly disappointed by an apathetic staff. The front desk is very professional, but the pool crew, restaurant and other staff are very indifferent, poorly dressed, half shaven and often sitting around. I counted 9 tables at breakfast needing clearing while the staff chatted in a corner. The pool restaurant staff never stops by the cabanas to ask if you need anything. We had to call every day at 3:00 to get our room made up; little things like dirty glasses not replaced and towels not refreshed by the turndown left a lot to be desired. Not up to Marriott standards.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect winter getaway”
Reviews.Author: vargoPinehurst
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the staff, from the front desk, to the lovely bar, to the room maids and can't forget the pool help!. It is a lovely facility, with the room being large. The shuttle service was so appreciated. The washer and dryer came in handy, This was our third trip to the Keys and our second to the Marriott Beachside. (The deck cushions need to be replaced, BTW.)

Reviews.Title: “Service was 5 stars!!”
Reviews.Author: kmoonq
Reviews.Content: Upgraded on arrival from 1 bedroom to a 3 bedroom. Every staff member from front desk to pool bartender were very helpful & friendly. After being charged an extra day for parking, front desk completely took it off our bill. I loved the shuttle service. It was so convenient!!! Only about 10 min. Ride to Mallory Square area. I noticed the drivers would drop people off in different areas if they wanted. They were very accomodating. Only thing I would say is that The beach area is small. We were fine though. Our room was on beach area. We preferred it there because pool was crowded. Great place to stay. !!!!! I have no complaints at all!!

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean and upscale.”
Reviews.Author: DebT114
Reviews.Content: Older resort with small but clean king room. Upscale furnishings and linens. Pool area beautiful with small beach. Room service could have been better. Location is far from Duval Street. No Wi-Fi available.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly a Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: MAtripper
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our 25th Anniversary, which we had indicated to Marriott when we booked several months prior. My husband had requested an upgrade if possible, as you always hear of hotels doing something special for people celebrating special events. We were not given an upgraded room, which I can understand (they said they had no additional available rooms), but even though our reservation showed we were celebrating our 25th, the hotel did nothing extra. I thought they could have left a bottle of something in the room, or flowers, a dinner... something! That was a bit disappointing, as my husband is a Marriott Rewards member and we used all our points on this hotel. Obviousy, we'd been loyal Marriott customers, so we felt they could have done something small for us. Aside from that, the hotel is very nice and especially clean. The pool area has attentive staff and the shuttle service to downtown is great. The drivers are friendly and they will send additional vans if more guests need to come or go. The reason I only gave an average rating was that both my husband and I agreed that the mattress was the most uncomfortable one we'd ever experienced in any hotel. It was soft and lumpy, and neither of us could sleep for a week. We told the front desk, and they supposedly had housekeeping switch the mattress. If it was switched, the second was equally uncomfortable. They claimed these were new mattresses, but if so, we certainly did not luck out in that department. Overall, the experience was pleasant at this hotel, and if the bed wasn't terrible, and if our anniversary had been acknowledged in some small way, we'd have given the hotel a much higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, far from action”
Reviews.Author: aaussie
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful 3 bd unit - high end furnishings, down comforters, granite counters, spacious baths. The on-site restaurant looked lovely but we didn't eat there. For a family of six, the space was excellent. The reason for only 4 stars is the location. 3 miles to Duval looks okay on a map, but it's a nuisance to time your activities to the hotel's hourly free shuttle. With red lights and evening traffic, it can take 15 mins to get there. Taxi charges about $7pp so too costly for fam of 6. If you plan to stay put and relax on site, you'll be happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Steven S
Reviews.Content: Reception was rude; management said they will send her for retraining (didn't help me...a gold card member of Marriott awards)!! Room noisy, can't open the windows, opens to a walkway (need to keep your shades closed...so no light and no air), room service took an hour to deliver ice (no self service options) restaurant poor, location: "Beachside" there is no beach!! (a few feet of imported sand which doesn't run to the water doesn't make a beach!). Shuttle to Duval Street (think a low class/tourist Bourbon St in NOLA)runs every hour on the hour and back on the half hour...crowded, drivers have their hands out for a tip and without the shuttle you are locked in. Pool, ok, nothing special, you fight for a chair. Lunch at the pool very poor, no where to walk to for entertainment or a meal. Front desk recommended Denny's or McDonald's. Recommendation, if you must go to key west, stay in town, two very good restaurants "915" and "Flaming Buoy Filet", and can always stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Platinum Members Paradise”
Reviews.Author: live4vacation50
Reviews.Content: I would like to start off by saying that my wife and I are Marriott GOLD members.We have been treated very well by other full court and Renaissance hotels.This hotel does not recognize anything but PLATINUM. When I booked the room, I was told that I could have an early check in. When I showed up at 1:00pm, I was told my room was not ready. We had to wait till 4:30pm. I also asked for an upgrade, which we were promised, but never given. Throughout the week, our room was never cleaned until 4 p.m. One day, the Front Desk staff told us that our room would be cleaned by 2:00 pm (because we had a restaurant reservation and wanted to get back from the pool to take showers) but it wasn't. Other things to consider: If you plan on using the fitness room, make sure to wake up extra early because they ony have 3 tread mills for the entire hotel. If you think that the word BEACHSIDE means something, it does not.There is no BEACH!! Make sure to do your research on restaurants and activities before arriving, because the concierge was not helpful at all. They took our name and cell number to let us know about dinner cruise reservations and never got back to us! While Gold card members usually get breakfast for free, we did not. It was however, a very good buffet.Some nice things about this hotel: the pool was great and had plenty of lounge chairs and umbrellas.The shuttle bus was also good and always on time. We had a good stay overall, but as loyal Marriott gold card members, we thought we would be rewarded with some perks (not a lot, just SOME for what we paid).You must be PLATINUM at this hotel to get any.

Reviews.Title: “good but not great”
Reviews.Author: jimmymac131
Reviews.Content: My wife and i went here on our honeymoon. I upgraded to a suite which was well worth the extra room. Here are a few down falls : The bed was very worn out and lumpy , my wife and i didnt have a good night of sleep while we were there. One night i slept on the couch cause my back was hurting so bad. 2nd found out that the continental breakfast was not for everyone only platium members . Well at 350 a night i should be able to get a free apple or bannana and oj . Thats the only complaints i really have . Now to the good stuff! The room was awesome! Was great to have a full kitchen to make breakfast and a microwave to heat up left overs ! Also was nice to have the full couch as we spent our sunday night watching the 2nd half of the superbowl on the couch cause of the bad weather. The pool area was very nice , but we opted to sit in the sand which was right at the water. There is no real beach but they do have a big enough area to hang out . The bus down to duval street was right on time back and forth . And when there was a overflow they sent another van or bus to get everybody back . The drivers were great easy to talk to knew the area well. Ken was really interesting, seemed like he lived there for years! Very nice to hear the history as we drove .

Reviews.Title: “How suite this was!!! Why not 5 stars?? Terriffic”
Reviews.Author: kittyfSevierville
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by a very pretty lady and the gentleman behind the counter gave us two fluted glasses of cold champayne. Yippee, what a way to check in. Our suite was spic and span clean and so much nicer than places we have stayed -- even in Hawaii. So much faster to get here too. WE WILL RETURN!!! OFTEN IF WE CAN, especially in the winter. Everything was top class. Our view was of the lush gardens and the lighting at night around the pool and hot tub was appreciated. The hot tub was clean and hot and hit the spot after long days of touring the island. We loved having the free shuttle to and from the airport. No hassel. Right on time by the safest of drivers who handled our luggage with care. The on the hour shuttle to Deval Street was great and easy return from the same spot where it let us off. I loved having nice things in our suite. Big, fluffy clean towels. Nice crisp sheets and big comfy soft pillows with extras in the closet for watching tv. Oh the tvs were nice too and cable service provided for plenty of channels and wifi which we didn't need, but you may. We sat out on our beautiful balconey and had cocktails at night before and after dinner and loved having nice wine glasses and nice china. The dishwasher was wonderful and the clothes dryer perfect to dry wet swim suits. A couple of mornings we made coffee from the gormet packets left for us and had orange juice and yummy treats from the bakery uptown. That was a highlight of our stay. Our suite had a fully equipped kitchen and ice maker and it was wonderful not having to keep the ice bucket filled. I love the beach area. It is great for early sunbathing and there is a nice clean pier and we enjoyed watching the sunset from there on evenings we didn't want to go to Mallory Square. Perfect. We watched two young children discover a starfish in the clear water along the edge. Key West imported all the sand from Bermuda. No waves coming into Key West due to the reefs. It was wonderful. I can't say enough. They did a great job to make us feel welcome and our stay was as nice as nice can be. Thank you Beachside. We liked it, we loved it and we want some more of it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “2 Miles Make A Difference”
Reviews.Author: southernglobal
Reviews.Content: Back to Key West again and figured I would stay in a mainstream hotel. The Marriott is a beautiful property with a great restaurant (indoors not poolside), great amenities, and great service. Do not eat the food at the pool bar! The pool area was the perfect place to relax when I got back from jet sking and shopping downtown. The beach was also perfect at sunset. My room was clean, but obviously well used. The bed was comfy and the the linens and bath towels were top notch. Overall, this was a great place. There were more families than I expected, but I suppose it is the time of year most Euorpeans travel with their kids. My only draw back from staying at this hotel again is the location. That being said, I don't believe I will stay anywhere that far away from the action again. It is only two miles from Duval St, but the wait on a taxi (not very friendly taxi drivers in this town - not a one), the trip there, and waiting forever for a lift home just ate up too many dollars and too much time. Yes I saved money staying two miles away, but transportation costs mounted to rates which could have been spent within walking distance. Planning on visiting again this August, so would appreciate any feedback on nice affordable hotels in the historic district.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great!”
Reviews.Author: Capecod10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 10 days and loved everything about this place. We rented a moped which made a lot of sense as this hotel is close to the airport and about 3 miles from Duval Street.and we really wanted to explore Key West. To be honest we slept and ate breakfast at the hotel and otherwise we were out and about. I saw lots of people at the hotel beach and around the pool and there seemed to be room for all. The concierge and front desk people helped us get any info we needed about attractions and water activity. Every staff member was courteous, friendly and helpful. There is an absolutely beautiful place to bike, walk or run along the water next to the hotel. Cannot wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to what I expected.......”
Reviews.Author: ckchaas
Reviews.Content: I want to give an honest complete review of this hotel. I researched trip advisor about this hotel before booking and was confident I was booking with a hotel that both met my standards and gave me the best value for my money. This would be our first trip to Key West and I was unsure where the best location was to stay. The good points are as follows. It was very clean, the grounds were beautiful, the staff was very nice upon check in and out, the shuttle downtown was very convenient, it had nightly turn down service. Overall, it meet my standards on cleanliness and service. Bad points, I booked this hotel in November of 2010. I requested a high floor, extra towels and extra pillows. Upon arrival we were given a room on the first floor. I ask about a higher floor but it was unavailable but I was given the option of calling the next day to see if another room was available. After unpacking I didn't want to pack up and move after getting settled in. The towels and pillows were the customary allotment so I'm not sure "requests" are looked at upon check in. I also booked a "resort view" which on the website depicted a view of the inside of the resort overlooking the pool. We were booked in a room directly looking at a stucco wall. I called the front desk and was told a resort view was also a view of the gardens. The gardens consisted of a few trees and a few bushes. So my advise, call the desk before arrival and clearly state you want a high floor and overlooking the pool. In the room my only complaint was two of the jets weren't working in the tub and the water pressure in the shower was terrible! Also, if you are going to enjoy the beach, you might look for another location that offers more beach area. On our next trip we will book a little closer to town. We did visit the restaurant one evening for drinks and the staff there was not as friendly as the front desk staff. Overall, great hotel minus the few issues.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WAYNE069
Reviews.Content: This was great, i paid 159.00 per night. And had it all a nice room and top service. now is the time to play in the sun. so have a great time..

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Goldenretrieversareg
Reviews.Content: I'm not hard to please. Quit room..comfortable bed ...in house movies..coffee maker ... snack bar...and most important great view from a private balcony. We stayed in large oceanfront suite....don't know why my wife booked it.. Full service kitchen and room for eight...but we weren't planning a dinner party and my wife wasn't cooking....arrived late ...no mini bar...coffee but no cream..no movies Next morning..view ok if your deaf and have severe cervical arthritis limiting neck rotation and flexion...otherwise you will hear loud traffic and ambulance sirens blasting from the nearby crowded street...you will see dirty seaweed and rocks on your beach from your balcony..you will also see and hear 2 or 3 of your neighbors on their balcony. Lastly,we were told at check in we would be getting free breakfast and were surprised they really meant "continental". The workout room was awful. The pool average. The service top notch. The people were very nice and we have been promised a full refund for the one night we stayed before checking our early.

Reviews.Title: “Average everything”
Reviews.Author: Milu C
Reviews.Content: The rooms were pretty small, although nicely furnished. Found it difficult to locate the room, the directions from the front desk are pretty muddy. Average bathroom, nothing interesting. Our room (I think most rooms) are along the outside corridor, and we were facing the street, so pretty loud. If we'd been there for more than one night I would have asked to change rooms to other side of hotel. Front desk staff are polite and aloof, that may be their thing. Glass of champagne on check in is a nice touch. Free wifi in lobby, but expensive wifi in room. I found the hotel to be overpriced for what you get and the location. Although there is a shuttle into town, it's pretty far. Next time I'd stay closer to town and shop around a bit more before booking.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: UKPinkPanther
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in a one bed-roomed Presidential suite and could not fault the facilities of this hotel in any way. On arrival we were offered a glass of sparkling white wine which was very welcome after a long journey.The room itself was large with a good sized balcony and first-rate kitchen and dining facilities. There was plenty of sunbathing spots to choose from in the grounds and the pool was of a reasonable size. We found the shuttle service to and from Duval Street easy to use - it runs every hour - with helpful and informative drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Cuba”
Reviews.Author: skiutah9
Reviews.Content: Good location, but the rooms are very noisy when the doors open and close. I mean it is a bang when the outer door closes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jessford78
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully clean! The pool and beach area are steps from your room. Jet ski rentals are on site and the tour was amazing, we went around the entire island. Happy hour in the bar/ restaurant is buy one drink get one free. The free shuttle to downtown is great, but fills up quickly in the early evening. Drinks poolside are about $10. Quiet location which was nice after a busy, rowdy evening downtown. Nice beach side walk to Denny's or iHop for breakfast. Wonderfull experience and would stay again if we ever go back to Key West. I did not see a lot of small children. It seems to cater to a more adult crowd. Most people were between 30 and 50.

Reviews.Title: “dont get stuck behind the bar”
Reviews.Author: peterdcpa
Reviews.Content: if your room is behind the Blue Bar your view is obstructed and the noise from the refigeration units was too much. Rooms clean and large, nice full kitchen but not necessary if you eat out each night. the bathroom shower and tub were both huge but real low water pressure. Really small beach with nasty sand Id rather stay closer to down town

Reviews.Title: “Not the best stay”
Reviews.Author: Kathy P
Reviews.Content: The parking should be free when you stay in a Hotel. Be sure to ask them about the parking fee. Also, We made reservations weeks ahead but they put us in a room that was inside another room. It would be great for two couples or families but we felt we were sharing a room with strangers. Not impressed with Marriott at this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In Key West”
Reviews.Author: gfkfsbrents
Reviews.Content: Great facilities, ammenitties, staff and price. A little far from Duval St but they run free shuttle all day long.

Reviews.Title: “Good restaurant, Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris L
Reviews.Content: This place was very nice, but I was a bit disappointed with its "Beachside" name. There is no beach, do not be fooled. The best aspect of this place is its Tavern, which has delicious Tapas twice a week (I think Tues and Thur). The restaurant and bar is incredible and if I strongly recommend eating there. As far as the accommodations, this place had smaller rooms, which I am okay with, however, there was no refrigerator or ice, which is kind of a PITA. The beds are very comfy and the cleaning service is exceptional. The shuttle service is also very convenient for getting into town. Be aware, you need to have a rental car or plan ahead to get to the dive companies, pier, etc in Key West. Overall, I recommend this place. For some reason the lack of free ice and/or refrigerator kinda annoyed me, but other than that they were solid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms; superb suites; far edge of town”
Reviews.Author: msandman
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed four nights. We had a 1-bedroom suite and a normal room with king bed. The suite was superb -- really a 1-bedroom apartment with full sized kitchen appliances and a separate dining area. It had a good sized balcony facing the pool, and a large well-appointed bathroom. But note that 4 people will not be comfortable in some of the 1-bedroom suites because some of tehm have L-shaped sectional sofas rather than sofa beds. And the hotel does not offer roll-away beds. The bedroom in the suite and the normal bedroom are about the same moderately large size, nicely furnished. The hotel is managed a bit too casually. There were not as many towels in the room, and we had to call down to the desk at 2:00 PM to get the room serviced. Room service consisted of making the bed and refreshing the bathroom, but doing almost no cleaning, although that may have been because we were in the room.. Towels do get refreshed at 5:00 PM. There's a $17.00 charge for self-parking that wasn't mentioned when we checked in, and there was no indication of the charge at the entrance to the garage. So... management could be a bit sharper. The hotel is about 3 miles from the center of Key West. The hotel runs a shuttle once an hour into town, and the traffic isn't too heavy, so you can drive in yourself and not feel frazzled. There's no beach to speak of at the hotel, but there's a nice public beach on the south side of the island, accessible by car or bike. There are good bike paths or bike lanes almost everywhere and you can rent a bike easily and bike into town. (No one on a 2 wheeled vehicle wore a helmet -- not on bike, motor scooters or motor cycles. If you want a bike helmet bring your own.)

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: LeslieIdaho_USA
Reviews.Content: I was handed a glass of sparkling wine while waiting to check in. That set the tone for a lovely stay. For some reason they decided to upgrade us to a 3 bedroom condo instead of the 1 bedroom we reserved. That was a nice surprise. Wow, beautiful condo with travertine floors and lavish bathrooms. I really enjoyed the huge jetted tub at the end of each day. The view was amazing but the beach small and water not really swimmable. Although, I didn't see any other hotels with better. The hotel is a bit further from downtown but that didn't matter. The shuttle service was on time and they were extremely friendly and polite. Our 1st night there were too many people to take on the shuttle so the front desk called and paid for taxis for everyone. Most places you would have to wait for the shuttle to return. We had drinks at the classy bar each night and again the staff was excellent. So glad I did my research and stayed at the Marriott Beachside! We will return here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Seems to be well suited for families, not so much for couples.”
Reviews.Author: bird1010
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with another couple in December. The rooms are luxurious and very spacious. The large number of very loud children at the pool was a problem. We were on the fourth floor and could not sleep-in due to constant and exuberant games of "Marco Polo". Unfortunately, the parents of the excited children must have found this charming. Hotel was nice, food at poolside was good. Servers were ubiquitous by the pool. We had a car so we never took the shuttle. Would stay here again if I was with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Overnighter”
Reviews.Author: CFII
Reviews.Content: Reserved online for an overnight stay back from Grand Cayman. Called the hotel from the General Aviation side of the airport and was promptly picked-up and dropped-off the next morning. The rate was pricey but chose the hotel due to it's proximity from the airport. The room was clean and comfortable. Would not stay there when traveling with family as there are no rooms with double-beds, only 1 king per room. Used the shuttle to go downtown, it ran on time and had no problems with it.Getting to the rooms is a bit inconvenient as you have to walk quite a distance from the lobby depending on which building you get and there is one elevator per building accessible via the parking garage. Mattress springs were squeaky from wear but since was a king size, moved over to the other side. For the high nightly rate, an additional $17.50 in parking fee seems excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a heatbeat!”
Reviews.Author: Eck1215
Reviews.Content: Top notch accommodations and service. We really felt as if we were someone special. The suites are beautiful. We had a gulf view with a spiral staircase that lead to the private little beach and then out to a sitting area at the end of the dock. Absolutely wonderful. Great breakfast to start the day and a nice little pool bar to relax and enjoy when recovering from the previous night out from Boondocks. Shuttle service to and from and also easy access to the airport. Tiffany was wonderful to deal with and went above and beyond to make our group stay enjoyable. After staying in that room I am really contemplating buying the Marriott bed with all the trimmings! I haven't slept in comfort like that ever.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: westsidebernie
Reviews.Content: Had a standard room - looked like done over recently. Very Nice. Shuttle easy to take into center of town. Pool area nice + small beach area right there.

Reviews.Title: “It's what you expect from the Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: ElminR
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great, the service was like royalty. Beach on the hotel for guest. good location. The only thing is if you want a hot shower, it takes literally one to two minutes to reach hot water. other than that, its a great stay and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Judith S
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West and we could not have picked a better place to stay. The room was small; but, we did not come to stay in the room so that did not matter to us. We came to see Key West and that's what we did. The free shuttle took us downtown whenever we wanted and to/from the airport on time. John, the shuttle driver and Bart, the pool bartender were most helpful in giving us tips on what to see, where to go and where to eat-this was a big help and made our trip unforgetable. The staff met our every need and request without hesitation. The pool was beautiful, the beach was nice. There was access into the ocean but this time of year..we preferred the pool and hot tub. Thanks to everyone there for going out of their way to make it a perfect vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A Classy Option in Key West”
Reviews.Author: FTLAW
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel to stay at at the conclusion of a running relay race from Miami to Key West. I booked late, so options were slim. The reservations staff was very helpful in securing a room for the night for me. The location is not very close to Duval Street, but by car it is not far at all (nothing is far) and the hotel has a free shuttle on the hour to take you straight to Duval. The lobby was not extremely large, but was tasteful and the staff was pleasant. The restaurant was large and had a quite nice breakfast buffet. I had a one bedroom king. The bed was very comfortable. The room was not very big, but big enough to serve its purpose. The bathroom was nice. The room had a safe. The air conditioner worked well. The windows were nice, but if you had the curtains and blinds completely open, guests walking on the narrow walkway in front of your room can easily look right in.

Reviews.Title: “Two Different Stays with Varying Results”
Reviews.Author: dnumgis02
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice, once in September and once in December. One should note that this hotel is away from Duvall St and the center of action, but there is free shuttle service. I had my Platinum status recognized during both stays with free continental breakfast for the status. For my September stay, I had one of the better non-suite rooms that had a partial view of the pool. While the room was compact, I slept extremely well. For my December stay, I got upgraded to one of suites. The suite is gorgeous with a full stainless steel kitchen, a living room, a bedroom, and a bathroom with separate bath and shower. Unfortunately there was a strange intermittent noise outside of my room so I did not get a good night's rest. Fortunately it was only one night so I didn't make much fuss about the noise. All in all, I varying results with my stays but this Marriott does strive to be one of the better full service Marriotts out there.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, not great, but the service is not up to standard.”
Reviews.Author: arozylo1
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of aspects of this hotel that I like. The king suite I had was great, overlooking the pool with a walk-down stairway so you did not have to walk to the elevator. It was fully equipped with a modern kitchen, had 2 flat screen TVs, a big bathroom with a spa tub and nice shower, and a roomy veranda. The location was fine for me, out of the noise and bustle of town, but with an hourly shuttle to take you there (with a great driver). Parking was good, underneath my unit. The pool and spa area was pleasant and well-kept, and there was a small private beach where you could get wave runners and other water equipment. Where improvement is needed was in the service. We stayed a week, and had to call 3 days to get the room made up late in the afternoon. The restaurant, while lively both morning and evening, had staff that varied in friendliness, most good, but some look as if they forgot how to smile. The concierge did not consistently return phone calls. If you book, make sure you get a suite (which most units are), since the regular rooms have no veranda and generally do not have a view. I would stay here again, but I hope the management reads these reviews and trains their staff to be more consistently friendly and service-oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Key West”
Reviews.Author: joacre
Reviews.Content: Rented a 1 bedroom with a full service kitchen. Place was very nice. Someone picked us up at the airport and took us back. Free shuttle to the main downtown areas all day long. Did not need a car for this stay. The reception crew were funny nice and friendly. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Confirmied. WORST Marriott EVER”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra S
Reviews.Content: I concur with the other reviewer that this is one of the worst hotels. We also are Platinum members which counted for nothing. â€¢ Checked in and told Housekeeping had to check room. Understandable but they didnâ€™t even have the pillows facing the correct way; glitter on the carpet, hair on the bed. â€¢ Also told at check in that this was a busy week and so they did not have an upgrade. We looked at a wall and had a handicapped room with no tub which was highly problematic for my mother in-law. â€¢ Day 1 we checked in on Christmas Day. Our daughter came down with an ear infection and I carried her down to the desk screaming and crying in pain. I asked if they could take us to a drugstore and was told they were â€œprohibitedâ€�. I asked for them to call a cab which they did but there was nobody from the hotel at the front door and another couple took our taxi. I asked again and was able to get o the pharmacy and back. The best was at turn down that night we could hear over the blaring walkie talkie the housekeeper carried, â€œBellman can you please pick up a guest from this restaurantâ€� and it was confirmed and requested for more than 1 party. Nice. â€¢ Generally the staff was just not friendly. Very hard to believe or call this a 4 star hotel when the staff at the Courtyard we stay at are more caring, friendly and attentive. Even as platinum travelers nobody ever used our name on the phone until the last day we checked out. I was ready to at least advise the hotel of our experience but when we checked out they didnâ€™t ask us about our stay! â€¢ On more than one occasion we would wait 8-10 rings with a request for operator to pick phone only to be placed on hold; yet each time that happened I went down to the desk there were 2-3 people sitting and drinking coffee and chatting among themselves. â€¢ Restaurants were equally disappointing. Christmas Day room service with the ear ache was a hodge podge of linen colors, a plastic pitcher of water, not even glasses of ice water and the plates served raised inside of the cover?! One time we ordered grilled cheese which was inedible because they must have just grilled fish and thatâ€™s what the sandwich tasted like. The other time we ordered we were told 45 minutes and called after 50 minutes to see where food was and told they were putting the order together now. As opposed to sorry or calling us maybe at 40 minutes to say they were going to be late. Very spotty service at the pool as well. â€¢ There must be a shortage of teaspoons because the restaurant one day only had soup spoons for cereal and coffee; even when we had coffee at the pool it was served with a soup spoon. At least as not horrible as the gentleman behind the breakfast bar using his fingers (without gloves) to refill the buffet. â€¢ In general staff and service is just not what you have grown to expect with Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our group”
Reviews.Author: Carjar
Reviews.Content: We were 3 couples visiting Key West and had reserved one of the 3 bedroom/3 bathroom suites. The suite was very large and very clean. It had a top end kitchen and even a washer/dryer. Groceery stores are nearby. The hotel is about 10-15 minutes from busy Duval street, which is a good thing as it can be very noisy. You can drive into town or the hotel provides a shuttle service to & from the center BUT it is not always reliable; one night we had to take a taxi back and we were not pleased! There is no 'swimming' beach here, so beware. The pool area is very nice and clean and there are plenty of towels. All in all, a great place for a couples stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a little noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Assassin8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at a newer (great) property- but this Marriott was far from Duval street and there was noise from the street traffic. There was additional noise from slamming of the heavy doors of the rooms. We did have a beautiful suite with a stunning view of the bay. Nice soaking tub and comfy bed and even a kitchenette! Staff seemed friendly and overall we got good service. (A litter of "Marriott" kittens were hanging out around the pool -begging for food and they were a huge hit with all the guests! Me especially!)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, be cautious about the room you select”
Reviews.Author: texasgrown11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary in Key West in May 2011. This hotel is a beautiful property on the water. The hotel has several buildings situated around a beautiful pool & bar area. We spent several days sipping cocktails by the pool. They also have some burgers, sandwiches and other snacks that they will serve poolside. There is also a private, sandy beach area with chairs and a dock that offers gorgeous sunset views. The rooms - The lower cost, basic rooms can be very small. The room is hardly big enough for the bed with an en suite bathroom with a shower/tub combo. We spent our first several nights in one of these rooms and felt cramped. A light sleeper might have a hard time as the walls are thin and these rooms are typically situated next to the walkways. These rooms do not have a view. Just look at the description of the rooms carefully before reserving. It is worth the extra cost for a bigger room. At the end of our trip, we were upgraded to a bigger room with a view and couldn't believe the difference! We had a HUGE master bedroom with a spa-quality shower and jacuzzi tub. We had a separate living room with a full kitchen and dining area. There was a half bath attached to the living area as well. Our closet alone was probably the size of our first room, it was unbelievable! The room also had a patio with gorgeous ocean and beach views. We sat outside for morning coffees and evening cocktails & sunsets every day. If you have the points or can budget for these rooms, it is well worth it! Overall, we thought the other beaches in Key West were OK, crowded and disappointing considering you typically have to pay for access - so after exploring the island, shopping, and eating, we would've spent the rest of our trip enjoying the pool and our awesome room at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst resort”
Reviews.Author: tslowik
Reviews.Content: We reserved a water view room for new years eve at the end of october 2011. A week before our check in day they emailed us to tell us it was going to cost us an additional $125/night (on top of the current $399/night). They did not honor the first reservation because "this is a busy week and we can get this rate". I am a platinum member of Marriott. Have been for years. The room they gave us is a 2nd bedroom lock off of a time share. No view, no sliding door stuck in the middle of a complex. They asked if there was anything they could do. We asked for a discount but got none. In other words they asked if they could anything but had no intention of doing anything. The manager was useless. We travel a lot and have never been treated like this. DO NOT reserve this hotel. Plus it's 3.5 miles from town. The resort is poorly designed... And not managed well. The beach looks out over a landfill,,,

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Noisy Neighbors and Maids”
Reviews.Author: danwriter
Reviews.Content: Christmas 2011. Other reviews compliment the suites but the regular rooms are nicely appointed but quite small. B261 is opposite a linen closet/housekeeping station and doors slam and carts rumble like thunder on a morning you hoped to sleep in. Room shares a foyer and neighbors slam the common door often and early. The entire property is actually a failed condo project, a victim of the South Florida housing bust (as per one of the employees, confirmed via Google) so there might be some bad juju at work. Staff is great, though. Just avoid those rooms near housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest suites I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: nancy w
Reviews.Content: The Beachside suites we were upgraded to was one of the nicest I've ever stayed in. We surprised to have a full dining room and kitchen with subzero. The location is a bit off the beaten path but with the free shuttle to town and the airport all was well. We did have one glitch when we were moved from the hotel room after the first night to our suite my husbands brand new collared shirt went missing after we asked housekeeping to retrieve. I disappointment that left us a little uneasy and annoyed. If you're planning on spending time at the pool I would def snag a spot early and in the middle to enjoy the sun all day. There are watersports available on the property as well as a small but nice workout room. I'd def recommend the happy hour and tapas menu at the restaurant as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, spacious and relaxing!!”
Reviews.Author: ClinesATL
Reviews.Content: Great trip. The hotel is five star all the way. Gorgeous suites, awesome service and a perfectly relaxing pool. The food at Tavern N Town was excellent and the ambiance was top notch. The pool was relaxing and quiet, and the drinks and food from the bar were great. Finally, the free shuttle to Duval was really impressive. The drivers were friendly to everyone and told us the best places to eat and shop. We also met a lot of cool people shuttling back and forth. Awesome resort-I completely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: KateDonovan
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property. I stayed here with my husband and sister. Our room was huge! 1.5 baths, a comfortable king bed, kitchen, living room, huge lanai! I don't think all the rooms are this large, but wow was this fabulous! I think this property used to be one bedroom condos for sale, but was converted to a hotel. Everything was very clean and the staff were friendly and made us feel welcome. Easy parking, clean pool and hot tub, nice beach area for lounging, fun pool bar, turndown service with chocolates on the pillow. Overall very nice! The only downside is location. There is a shuttle to Duval Street, but I think it stops at 11:00pm. A cab back was about $20 with tip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Key West Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louannblank
Reviews.Content: Although there is no beach for swimming, you can rent jet skis and canoes for use on the bayside. at the hotel There is a hotel shuttle that drops off and picks up on Duval Street. This is great since parking is limited and pricey in the Downtown area. The pool was very nice and fortunately we had a breeze for part of our stay. Only had breakfast at the hotel which was very good. Recommend the snorkling tour with Fury. Bahia Honda State Park. is a nice day trip. Take a lunch and enjoy one of the few beaches in the keys.

Reviews.Title: “"Amazing suites" does not do this place justice!”
Reviews.Author: travelindiva_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the 1 bedroom suite with a resort view. The suites are exactly like the website. This resort was far more than what I excpected. We really enjoyed our time here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: brad b
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at the Marriott Beachside and it was great...I booked a 1 bedroom suite but they upgraded me to a 3 bedroom/3bath Presidential suite...The room was beautiful,clean and spacious.The pool was very relaxing and the restaurant was awesome especially dinner.The staff was very helpful and friendly.The shuttle to Duval St was great but coming back every night we took a cab because it was very late..Sat night there was a fire in the hotel but that just made the trip more memorable....Would definetly go back

Reviews.Title: “Great suites!”
Reviews.Author: GatorFan49
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days for a business trip. The room I got was a suite and it was huge and very nice-- more like apartment that had 2 separate areas. One bedroom with full bath and the other living room and real kitchen with full dining table, subzero fridge, etc- way more than what one would expect. The floors were all nice travertine tile and very clean. The only downside was the shower had very low water pressure. This may have been an issue in just my room- not sure. They also have a complimentary shuttle that takes you downtown which is only a few minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but far from the action”
Reviews.Author: lcannava
Reviews.Content: My friends were getting married and reserved rooms at this hotel. Rooms were nice, clean. I had a normal room but would recommend a single suite to anyone who wants a huge room with a kitchen for a longer stay. The hotel is very close to the airport but far from downtown. There is a shuttle bus that runs on the hour that will take you in town (15-20mins). They have a nice pool and a tiny non-swimming beach in the bay. I got a good deal with the wedding booking but I would have preferred to stay at a B&B on the south part of the island and be able to walk to town.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Rooms and Super Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: eatandreview
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite. It has everything and I mean everything in it. Washer and dryer, full dining room fully equipped kitchen. The appliances are top of the line and rival those we own in our own home. Bed was super comfortable and the view was dramatic. The only down fall is that their shuttle service only runs once an hour but the driver will drop you off anywhere on the way, but he can only pick up at 1 spot. I would have given them 5 stars, except it is about as far from Duval street as you can get and the shuttle only runs once a day.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Phun-seekers
Reviews.Content: Room arrangement is curious and creates a noisy, non-private experience. Service is great. Shuttle to downtown is handy. Decent rooms. Have low expectations and all should go well.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Property!”
Reviews.Author: Julie C
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding property. Very clean, nicely appointed and the staff was great! We stayed in the 3 bedroom presidential suite and we were not disappointed. We especially liked having a full kitchen. Every morning we could make our coffee and sit on our huge deck and watch the day begin. In the evening make a cocktail and look at the stars. Another nice perk was having a washer and dryer right in our suite. We could pack light, allowing us to avoid some of those excessive airline baggage fees. This hotel is not within walking distance of all the " action " but that is actually what we loved about it! We could party until dawn and then come back to peace and quiet. It was a great place to relax and regroup. Take a few hours your first day in Key West and rent an electric car. They are really fun and a great way to get acquainted with the island. Being a Platinum Elite members we have stayed at many, many Marriott properties, We would have to say this is one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great Property in a great place!”
Reviews.Author: jj114558277
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful property located right as you enter the island. The lobby and restaurant are beautiful and the pool and poolbar are a blast. Rooms are very nice and comfortable, and the staff is great. Definitely a great option for your trip to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding”
Reviews.Author: sunyatcamp
Reviews.Content: We had a very small room, although we did not stay in the room long. The front desk staff was not very informative but the rest of the staff was just fine. I can say the wedding planner was great and the food and drink at the party were wonderful. It was chilly on the beach but a great day for a wedding!

Reviews.Title: “Huge room that was spotless and full of extras.”
Reviews.Author: Deanvt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott for 2 nights, loved the bed, the shower, the kitchen. King size bed with great sheets and pillows, huge walk in shower, kitchenaid appliances. (of course we only used the toaster). In suite washer and dryer with Detergent! Would be great to get a suite for the family. Only drawback was distance from Duval, but there is a free shuttle on the hour that drops you off at Margarittaville in the heart of Duval St.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous views with very cozy clean rooms.. Double balconies..”
Reviews.Author: smokee2727
Reviews.Content: Its not right in the heart of key west, but for a 5 minute ride, its well worth it... Rooms are new full kitchen dining 1 and a half bath. Double balconies. Beautiful views of the gulf... Like the fact the its quite and off the beaten path.

Reviews.Title: “WOW gorgeous room & view!”
Reviews.Author: ScenicRt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I originally checked in for only one night and we were supposed to go to another FL location the following night. 15 minutes after we checked I we called the front desk and extended our stay an additional night. The room and view were impressive. The furnishings were up to date and gorgeous. The floors were huge marbled tiles throughout. The balcony had cushioned lounge chairs and a staircase to you one personal space of beach with more lounge chairs. The gulf was a few feet away. We had a drink at the pool bar one late afternoon before heading to The hotel restaurant for happy hour and tapas. The drinks were the best we had all week and the tapas at the bat were delicious.bthe hotel has a free shuttle every hour to downtown which we used several times without any issue. A cab ride is $20 to downtown so the free shuttle was extremely convenient. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dnot55
Reviews.Content: Wanted to stay downtown, but now glad we didn't!! Location is perfect - away from all the loudness of Duval Street. Shuttle to downtown was great! Front desk folks were super-nice! Ate in the restaruant - delicious pizza!! Overall a wonderful experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations and Outstanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: zeromiler
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here two times in the past 3 years. I've got to say that the accomodations are still excellent and service from the staff is outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodation”
Reviews.Author: OskarandSunny
Reviews.Content: The rooms are superb , modern, clean, spacious and beautifully furnished. The location not so good About 3 miles from Duvall St. , hotel runs a shuttle to downtown if you don't have a car. Hilton should look at what Marriott are doing. Only problem we had we arrived an hour early for checking and the room wasn't ready. They said they would get the room ready as a priority and call us when it was finished, an hour later we re checked and the room was ready but no one told us. they apologized and threw in free breakfast....

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations...a little off the beaten path.”
Reviews.Author: vivvitale
Reviews.Content: We just had a "girl's weekend away" in Key West. The Marriott was perfect for us. We each had our own room, living room and dining area and deck. Four of us had room to spare - six would have been fine as well (we had a 3 bedroom unit; two with queens, one with twins). Pool is great and the facility is well taken care of. However, this is not in the middle of the town...they do, however, provide a shuttle to town that gets you to the heart of things. Definitely would recommend for a group or family. The facility was clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “A WEDDING TO REMEMBER”
Reviews.Author: brutusToledo
Reviews.Content: Our daughter got married on July 8th 2011.The Marriott and staff made this special day even more special.The suites,the grounds,the food and the staff were amazing!!!!!! Best srervice by far we have ever experienced.We had 150 people attend and they are still talking about the great experience.Kudo,s to The Marriott for providing one memorable week,especially Liana Pyne.If you are thinking of having a destination wedding,this is your home.Do not miss out!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with everything you need!”
Reviews.Author: sanddunegirl
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 5 day stay at the beachside Marriott. First of all, we highly recommend upgrading to the suite! We would have been so sad to be stuck in the smaller/non view room for a week. The pool was a really nice area with a poolside bar ($10 drinks) and good food. There is a beach but it's man made and not very good for swimming. The tavern and town restaurant inside the hotel was really nice. I dont think I ordered the best things but the key lime pie was really good! We happens to be coming to the hotel to attend a small conference and the hotel seemed to handle all of the food and logistics really well. The hotel isn't close to duvall street but there is a free shuttle that runs every hour and it worked great for us to be able to explore the island.

Reviews.Title: “Spoiled for Other Hotels”
Reviews.Author: lindyligirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel will spoil you for all others. Upon check-in we were welcomed with a glass of champagne, which I thought was lovely. The room itself is huge and beautifully appointed. We had a wonderful kitchen, dining room, huge living area, beautiful bed, and a bathroom I would love to have at home. Also the balcony was large enough for lounge chairs and then some. The pool area was clean and the snack bar was right beside the pool. We had lunch there one afternoon and the food is very good as well as the drinks. The resort lobby is your first impression of the hotel and you can tell that you're in for a treat. As I said in my title review, this hotel spoils you for all others. This is my second time in this hotel and I intend to go back again and again. Another plus for the hotel is the shuttle down to Duval Street, you don't have to worry about your car and can enjoy some drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Best Suite Stayed at”
Reviews.Author: angelica r
Reviews.Content: We booked a two bedroom suite. BEST DECISION EVER!! By far one of the best hotels Iâ€™ve stayed at. The suite that overlooks the pools has pool entrances which are so convenient. Everything was so clean. Beds were amazing. I honestly have not one negative thing to say. I read some of the negative reviews and maybe the standard rooms arenâ€™t as great, i guess you get what you pay for, but when it comes to their suites, I HAVE NO COMPLAINTS. Only thing is hotel is a drive from duval, besides location issues, everything was great :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel even if it is a bit far from the action.”
Reviews.Author: susiegrneyes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott beachside between 09/23/2011 and 09/26/2011. We stayed in a one bedroom presidential suite. We were originally booked at the Casa Marina, but we opted not to stay after finding the room to be sub par. The room at the Marriott was at least 3 times the size of the Casa Marina and was $30 less per night. The gentleman at the front desk was kind enough to waive the parking fee for us. The covered parking was definitely a bonus given the heat while we were there. The rooms were fantastic, just like the pictures. The kitchen has granite countertops and top of the line appliances. The bed is very confortable and the travertine tiled shower is very nice too. I loved the two story balcony. The patio furniture was extermely confortable. The second level is private and has great views of the ocean and pool. The pool was never too crowded. The room numbers are a little confusing at first, but they make sense once you understand the system. For example our room number was 236. It's building 2, floor 3, room 6. The only drawback is you are about 10 minutes from duval street. The hotel offers a complimentry shuttle, but we did not take advantage of it. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ed F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Key West Marriott Beachside Hotel for our recent honeymoon. The facilities were excellent and the customer service by the staff was simply OUTSTANDING! We plan to stay there every year on the anniversary of our honeymoon!!!! Thank you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but a bit away from the action”
Reviews.Author: wnuval
Reviews.Content: It's about a 10-minute drive to Duval Street for Key West night life. You can also leave the car and rent scooters or bicycles right across the street from this hotel, which is highly recommended. Very fun to cruise around the island, although maybe not so much in the summer unless you love hot, muggy weather (which I do not). But still fun although a bit uncomfortable. The hotel itself is great - 3-bedroom suite was fabulous - great big bathtub, swanky fixtures, a little balcony with rooftop access, a la Hangover. Pina colada in the pool, and I definitely felt like I was on vacation. Wish they had wifi access in room but the wired internet suited our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Disneygrammy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right across from Smathers Beach. They have jitneys to take you to Mallery Square every 15 to 20 min. and bring you back. Very clean and quaint.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel only minutes from Duval St.”
Reviews.Author: dmeyer
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Beachside was amazing! My husband and I spent a week there with our 8 month old daughter. We had a 2BR/2 bath unit while staying at the hotel and our balcony had direct access to the pool via stairs. Poolside food and drinks were great, excellent location away from the noise and craziness of Duval St. The hotel's shuttle also offers free service to and from Duval St. every hour, which is very convenient. Would definitely stay at this hotel again when we're back in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property, Terrible Location”
Reviews.Author: maltasr
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at this property August 3-9. We used our Marriott points for five of the nights and paid about $150 for the sixth. In retrospect, we probably could have put our Marriott points to better use. The "Presidential Suite" we stayed in was beautifully appointed and all of the appliances were absolutely top of the line. We had a pool view suite which afforded a minimal view of the pool area. The water view suites which were much more costly actually only have a view of the lagoon (aka) swamp where we would never swim or utilize in any way. The hotel, as many reviewers have already pointed out, is in a nondescript part of Key West and far from the main action along and near Duval Street. The hotel tries to compensate for the poor location by providing an hourly shuttle to and from Duval. Unless you can find a substantial discount from the rack rates or have some other significant discount, I'd highly recommend staying at another property closer to the main action as well as the multitude of good quality restaurants in the Duval area. Key West can be a fun place, but I'd highly recommend staying in a more desirable location and only traveling there in the Oct.-Apr. interval. The FantasyFest held in October is probably the best time to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the family”
Reviews.Author: Tressea
Reviews.Content: We had 4 adults and 2 toddlers. It was great. the 3 bedroom set up worked for some privacy,3 full baths was great. Kitchen was excellent. No beach but there was a nice pier to go out on to sit and watch the sunset. Good balcony with comfortable furniture. Shuttle to Duval on the hour. Outstanding staff and service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gary307
Reviews.Content: Quality of rooms are much better than the outside appearance would suggest at this property....lots of Marble, nice space, and the location is fine...while it's away from the craziness of Duval Street, all of that is easily accessible via a shuttle or your own car... Great value for the space. Nice amenities, ie. pool, small beach area (gulf side, not Atlantic) good bar and restaurant....

Reviews.Title: “A good experience but minor issues detracted.”
Reviews.Author: petsaloz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a large apartment facility with family. The apartment was excellent providing all that was needed. The little things that detracted were a broken door on the clothes drier - an essential piece of equipment with babies and little children. The standard of housekeeping was below expectations but still good. These minor issues would not prevent anyone having a good stay. All facilities such as the pool etc were very good. A bus service into the township is offered and this makes up for the edge of town position. Quiet and peaceful - would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Key West Marriott Beachside Hotel”
Reviews.Author: francis k
Reviews.Content: This is our review of our stay at the Marriott Key West Beachside Resort. My wife and I stayed from Saturday, August 20th through Friday, August 19th, while our daughter was on a cruise with her friends. We didnâ€™t know this was originally constructed, before the real estate bust, as primarily 1 bedroom private residences, with a 2nd attached bedroom in a common foyer area. Only a percentage of the residences were sold and people can rent the 1 bedroom suite or the 2nd bedroom like hotel rooms. We were asked at check in if we wanted the balcony view and we declined not knowing it was code for the 1 bedroom suite. We may have opted for that because the 2nd bedroom was really tiny. I could have literally swung my legs off the bed, stood up and be within inches of the bathroom. The bathroom did feature a very nice, deep bathtub, which was very conducive to long, hot soaking baths. They did provide daily housekeeping services. There were only exterior hallways and the floors became slippery when it rained. Whoever was the architect should have his license revoked because the layout of buildings was very confusing and they had parking under each of the buildings. The pool, small as it was, was surrounded by the buildings and we heard car alarms going off every day. The elevators required key cards to access the floors, but anyone could have put their hand through the security gate and unlocked it, allowing access to the staircase. They did have CCTV at each entry point and at least 1 guard patrolling the grounds. The pool was awfully small and thank god the resort wasnâ€™t full because it would have been ugly. They did have very attentive pool guys who would lay out the pads, scoop up the left over towels and bring out new ones. The nearby man-made beach was ok, but nothing to write home about. The watersports area was a short walk from the main beach area and they had lots of stuff you could rent. The fitness was a small room with 3 treadmills, 2-3 ellipticals and 1-2 bikes. A rack of free weights and 2 mats were the only other equipment. I spent one morning there and never went back. We had lunch at the main restaurant, Tavern and Town and we never went back. The server came to our table three times before she noticed I got up to get my wife and me our own napkins. The lunch selection was pitiful and the food was very salty. They serve the same menu at the Blue Bar, the pool bar. We didnâ€™t know Tavern and Town did not serve lunch until after we ate there. We didnâ€™t try room service as we didnâ€™t especially like the food. I will admit the Tavern was rocking most nights were passed by. The resort provided a shuttle at the top of the hour to Duval Street and a return ride at 20 minutes past the hour. They dropped you off and picked you up in front of Jimmy Buffettâ€™s Margaritaville bar. We hit up all the drivers for their favorite local restaurants and we ate at Turtle Krawl, Louieâ€™s, Carolineâ€™s and a couple of other places that were excellent. Ken was the best shuttle driver we had, while the others were also very knowledgeable and friendly. If you ask nicely, and tip, they would actually drive you to your destination, if time allows. For the non-runners, you can skip this part review. I did three 6 mile runs from the resort, located at US 1 and South Roosevelt Blvd, along South Roosevelt and past the airport, to Bertha Street and back. You could add several more miles along Bertha to Flagler or up to Duval and back along North Roosevelt to the resort. Bring your own water as there were no water fountains along the way and no stores to buy any as it was very hot and humid in August. South Roosevelt had lots of runners, walkers and bicyclists, even at 6 am. There was hardly any traffic on Sunday, but a lot on the weekdays so be careful of trucks, school buses and speeding mopeds. While there are many other people using the route after 7 am, I did see a couple of homeless people and it was pretty desolate at 6 am, so be careful. We a fun time searching for the best raw oysters (Turtle Krawl won hands down) and a great everyone knows your name place called Sweat Tea. We ate at Sweat Tea 5 times in one week, it was so good. It was the only place we went back to. Louieâ€™s is a bit off the beaten track, but not very far from Duval Street, and had a very romantic ambiance. We also ate at A & B Lobster House and we felt it was way over priced tourist trap. Better eats can be had downstairs in their causal location. Better prices and better food. We also ate at a family style Italian joint. I am still amazed at the serving size. The worst place we ate was a Subways (we were doing laundry and it was right across the street from the Laundromat) and Overdrive Bar. Both gave me an upset stomach. Overall, we enjoyed our stay eating and drinking our way up and down Duval Street. We probably will not stay at the Key West Beachside again as itâ€™s not really a true hotel and it lacked a lot of the amenities I would have expected for the price, value and the Marriott brand. We did choose it because of the Marriott brand and while it was a nice place, but it is simply not a true AAA 4 diamond rated resort we had expected.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: gigglebuke
Reviews.Content: I just stayed one night in the presidential suite before moving on to my final destination. The room was amazing and worth the few extra dollars from a regular room. The staff was great and the hourly shuttles to and from Duval St. were perfect. I also called for an airport shuttle pick up and the car was there in no time. There's a small little beachy area to sit on the water and relax. You can't jump in the water but it's a nice spot to see the sunset. I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JGB007
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to this hotel and I was once again impressed by the service, food and fantastic rooms. All in all, a wonderful four days.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: jbk999
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was small but had everything we could ask for. The beach was tiny but since few guests used it was just fine for us and had some fine areas to snorkel. The pool was also on the petite side but we could always find chairs. We stayed in a presidential suite which was huge except for the price.which was very reasonable for a 900 sq foot condo wth high end amenities, daily maid service and parking.
