The location was the only problem but we knew that going in and had a car to get us around. A similiar accomodation in old town Key West would have easily been double the price or more. So the inconvenience of driving to town wasn't too bad and the Marriott did have a free shuttle. I highly recommend and look forward to my next visit one of these days!! .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff - Just Needs to Be Closer to the Action!”
Reviews.Author: Harlin10
Reviews.Content: I have become accustomed to only expecting the best from Marriott properties and this locations did not dissappoint. The room was large and comfortable - top of the line. The staff was very helpful and professional. Dinner at the restaurant on the property was perfect. Had this hotel been closer to Duval Street - I probably would have extended my stay. My wife and I went to Key West to enjoy the water recreations during the day and to enjoy the restaurants and bars on Duval Street in the evening. Only problem with the Marriott was that the shuttle only left every hour to take us to Duval Street. We just happened to walk out of our room at 8:05 and just missed the shuttle. So we went to the restaurant to eat and wait for the next shuttle at 9pm. Just missed that too, so we got a taxi ($15) not a big deal. Went to the bars and realized that the last shuttle pick up to go back was 11:20. Now that i am older I can't stay out drinking as late as I used to but 11:20 is a little early. This is where the headaches begin - finding a taxi later took some time. When we finished our boat trip on Sunday evening and wanted to go back to change, we had just missed the shuttle and it took us 30 min. to get a taxi. Hungry and salty from being on the water all day, we were not happy waiting. We did stay one extra night, but at the Westin right off Duval Street. The convenience of the location made our vacation even that more relaxing. Marriott has the best of everything but the location is inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “man what a treat!!”
Reviews.Author: clydester
Reviews.Content: this is the second time i've stayed on key west. and this place was GREAT!! you will not be disapointed with your stay. you might be a little way from duval street ( a whole 20 mins!) but you can rent a scooter across the street,or have there shuttle bring you close to the action. then have a great time!!!!! once your done then come back and relax around the pool! you have got to order thier pina colada with a floater!! man it tastes like icecream!! the people at the hotel are super nice and helpfull. the bar help both at the pool and in the resteraunt where very nice and courtious as well. the room was very quaint and inviting, bathroom very big. i would like to try other spots but i bet you right now i will return to the marriott.. i hope this review is helpful to you in deciding where to stay i would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Floridagator
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is quite nice. The rooms are very well done and clean. My only complaint would be that the location is only so so. You can't walk to anything from this location - either cab or your own car. There is a hotel shuttle, but that was not real convenient for me. Overall a good experience. The hotel restaurant is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Nenes_11
Reviews.Content: We just spent two days in the Keys at Mariott Beachside. We had a Presidential suite. The main room was fine as well as the bath room. The second room was much smaller altough allright. But the second batromm was rather small. The room service was not good at all. We had to call two or three times to get a bottle of water! The swimming pool is far too small compared with the number of rooms. And the beach is just a joke. Tiny piece of sand - smelling, noisy ( just on the side of the main road) and for sure I wouldn't have a swim in this water. After we left I discovered that I had left a few clothes in the drawer of my room. I immediately called the hotel - which put me through with the lost &found. Guess? Nobody had found anything ... I insisted and asked them to check again but they kept saying they hadn't found anything . Everything has disapeared. I am really disappointed ... Marriott ? May be not tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Great venue for group activities”
Reviews.Author: Heartlandchaz
Reviews.Content: A week in May provided an excellent site for the Coconut Castaways to team with local members to raise money for kids with cancer. The hotel was welcoming and gracious, with suggestions for activities, dining and nearby events. The Marriott family of properties is one on which I can count for a predictably superior level of comfort. The Beachside was no exception.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpmoney
Reviews.Content: We had a problem at check-in but Robert (Manager) did a great job accomidating us and I would highly recommend his hotel and I will be back to visit soon. This is a beautiful hotel with GREAT ROOMS and a FANTASTIC restruant. I travel all the time as I am a Platinum Marriott rewards member. They also are one of the few level 7 hotels that do happy hour at the Pool Side Bar. Cant wait to go back!! Thanks again Robert and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Wish I went to Puerto Rico Instead”
Reviews.Author: Connecticutguy
Reviews.Content: So we were debating between Key West and Puerto RIco and decided on Key West. The Marriott Beachside is a nice hotel (my wife is VERY picky). the 1 bedroom suite we were in was great. sub-zero kitchen appliances, marble countertops, plenty of space, pull out couch for the kids. Lovely lovely room. The pool is nice and we had several fun days at the pool. WEnt to the hotel restrauant (Tavern 'n Town) for breakfast and it was great (although it was $63 + tip for 3 orders of pancakes and 1 omlette!!). The staff is nice and helpful. However, the hotel is on the other end of the island from most of the action or activities. It is a small island and they do have a shuttle (although in my opinion it wasn't convenient). The road to/from Duval Street is always backed up and slow. Parking is a bit of a hassle downtown. Overall I am a little bit disappointed with Key West. Not such a nice island and not "built up" well. Upscale amenities are lacking. There is a good amount of fine dining here and the watersports (fishing, sailing, parasailing, etc) are a big thing here. But beaches are definately lacking here. The Marriott Beachside is somewhat comical in that the beach can't be more than 20 yards wide and you cant go in the water here. The "big" beaches on the island also arent very "big" and they dont compare to some of the more well known beaches in the caribbean. also, key west is very pricey for dinning. I can't help but feel that Key West was not the best choice of summer vacation spots and that I should have gone to puerto rico instead.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! We'll be back :)”
Reviews.Author: allybabalove
Reviews.Content: This Marriott was SO easy to get to! We got here at about 8am and the allowed us to check in early (thank gosh) we were SO tired from our 2am drive down from Boca Raton. We had planned on volunteering at the Marine Mammal Conservancy in Key Largo, but was absolutely disgusted with their lack of hygiene at their facility, as well as once we heard how much pain and how extensively the whale was hurt (and that PETA was there boycotting) we immediately left and headed down to Key West. First of all, what a gorgeous drive on the overseas highway! Seeing the sunrise in the rear-view mirror and looking out across nothing but ocean was such a great way to spend the 2 hour drive.... We got to the hotel and went straight to the room. I like how even though there are outside hallways, you have to have a card key to access the elevator. Also, the door that you go into then has a private foyer with two room doors connected off of that. It made our room entry private and I can see how that would be great with a lot of luggage and having to deal with the elements! We had a king bed regular room. The room was great, it was a little small (especially compared to the Marco Island Marriott's rooms) but it was perfect for what we needed it for. The bathroom was decently sized and the whole room was very elegant in color and decor. The pool was regular sized and fine. The outside bar was nice and shaded, and the bartenders were always fast and mixed them pretty strong :). I LOVE the little bit of the beach that is right by the dock off of the pool...it was nice to walk all the way to the end of the strip of beach and just be secluded with one another under the shade of the cabana. Sigh,....just remembering sipping our mojito's in the sun :) BY FAR the best thing about our experience here at this Marriott was the excellent staff...everyone from the bartenders, pool staff, housekeeping (especially very nice!) and last but not least, KEN!!! If you stay at this hotel you HAVE to take their free shuttle into town to Deval street, simply because of the off-chance you MIGHT get the world's most loveable, passionate about life, simply amazing, your new grandpa (you wish) NICEST, friendliest, etc etc man named Ken. He is a shuttle driver for the Marriott that picks you up every hour from the hotel and picks you back up every 20ish minutes from Deval street. ANY SINGLE thing he tells you to do, GO DO!!! It was our first time in Key West, we had no clue what we wanted to do except the snorkeling bit, and we listened to Ken about every single place to eat, sightsee from, etc. He also tells a fantastic story as you're traveling with him all about the island. He mentions everything from the trees to the buildings to whatever else! We had the pleasure of listening to his tour on two different days and I was surprised (even though I shouldn't have been) when he did the exact same tour the second day. Only it was done with the same charisma and heart as the day before.....he is really one in a million, I can't say enough good things about Ken, he really MADE the trip for us. Such a wonderful once in a lifetime person!! Key West recommendations: We did Fury for the snorkeling and they were great! We did the two-reef stop and it was definitely worth it! They were both great snorkel (or scuba) locations and wasn't crowded at all. Also free beer (as much as you can drink) when you're done. Just make sure to bring cash for tips, trust me they deserve it! :) side note - I fell down three steps once we came back from snorkeling...be careful and hold on :) EAT AT ALONZO'S FOR HAPPY HOUR!!!! It's right on the dock, you can see cool boats, HUGE tarpin daily that flock to the docks to catch the fisherman's leftover scraps, people walking by etc. They have some pretty amazing food and their happy hour pricing is to die for! My boyfriend and I had 8 drinks (at least) and 5 appetizers for around $60 (unheard of in Key West)...all of it was fresh caught delicious seafood and strong drinks! HIGHLY recommend! Thank you again to all of the wonderful staff that really helped to make this such a special vacation for two older college students :)

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: MissymarGarner_NC
Reviews.Content: We have a family of 5, 2 adults, 3 teens. The 3BR accomodation here is great! It's on the beach, but not the greateast Key West beach front. Not very close by the outdoor 'shopping area' - Duval St. I'm a hotel snob & it was an absolutely beautiful room & extremely clean! If we were going, I'd definitely return to this hotel, but would try to get an oceanfront room. Our view was of the pool & courtyard area - you could see the top of the outdoor bar area though - not the greatest.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable option for staying in Key West”
Reviews.Author: ral999
Reviews.Content: The major drawback to this hotel is that it's not downtown and it's on one of the major roads leading into Key West. Other than that it's a reasonable option for your stay in Key West. Our room was comfortable and clean but definitely on the small side and had no view at all. If you want an ocean or pool view make sure you ask for it. And, although there is a beach, it's small and not well-used at least while we were there. On the plus side, the pool area is nice. There's a bar and the staff will bring drinks and meals to you. The food's good and is reasonably priced. The staff are very friendly - Robert in the bar in particular was great. The hotel compensates for its location by operating a free shuttle that leaves every hour on the hour. The pick-up is on Duval Street and the last pick-up is at 11:20pm. A cab ride from downtown costs $20. Parking is $17.50/day and you self-park in a covered garage close to your room. The hotel offers free Internet in rooms (unusual for a Marriott) and in common areas. The gym is just about adequate but suffers like many hotel gyms from not enough free weights that people actually use (i.e. 10lbs to 20lbs) and only one bench.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it and we WILL BE BACK!!!!”
Reviews.Author: je1058
Reviews.Content: Wow... What a GREAT place! This has become our FAVORITE hotel and the fact that it's a Marriott makes it all the better. The restaurant is AMAZING... Great bar, great food and very friendly staff. The rooms are beautiful with all stainless appliances in the suites... SubZero and KitchenAide are two of the brands they feature. This property also has a great pool, hot tub and poolside bar. It's located on the other side of the island from the "downtown Duval area" but they offer a free shuttle bus. Definitely worth staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Marriott”
Reviews.Author: liliam
Reviews.Content: Love Marriott Beachside. We have been going 3 to 4 times a year for the last 3 years...even before it was a Marriott. We always get a 1 bedroom suite...spend the extra money. It is worth it!!! Great pool, small but nice beach and free shuttle to downtown. I personally love the location because it is off the beaten path. Don't stay here if you want to walk to everything. The shuttle is so easy though. Good food, nice and friendly staff and watersports on property. Great establishment! :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lynney74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent three marvelous days in Key West and loved staying at the Key West Marriott Beachside Hotel! Our room was spotless, the amenities were numerous, and the staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. Within minutes of landing, we were picked up in the airport for the short ride to the hotel. I had requested early check in, and was pleasantly surprised to find that the room was ready at noon, especially since we had been up since 3:00 a.m.! We spent a relaxing afternoon at the pool and had a delicious lunch at the pool bar; they even bring your food and drinks to you, if you wish! Each evening we were there, we took the shuttle to and from Duval Street and enjoyed complimentary champagne while waiting. The drivers were very punctual, accommodating and friendly, and one evening when there wasn't enough room for everyone to get on, the driver hailed a cab to take the rest of us back to the hotel. Because it was just the two of us, we stayed in a standard room with a king bed. Although small, the room was beautifully appointed and we had plenty of space. After all, we didn't come to Key West to sit in a hotel room! As with all Marriotts, the bed was extremely comfortable. My only disappointment was that the room had absolutely no view. The description did say that it faced a walkway, but I didn't realize that there would be a wall on both sides and as a result, it was difficult to get phone reception. Nevertheless, we just slept there so it wasn't that big of a deal. We will definitely return to Key West and will stay at the Marriott Beachside Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room and view!”
Reviews.Author: mgorey828
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Key West. During the first five nights, we were treated to one of the nicest and most comfortable resort rooms. We were treated to a spectacular view and were able to enjoy our own Sunset Celebrations. Although it's a little far from the Duval area, there is a shuttle with a friendly & knowledgeable driver (the ride was enjoyable!) We were able to take a Wave Runner tour from the Marriott property that was a great deal of fun! Try the pizzas from the property's restaurant. - we ordered them two nights in a row ... thin crust & tasty. Having a well-stocked kitchen was also a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience, not Location”
Reviews.Author: missa019
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right off of highway one right when you enter Key West, it is NOT close to the center of town (Duval Street, Mallory Square, etc.) BUT did have a free shuttle that ran until 11pm that transported us to the center of town, which was VERY convenient. And the shuttle driver was AMAZING! It was like a free tour guide, because he pointed out important sights to see, great restaurants to eat at and was very knowledgeable! We did have to pay for parking at this hotel which was about $17 per night â€“ kinda steep! But Key West is NOT a driving town, so we had to leave our car somewhere! Our room was AMAZING! Clean, new and spacious. Absolutely no complaints about the accommodationâ€™s! The hotel has an amazing pool area, but NO beach. The water by the hotel is not very nice or clean and not swimmable. We chose this hotel because it was new, more affordable than other hotels that had better locations, had a free shuttle and free internet. Overall we enjoyed our stay, but if youâ€™re looking for something closer to the center of town and all the action, this would NOT be the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: TinaT68
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 5 other people; the accommodations were outstanding!! Our unit was immaculate...there was ample space, lots of parking, a free shuttle to take you to Duval street (on Saturday, the gentleman driving even provided us with a free tour of the island - EXCELLENT Tips of places to go & see were included) The pool was great; and there was also a little beach area where you could rent jet skis right there - awesome fun!! This is a great place to stay & I will stay there again for sure!! The restaurant, Tavern N Town, has THE BEST food. Their award winning dishes are wonderful...I am not usually a steak person, but I orderd the prime rib that night - it was THE BEST piece of meat I've ever eaten...ever!! I cannot say enough about this place!! Don't waste your time looking at other places...just book this one!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation property”
Reviews.Author: Illinoisgal29
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is on the opposite side of Key West from Duval Street. This is wonderful if you are looking for a quiet location as a get-away. It is only a 2-5 minute ride from the airport which is terrific. The Marriott's free shuttle will pick you up and return you to the airport when requested as well as take and pick you up from downtown every hour. A rental car is not necessary.This complex was originally built as condos, so as a result, the units are beautiful...high ceilings, lovely floors, deep tub, comfy bed, good air conditioning, pretty furnishings, etc .Outdoors there is a huge pool, a whirlpool, outside bar, small beach, and covered parking from the hot sun. Buildings are only 3 stories high and it is an easy walk between them. The restaurant/bar was very good. Marriott staff was helpful and gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, Great people, Great service.”
Reviews.Author: Iwest1
Reviews.Content: Incredible rooms, all staff went out of their way to accommodate us. My only criticism is with the Hotel name. While there is a sand beach, there is also a retaining wall and signs that say do not get in the water. If you are looking for a beach resort to let the kids ride the waves, this isn't it.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: LindsA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Key West Marriott Beachside Hotel for our honeymoon in October 2010. We got the room using Marriott reward points, so I don't recall the price of the room. The property was great, and our room was the largest hotel room (or rather "rooms") that I've ever stayed in. Our room included a full kitchen, dining area, living room area, balcony, bedroom, and bathroom, with a jacuzzi and shower. The space was larger than some of my friends' apartments in Manhattan. The hotel has a nice outdoor pool, hot tub, and bar. The only downside of the hotel that I can think of is the location. It isn't right in the heart of Key West, but the hotel provides a free shuttle bus for the short (about 10 minutes) ride to Duval Street. I would definitely stay here again if in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: HereOnHols
Reviews.Content: We didn't know until we checked in that all the standard rooms face the passageways. So the standard rooms are not that great, though the soft furnishings and bathrooms are nice - but the rooms are not large. For the standard room, at that price, I wouldn't stay there again. It's a nicely air conditioned box, really. We paid to upgrade to a one bed suite, which was lovely, and faced the water. The pool area is ok but not amazing and does smell a bit like lots of little kids have gotten a bit over-excited in it, by the end of the day. My husband went down at around eight am as well, and it hadn't yet been cleaned. The restaurant is pretty fancy looking and the service is good, but the food isnt worth the price. The entetainment is two people and a synthesizer, which seemed pretty retro. HOWEVER, staff are very helpful everywhere and there's nothing really wrong with this place, it's just bland and priced a little over the odds form what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the beach, but away from Duval Street”
Reviews.Author: LongboatKey1
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, some rooms have great views some do not, staff was very nice and pleasant. Only draw back is that Duval street is a little bit of a ways from the hotel. Some might like this more because the Marriott does not have the loud noise from the Duval crowds!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY IF YOU WANT RELAXATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: MimiThompson
Reviews.Content: We were so happy we didn't stay down on Duval Street with all the hustle and bustle. Exactly what we needed was some down time and quiet. Had a rental car, so we could come and go to Old Town whenever we wanted - only a 7 or 8 minute drive. 1 bedroom suite overlooking the pool was perfect. Very spacious and even had an extra half bath, full kitchen and laundry. Pool was gorgeous and service at the bar was great. We drank Dragon's Passion and was able to grab a secluded cabana. Would stay here again. Add on 1 or 2 more bedrooms if needed.

Reviews.Title: “A tropical poolside paradise”
Reviews.Author: jmacholl
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here last July also and the service was much nicer then. The hotel is beautiful and it's a wonderful place to stay, just a few things weren't up to par this time. We stayed in the 3 bedroom presidential suite which is amazing. The only complaint was the floors, they weren't cleaned very well even after housekeeping just left. But that's small potatoes. The thing that bothered me the most was the service. A little rude and inpatient this time. We spent a lot of money to get there and to stay there and a little more hospitality would have been nice. Needless to say, we would go back again, the hotel is just beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon location”
Reviews.Author: Texas2011a
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon in September 2010. As my new husband will attest, I am a loyal Marriott guest and picky when it comes to hotels, but LOVED this property. We used the road trip to Key West package so parking was free and included a $25 gas card. This was forgotten by the staff when we checked out, but a simple email to the hotel and one was mailed to us. Our 1 bedroom suite did not overlook the water but let's face it, the beaches in Key West are pretty bad anyway. It would have been nice to not face the air conditioning unit behind the pool bar, but as long as our balcony door was shut, we couldn't hear it. The suite was large, beautifully decorated and I can't ever remember being impressed by the kitchen and bathroom in a hotel - just beautiful. We also loved being at the quiet end of the island, away from Duvall Street. The restaurant was excellent and had some of the best snapper I've ever tasted. Make sure you try the key lime pie martini. If we come back to Key West, we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Vacation Spot!”
Reviews.Author: JulieOhio
Reviews.Content: We (28) of us, celebrated my husband's birthday in Key West. We absolutely loved the Marriott Beachside Resort, the staff were wonderful and accommodating, pool great, pool bar nice, and the restaurant was very good. We loved the suites! Large rooms, beautiful decor! The concierge was absolutely the best. Toni, was a wealth of information in picking tours and restaurants for such a large group. Key West itself offers enough for everyone; golfing, snorkling, deep sea fishing, great restaurants and bars, shopping and beautiful weather! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms but some pictures are deceiving"”
Reviews.Author: tabamoura
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and spacious, and furnished with nice pieces that truly demonstrate their concern with quality. The only problem is that the beach is not really a beach, but a 30 feet stretch of sand where they park a couple of dirty kayaks and 2 or three jet skis . The water looks dirty and it filled with seaweed. The rest of the waterfront is not for swming as there is 5 feet concrete wall drop . I even saw what I think its a grey water discharge pipe . Bottom line is that if you want a nice comfortable hotel and don't care about the private beach, this is for you . If you are looking to get wet in the blue waters of key west while in hotel grounds, look for other options. Also parking is $18 . They will not tell you . You will see it in your credit card later.

Reviews.Title: “Nice digs in Key West”
Reviews.Author: cmasse10
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, we could get used to staying here for long weekend getaways, our own kitchen, laundry, a two-level deck overlooking the water.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot off Duvall”
Reviews.Author: andreatCt
Reviews.Content: A VERY clean hotel and a GREAT pool and bar area. Shuttle leaves all the time for Duvall St. so there was no problem getting ther and back (10 min driven and you can see other interesting areas of Key West main areas, Great restaurant in Hotel , we ate the first night we got in since it was after 9 and the steaks were great! Nice wine selection too. Had a beach front room that was well appointed and had the most comfortable bed that we almost brought one (they sell them) but ours in only a few years old! and clean clean clean !!

Reviews.Title: “A Gulf view from Key West”
Reviews.Author: KeyWestTravelers
Reviews.Content: Our room was an extensive suite, furnished and decorated in a grand Southern style, both immaculately clean and providing all the comforts of your own apartment/condo. The view was spectacular ,overlooking the long walkout dock that provided lounge chairs to look out at the awesome Gulf of Mexico. Walking through the beautifully landscaped poolside and patio, we either sat in the sun, ate a delicious lunch at the outdoor bar or continued through to the hotel's entrance to catch the hotel's bus to town. Breakfast, evening cocktails with entertainment and dinner at the hotel's restaurant was consistently gratifying as well as the staff's manners and professionalism, from doorman to wait staff to housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “4th of July Fireworks from the rooftop terrace in my robe :)”
Reviews.Author: UofLtraveler
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to the Florida Keys and Key West. The island and this hotel left me with a great impression and I would definitely return. The hotel room was really great and any complaints are really just nitpicking. July 2 -5th, 2011 - July 4th weekend Room: It was awesome. We had a third floor room with a spacious balcony and spiral staircase leading to a rooftop terrace. 2nd floor has no extra balcony and 1st floor has spiral staircase leading you to pool (one guy had a few kayaks on his 1st floor balcony). You could set up an airbed with space to spare on this thing. I wish I had my grill. We were able to see Key West 4th of July fireworks wonderfully from there and if you turn around you could see them from other islands and of course from all the boats around the island. The 1 bedroom suite is giant. It has 1.5 bathrooms (great!), full kitchen (stove, oven, sub-zero fridge), 6 person dining table, L-shape couch w/sleeper, 2 modern tvâ€™s, huge whirlpool tub, giant shower, and WASHER/DRYER with detergent and dry sheets included. Kitchen has lots of little extras and has everything most people have at home. The room is beautiful and feels like the Caribbean and Key West. Itâ€™s modern and high end. All the furniture tops have glass which keeps them looking nice. The bed is super comfortable and the curtains can make the room pitch black. Bathroom has two robes, blow dryer, shower cap, mouthwash, soap, shampoo, conditioner, sewing kit, cotton balls, and q-tips. TV has a multimedia hook-up for HDMI and MP3 hook-up with cords. Big kids can bring their game system or your camera after being out all day. Thereâ€™s even an emergency flash light in the night stand. WASHER/DRYER in room was great. Our suitcase was packed on the way home with only clean clothes. I would have brought dirty clothes from home if I knew. The first day we didnâ€™t have as many toiletries until I spoke to house keeping in Spanish and then our towels were fan folded and room fully stocked. It only has some spots on walls where paint could be freshened up from probably guest suitcases and only some of the grout in the rooms needs bleach (nitpicking). The living room TV has digital channels but they are harder to find/manipulate so regular channels arenâ€™t as pretty. The room does have the â€œfoyerâ€� which other reviews have mentioned before entering your own room. This would be excellent if you book both rooms. Check-in/check-out: We booked a Presidential suite and arrived to Key West just before 1pm. We had requested early check-in but were told that the room and early check-in was not available as they were sold out the prior night. They requested my phone number to call when the room was finally available. We took this as an opportunity to do a loop around Key West and get some lunch. We were able to check in at about 3:30pm. The front desk was smooth and they delivered my very particular room request. Check-out was easy, too. Had to go to desk to get receipt. They keep fresh fruit at desk and water with cups. There is a sundry station for items to purchase. Parking: $17.50/night but our rate had free parking and a $25 gas card on check out. We actually only used the rate for 2/3 of our nights but got free parking all night. There is PLENTY of actual hotel parking as there are garages under the actual hotel buildings (1st floor) and there is a 3-story lot that most people miss next to the lobby/main building. We never moved our car after it was parked. Itâ€™s covered parking in sunny/rainy Florida which is nice. Exterior of property: You have to use your room key to activate the elevator which is fine for safety but annoying when your hands are full or are in a rush. The elevator is â€œoutsideâ€� and not in a builder interior so itâ€™s hot and humid â€“ nothing new. The halls are outside and the entire property seemed well-lit and very nicely kept. Pool: The pool has a great view of the water and plenty of chairs and several cabanas which went generally un-used by most when we were there. The chairs were about 80% full. The pool didnâ€™t have too many people in it so it was pretty nice. There were a couple of kids on the other end but it didnâ€™t bother me. They is gravel mulch around a palm tree that guests unfortunately like to throw their cigarettes in and that part of the pool smells like an ashtray. I did see the pool guy picking butts out every morning, though. I could see where about 15 more people could have made the pool area no fun. The beach is for sunning. There is a nice pier with chairs out to lounge out in. There is about 10-15ft of usable beach by the jet skis. I was able to kick around in it and then go back to the pool. This is not a â€œbeachâ€� hotel as all the reviews already say. Internet: Free wi-fi at the pool and in the lobby. Free WIRED internet in your room ï�Œ. I canâ€™t comment on speeds since I had wi-fi only devices. Oh well, I went to the lobby business center and printed out directions and receipts for a charter. They have a laser printer which was nice and fast. Extras: It looked nice. One of the waiters was super helpful and gave me a cup of olive oil for me to use and cook in our room. I didnâ€™t actually eat there. Very nice of them! The shuttle leaves promptly on the hour. They can call a cab if you miss it. We always made it on the shuttle back and at times they had two shuttles and at times lots of people were left behind. So itâ€™s hustle and bustle to get on it. At this point in my life if I know Marriott can really drop the ball when it comes to town and airport shuttles â€“ so always have cab fare.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room; nice property”
Reviews.Author: DCMANYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroom suite with family and I couldn't have asked for a better set up. Each bedroom had its own bathroom and the common areas were spacious and attractive. We also had our own steps down to the pool, which was very convenient. The shuttle is a great service, and the drivers may drop you off where you would like if it's not crowded. The taxi services were also very quick and a decent value, although the taxi stock is pretty shoddy when you compare it to other cities. Like other guests, I would note that the hotel is on the water, which has sand in front of it, but I would not really classify it as a beach. This was more like a hotel than a resort, but it was still great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful suites, dont expect a "beachside"”
Reviews.Author: tmunsie
Reviews.Content: We visited Key West for the first time in late June 2011, it was the second half of a two week honeymoon. We had never been to key west but, similar to others, had heard great reviews from family and friends so decided to visit. One thing to tell all prospective travelers - There are NOOO beaches worth a dime anywhere in Key West... We had hoped when booking this "beachside" hotel that we would be getting a beach?? no such luck, there is a bit of sand on a seawall - and a "no swimming" sign clearly posted. We were sent to another beach towards Duval "Fort Timothy??" something like that, dont waste your time with this place. The water is disgusting there, and you cant walk barefoot on the sand it is so rocky. Besides this, the atmosphere in Key West was great fun - amazing restaurants (highly recommend the rooftop cafe on front street) . The hotel itself has a great pool, and the poolside bar and staff were great as well. There seemed to be quite a few families staying there, so if kids in the pool bother you - you may want to look elsewhere as the pool was mobbed by kids most of the day. The suites were incredible.. When we first checked in we were put in a standard King room - we promptly upgraded as these rooms have a small window looking out to the stairs, but were incredibly happy with the suite - full kitchen, huge balcony, jacuzzi, etc. Im not sure if we will travel to key west again, most likely will spend the extra money to go to Aruba or somewhere with beaches - however if we do visit again, we would be more than happy to stay at the Marriott for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Tkutkl
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort and the only thing we would have changed was the length of our stay! The one bedroom suite was amazing, the concierge Joe was great and the shuttle to Duvall was a nice addition since we didn't have a car! One little complaint- the female concierge really could use sone work on her people skills- we called to check the weather prior to our departure to decide if we wanted to schedule a massage in the cabana and her response was- "sorry, I don't understand your question" then when we arrived late (flight delay) at one in the morning we asked the gentleman at the front desk to cancel the massage as we wanted to sleep in, he said he would but I still had my husband call at 8:00 that morning to speak with the concierge but he couldn't get anyone to pick up so he called the front deal who again said the would let the concierge know. At 8:45 our phone rang and it was the female concierge waking us up to tell us to meet the massage therapist at the cabana in an hour... We did not ask for a wake up call and had cx the reservation and when we informed her of this she was not pleases stating the massage therapist had started driving down the island to the hotl and we were creating a problem. My husband was livid but I managed to calm him down and did not let that ruin our trip! Stay away from the female conceirge and you should have an AMAZING time at this stunning resort!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service, views & rooms!”
Reviews.Author: stiletto19
Reviews.Content: Awesome place! When we arrived, they upgraded us from our 2-bedroom suite to a 3-bedroom suite with a great view of the pool & ocean! They were helpful with everything, including getting us to places that were not on the shuttle route! ;) We booked online & were able to secure free drink vouchers from Blue Bar with a "package" deal....awesome Mango Mania frozen drink! Go! Now!

Reviews.Title: “Love this Marriott”
Reviews.Author: floridatraveler1996
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Key West and I have to say this hotel set the tone for my visit. The staff was very accommodating with my requests - directions, late check out, etc.... I have to say I was a little surprised about the exterior corridors and was apprehensive about what my room would look like. But once I entered my room, I loved the decor, it was inviting and tasteful and not over the top with "Florida Decorations". The colors were soothing after a long drive and I would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Sunset View From The Hotel Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TOURtheWORLDMexPal
Reviews.Content: I read the few previous reviews on this hotels from my fellow travelers, actually they may be correct of their impressions, anyhow, I already lowered my expectations toward Key West overall and I visited this area to find out what the big fuss about it, and the result that Key West is not one of my favorite spots to spend a vacation there. Go back to the Marriott hotel, the best thing at this hotel was the view from the room. For me to guarantee a good view to see the beautiful breathtaking sunset, I had to stay at a presidential suite with high floor. I did get what I paid for. The sunset in Key West was the highlight of our visit to the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “"Nice Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: boundlesstraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. The room we stayed in was really nice with great views and it was really clean. The only downside is the beach is really small and its pretty much overtaken by a jet ski rental company. But very nice overall. Just get wireless internet in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property. Great Suite. Less than Excellent Service and Commitment to Guest Satisfaction..”
Reviews.Author: Pabby317
Reviews.Content: I planned a 24th anniversary trip to the hotel. My wife and I spent a long weekend there, June 10-13, 2011. I am a very loyal Marriott Rewards Platinum Elite member, so I used points for our stay. The cost is 100k standard points for a small single bedroom with absolutely no view for three nights. I upgraded to a gulf view one bedroom suite for an additional 60k in points. Initial impressions were fantastic: elegant lobby, beautiful suite with 10 ft ceilings, marble floors, balcony, etc. The restaurant is great. We knew the hotel was a few miles from Duval Street when we booked it, so we knew what we were getting into logistically. Now here starts the downside: The front desk staff at check-in did not disclose that there was a $17 per day parking fee. I did not find out until I checked out. The hotel has no access controls in place for the small pool. It was very apparent that the staff gladly accepted locals in the small pool area with no priority given to hotel guests. The locals also parked for free in the spaces that the hotel guest had to pay for on a daily basis. Also non-hotel guests who dined in the property's fine restaurant parked their vehicles in spaces in which guests paid a premium. My wife and I came back to the hotel after diner downtown on Saturday night, and we could not find a parking space for at least 15 minutes. Early on Sunday, the event staff at the hotel removed half of the pool umbrellas for a wedding reception. Shade was now at an unexpected premium. Also all day long, the beach was inaccessible for sun-bathing/ palm tree shade due to a wedding set-up that was utilized for two ceremonies throughout the day. I am incredibly disappointed that our enjoyment of the property was compromised by the lack of proper equipment (umbrellas) for their event planning. I have never been at a Marriott Rewards Category 7 hotel that had such little concern for the quality of the stay for their guests. Later in the afternoon on Sunday, My wife and I experienced something we have never experienced before. Many of the members of the wedding party from the morning were drunk and playing games such as chicken in the pool. One of the drunkards defecated in the pool. So the pool was shut down and yellow "crime scene" tape was laced around the perimeter of the pool. That was awful. What also disappointed me is that one would expect that the hotel staff would had stepped up and found ways to accommodate guests that were significantly inconvenienced. I requested to speak to a manager upon check-out on Monday morning, and was told by the reception desk person that none was available. I was also told that I would be able to share my comments/criticism in a survey that I would receive after my stay. I haven't gotten it yet. Final thought: I could (should?) have spent similar points at a JW Marriott or Ritz Carlton tropical resort property and the management staff would not have accepted less than a wonderful guest experience for my wife and me. I will be back to Key West. I will not be back to this property unless the management steps up and commits to an overall excellent guest experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_Traveller954
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice and clean. I have stayed here on more than one occassion, and would certainly return. The pool is nice, with good service. The hotel is actually on the island of Key west, but still a few miles from the center of Old Town, which is what more people go to Key West for. The hotel shuttle bus into town is convenient and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Restaurant..”
Reviews.Author: AHFox
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, manmade "beach".. Had a 1 bedroom unit - full kitchen, washer & dryer - actually more like a condo than a hotel. At the very edge of Key West, right at the entrance - you are quite a distance from all of the goings-on and tourist attractions. I believe the hotel offers a shuttle, we didn't use it as we had our car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: OliviaMG
Reviews.Content: Please keep in mind this hotel is on the other side of the island- so you will not be near the main strip (Duval). However, the hotel does provide free shuttle service to the strip and other hot spot areas. Very helpful! The hotel has a gorgeous beach front and pool area. Our hotel room was a bit of a jot to the front desk as well as pool area. Food at the lounge was awesome. Breakfast is a must. Rooms were nice, bed was not so cozy. Bathroom was a nice size; shower is a walk in type, no tub. Free internet.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Suites!”
Reviews.Author: KRLyons
Reviews.Content: The nicely decorated 1 bedroom suites, were spacious and clean. We liked the 2 level terrace, for lounging on the rattan chairs. The staff were gracious and accommodating. Key West attractions we enjoyed were the trolley tour, Mallory Square and we had a great meal at the Roof Top Cafe. The healthy breakfast buffet at the hotel, had homemade granola, which was delicious. We would definitely stay at this hotel again, if we were in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms-a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: onefortheroad_d
Reviews.Content: First time to Key West and stayed here using Marriott points. Room was stunning. Waterfront view, 2 balconies, huge living room/dining room/kitchen. 1 1/2 baths--jacuzzi tub and spacious stand up shower. Shuttle service to Duval was nice but would have been nicer to have been within walking distance. Shuttle back to hotel at night was full of rowdy drinkers. Received breakfast passes since I'm a Rewards member-it only included fruit/bread area--not even the usual Marriott powdered eggs--that section was $4 extra per person.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: JGrice822
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, we upgraded to a 1br beachfront suite & it was worth it. The suites are much larger & have full kitchens & balconies. Everything about the hotel is first class & the restaurant on site Tavern N Town is delicious. We dined there for breakfast most days & dinner one evening when we didn't feel like making the trip downtown. The hotel is set at the entrance to Key West not far from the airport & a shuttle is available every hour to drop off or pick up on Duval St. There is a small beach although not a swimming beach & very nice pool. Staff was superb & my wife & I scheduled a jet ski tour that left from the hotel & encircled the entire island. We have stayed at many properties in Key West & this is the nicest. We are already talking about trying to get a group trip together for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: mse139
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, probably one of the nicer ones in Key West. Hotel has a free shuttle downtown (very convenient), which saves parking/walking. Suite was huge, with a nice kitchen and dining area. Bed was very comfortable. Room was very clean. We had a 3rd floor suite, so it had a balcony plus a stairway to a rooftop patio. We were towards the back of the block, but could still see some water from our rooftop patio. Housekeeping was very nice and thorough. You do have to pay for parking and there is no free wi-fi. Restaurant was very good, my wife had the pork loin and I had the prime rib. Both were cooked to perfection and very tasty. Prices were very comparable to some of the restaurants on Duval Street and the food tasted much better. We went on a Sunday night, so it wasn't busy. Service was excellent. Dress code is casual, even though it looks more formal (everything is casual in the Keys). We both wore shorts and a nice shirt. We would stay again if we visit Key West again. They do offer a AAA discount, so take advantage if you can.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will be back with our husbands.”
Reviews.Author: sisters2011
Reviews.Content: We loved our room, which was a 3 bedroom Presidential Suite, what's not to like. The service was incredible, we did not experience one problem. We dined at the hotel one night, and the food was amazing. Ocean view from the pool - A+ and we had a ball taking a midnight swim. Easy to get to the action, free shuttle service there and back. The hotel is in a great location, accessible to the town, but far enough away from the noise if you wanted to just relax. All ready planning next years trip, can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Serious Problems”
Reviews.Author: slapjac
Reviews.Content: We reserved a waterfront suite at the Key West Marriott with 2 co-workers who wanted to get away for the weekend. We had been on the road for the week prior and chose the Marriott because it had a room with a kitchen and washer & dryer. The Front Desk agent didnâ€™t have our reservation and told me that we were at the wrong hotel. After showing her the reservation, she disappeared in the back office for 20 minutes. The Front Desk manager came out and explained that they had not prepared for our arrival and was sold out except for a â€œstandard king roomâ€�. After checking in, the room assigned to us had one bed and was so small, it barely fit the bed. The window had a view of a hallway. Altho tiny, the interior was quite nice and was the typical quality of a JW Marriott. There were some obvious challenges with three guys, so we went back to the front desk, spoke with the unsympathetic front desk manager, who told us we were on our own. I asked if they would be able to help us at least wash our clothes, but told us that she was not responsible for providing an â€œamenityâ€�. This experience ruined the trip and we were forced to spend another week on the road without any clean clothes. We caught fish on a chartered boat, but were unable to cook them because there was no kitchen. One of the guys with us had to sleep on the floor of the bathroom because the room was so small. Overall, I highly recommend booking at the Hyatt Windward Point. Over the last 3 times staying there, we didnâ€™t have any problems and the staff actually cares.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: SteviebTampa
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel, very comfortable, great food, nice pool, beautiful views. for such a wonderful hotel I was surprised that the floor was so dirty, we went bare foot and our feet were black!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not a category 7”
Reviews.Author: AA75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel just for one night and didnt want to leave! The room was spacious with a priceless view of the laguna. We sat on the balcony for a couple of hours just watching the sunset. We really liked our room and the fact that the hotel provides a free shuttle to the Duval street area. A couple of problems, we tried to find out about a dry cleaning service and were transferred a couple of times to different operators including a restaurant???? we finally just gave up. I called the concierge around 5 PM to get a suggestion for a restaurant and to make a reservation, I left a voice mail but never heard back. To summarize, great hotel but the service needs some improvement....

Reviews.Title: “wonderful- fantastic -but no beach”
Reviews.Author: ljdcom
Reviews.Content: Marriott does it again! Great spacious oversized suites with room to spare, full kitchen , living room, dining room, one and half baths and a washer dryer ! ALL Beautifully appointed! The veranda/balcony was huge! Every attention to detail was thoughtfully made. Tavern restaurant was slightly loud but the Prime rib was exceptional and the other menu items were top quality and reasonably priced for a resort hotel. Pool area was lovely and large with room for adults and kids without being on top of each other.pool service for drinks was quick ! IF you are looking for a hotel with a beach then think again this is a big misnomer there IS NO BEACH! Matter of fact Key West doesnt really have any nice sandy beaches , a few ROCKY ones but not the type you would expect in florida. . Just make sure you spend the extra bucks for a resort or gulf view suite. because the hallway view is slightly a step above a cheap motel . Odd for a Marriott but i dont think this hotel started out as a marriott. I would stay again and again.. and would recommend to everyone. We had a first floor suite which had circular steps down to the pool area from the veranda which was very convenient (dont try them after a few drinks ) Marriott also provides a free shuttle downtown to Duval St every hour on the hour which is wonderful because parking is non existant in town. also directly across the street is the Conch train which offers another option for getting downtown. The concierge also recommended the BEST dolphin experience WILD about DOLPHINS. A MUST TO DO ! Best dolphin experience in the KEYS! All in all would highly recommend to anyone, Whether it be for a family vacation , couples or singles not cheap but WELL worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is very nice”
Reviews.Author: NewlywedsMay28
Reviews.Content: Don't let the outside of the hotel fool you. This is a very nice hotel. Although all rooms don't offer a beachside view, the hotel rooms are very nice and very clean. The staff is very helpful and the nicest people I've met in a long time while on travel. As other guest stated, if you don't have a oceanside view or a poolside view, you may have a street view, which was great for us because we didn't go there for the view of the room, but more for the cleaniness of the rooms and service. The restaurant on property is EXCELLENT, the food is great. I will definetely go back to this hotel. Also there is golf course about 5 mins away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - Can't wait to Return Next Year!!”
Reviews.Author: TravlinStarre
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from the Marriott and we had a wonderful stay - the service here is impeccable; a special 'Thanks' to Brian B - pool manager - thanks for the complimentary drinks! We upgraded our room for $50.00 a night to a 1 bedroom suite which was well worth the money, it was beautiful, clean & had a wonderful view of the grounds & ocean (room 336B)....we did rent a car, but - on occasion would use the shuttle which was quick & always on time....we ate at our usual places; Schooner Warf, while enjoying Michael Mcloud & Two Friends (happy hour)....and, of course Bagatelles for breakfast~ Don't hesitate to stay at this hotel, it's immaculate & the staff couldn't be any more accommodating.....see you next year!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT WASTE YOUR POINTS”
Reviews.Author: crazyzeus1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in NO WAY a Category 7 that they claim to be. While the hotel room itself is fair, the property is more like a motel property. My husband is a Lifetime Platinim Elite Marriott member, & he was given a room that (no kidding) looked right into a WALL. Three feet away. They call this a "walkway view" or something similar, but you could see nothing except a wall. The pool is a sad little motel pool (NOT a Category 7 resort pool for sure!), there is no beach to speak of. We have stayed at beautiful Category 6 hotels in Hawaii & Cancun and expected something similar. This hotel would have been acceptable if they claimed a Category 5 status, but to waste SO many points on a motel is insane. We cecked in, and checked out 30 minutes later. Went down the road to the Fairfield which went out of their way to accomodate us. It's a sad statement when the Fairfield has a WAY better pool, grounds, staff, etc. There are many other places to stay in Key West that are a better value for your money/points.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT "Take the lower star ratings here very seriously."”
Reviews.Author: ORDmiaSYDhnlFLL
Reviews.Content: We were in Key West this week for a very quick pleasure trip. We stayed in a King room the first night and it was gorgeous. Those rooms do not have a view, but you know that before you book (described on their website as an OPEN AIR WALKWAY VIEW). If you stay in Marriott properties often, you will recognize the King room as JW Marriott quality. As to it being a "tiny closet", the room is 400 square feet. On the second night, we asked the front desk to upgrade us to a I BR Presidential Suite with a Gulf view. $100 later we were there. It was 953 square feet. We were able to have a phenomenal dinner at our 6-seat dining table that night (stone crab, oysters, shrimp, cuban bread, key lime pie and spinach salad) I wold never celebrate my 15th anniversary there, but for the 14th or the 16th - I WILL BE THERE.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Parenttravel46
Reviews.Content: The Key West Marriott Beachside is a wonderful hotel. We had a 3 bedroom suite which was perfect for the 5 people in our party. The room was clean and spacious. The kitchen was beautiful and the beds were so comfortable. Each room had a television which limited fighting over the remote. The only complaint we had was the water pressure in the shower was virtually non-existent. Rather than cooking in our kitchen, we ate at the hotel restaurant for breakfast each day and for dinner one night. The breakfast was delicious. It was expensive though. The food was fresh and the service very good. The dinner was excellent. In fact, it was the best meal we had in Key West. The food was delicious and served fresh and hot. The Key Lime pie was outrageous. The food was a bit expensive, but well worth it. The pool area was also beautiful. No problem except for some people smoking. I thought the whole hotel was smoke- free. The beach is very small for swimming. However, it was enough to get your feet wet. The beach was nice for sitting and reading. We rented a paddle board at the beach which was very reasonable. The hotel also has jet ski excursions that leave right from the beach two or three times per day. They were expensive and the tour covers 27 miles of ocean in 2 hours. There was plenty of seating at the pool and there were many areas on the beach that were private and quiet. While the hotel boasts that they have cabanas, I did not see anyone use them. All in all, i would highly recommend this hotel. While it is a 10 minute drive from town, the hotel provided a very nice air-conditioned shuttle back and forth to Duval Street. Most people seemed to take advantage of the shuttle. The hotel is right as you enter Key West, but it was nice at night to be in a quiet area of town. Be weary though the hotel is on a very busy corner. We did hear traffic noise while outside on our balcony even though we faced the water. We did not hear any noise when all the doors and windows were closed other than a passing loud siren on occasion. Highly recommend this jewel in Key West

Reviews.Title: “Our tiny room has a view onto the hallway and is so small that we have called it the "maid's quarters".”
Reviews.Author: pollydct
Reviews.Content: My birthday gift---a getaway to Key West. Cried when I saw our tiny room the "maid's quarters". What architect in his/her right mind would design a hotel in a beach resort with rooms looking out onto a hallway. We expected a balcony and lovely views. Instead we look out on a lighted (at night) outdoor hallway. We will NEVER return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: KNUCCI
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and well appointed. The staff was amazing. Unfortunately it is on a busy strip of the major road in Key West near gas stations and a Dennys.

Reviews.Title: “I will return”
Reviews.Author: BasementOffice
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 just finished spending 5 nights at this hotel and we loved it. We had an ocean view suite with an adjoining room for me, my wife our two kids age 11 and 12. The suite was beautiful, marble floors, full kitchen and great views from the balcony. The kids having their own room and a combined 3 bathrooms for the 4 of us made life easy. Also the room configuration of a main entrance door and then entry doors for the adjoining room and the suite was a very good thing. I could keep the main entrance door locked for security and the suite door open for peace of mind. I could also close the kids door when I needed to. The layout really worked for us. Check in was quick and eventless as it should be even though we arrived a bit early. We used the hotel pickup service and waited only about 10 minutes which gave us a chance to enjoy the sun. The driver; Joseph was very pleasant and also gave us a ride downtown during the week when the shuttle was off hours. Housekeeping was very accommodating and patient with our schedule. The shuttle makes life easy for getting to Duval St and the schedule works fine especially if you have spent the day at the pool, or FT Zachary Beach or jet skiing etc.,. In the evening I didnâ€™t feel like driving in to town and definitely didnâ€™t want to drive back to the hotel after dinner so it was great to have the shuttle service. As for the pool, it was pretty much like any resort/hotel pool. People stake claim to chairs early and if you get there too late it is a struggle but we have seen this all over the world. I only had good experiences with the pool wait staff and we enjoyed the food and drink, especially the blackened mahi mahi sandwich. As one commenter has said there was an incident with an obnoxious group of guests that were disruptive and hotel management should have dealt with the situation better. Personally I didnâ€™t care about them and played catch with my son but it is true at a resort like this profane and obscene drunken behavior is unacceptable, especially as there were many families with children at the pool at the time. Hotel management you must do a better job responding to and removing this behavior in the future. I know that hotel management reads these reviews so hopefully you are instituting the appropriate procedures. Aside from the single noted incident we enjoyed the pool without issue for the week. Key West is an island that sits on hard coral rock so all Key West beaches are manmade. The onsite beaches were similar to other Keys resort beaches we have stayed at and did the job when you wanted a change of pace from being poolside. As for the wedding related beach closures the kids and I walked the beaches almost up until the actual ceremonies without any issues. Nothing gets a 12 year old girls attention like a beach wedding so we loved that they happened while we were there. If you really want to be on a beach there are a few Key West options and we enjoyed the day at Ft Zachary Taylor Beach and the kids and I loved snorkeling all day and the rented electric car to get there. We rented from a stand across the street from the hotel, the guys working there were great and the only negative is crossing the busy street but it was like crossing any busy street and something we only needed to do a few times so it wasnâ€™t an issue. Also onsite is a rental/activities hut that runs a 2 hour jetski island tour. I highly recommend you do this and early in your stay. We did this on our last full day and I regretted waiting so long. Had I known how much fun it was we would have done it more than once. We really enjoyed our stay here, in fact last night a friend asked my opinion on this hotel for his family and I told him he would love it. As the locals say Key West is a drinking town with a fishing problem so you have to be aware of that when you visit with children, this place is not Disneyland. For us being able to enjoy Duval St for a few hours and then retreating back to the hotel before the late night insanity began worked great. I will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel - Roomy & Elegant”
Reviews.Author: jonwalkertravel
Reviews.Content: Our group of 4 consisted of myself (15) my brother (18) and my parents who are in their 40's. Maid service came at least once a day, sometimes twice, always at the best times where we were never in the room. The pool, pool deck and jacuzzi were amazing too. My family went on a jetski tour around the entire island and visited many places like the Southernmost Point of the Continental United States, the military bases and local hotspots and manmade beaches. We also took the educational trolley tour around the entire island being talked to by experts on the history of this island which, at first didn't seem fun for teenagers like me, but was interesting and fun. Many other excursions were available (just ask the concierge who were extremely personable and helpful), and an hourly shuttle into town to the original Margaritaville where there are endless restaurants and shopping opportunities (shuttles transported people back to the Marriott 20 minutes after each hour). The nightlife was incredible as well with local bars, restaurants, art galleries, and more! My step dad who was on a Rambler (walker) because he shattered his heel weeks prior to the trip maneuvered perfectly because of the roomy rooms, easy elevator access, and in general very handicap accessible environment. The service at the pool was amazing, and awesome drinks (my parents said!) and incredible lunch and appetizers. Town & Tavern which is the restaurant right in the lobby of the hotel is an incredible, elegant and formal steakhouse at night, and a fabulous casual breakfast buffet by morning. The beds were the best, free WiFI internet, and huge stainless steel refrigerator and kitchen appliances, which was essential for keeping our drinks and leftovers. This hotel has got to be one of the best hotels in Key West. This rivals a suite that I stayed at in Mandalay Bay Resort & Casino, Las Vegas! Wonderful and enjoyable for everyone and HIGHLY recommended.

Reviews.Title: “No worth the points or the price”
Reviews.Author: Shuffles48
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at Marriott hotels and resorts many times and have never had such an experience. The standard rooms are so small and there is no place to sit except on the bed or in one very uncomfortable old chair. We were told by the staff they could not do anything about it. Were told we could upgrade when we arrived, but then told none were available when we did arrive. The pool area is nice, but you have to walk through the parking garage to get to it. Also, people behaving badly at the pool are simply ignored by the hotel staff so, your only alternative is to leave the area rather than endure it. The king-sized bed in our room was uncomfortable and had a hole in the mattress on one side and my husband had to sleep on a pillow to be comfortable. We both returned home with aching backs. The restaurant was very nice and the food excellent. The parking fees are a little much, especially when you consider the value of the entire experience. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone going to Key West for an enjoyable week. Definitely not a "true Marriott experience"!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but limited access to a limited beach, kiddie pool needed”
Reviews.Author: bella3207
Reviews.Content: We just finished a week here, and our suite was beautiful. It was ocean front, with a full deck. Full kitchen, sub zero appliances, and overall very roomy. The noise form the adjoining room was almost non existent. Flat screens, marble floors and baths. The whirlpool wasn't very clean, so we didn't use it. Our maid service was prompt, with turn down service each evening. The staff here was very friendly, especially the bellmen and the shuttle drivers. The 10 min ride to Duvall St, was not an issue. We liked being away from all of the noise, and drinkers. Our hotel was on a man made limited beach. We checked in on Wednesday, and by Friday, we couldn't use the beach because of weddings the entire weekend. There's only one pool, so everyone was either on top of each other, or shuffled to the back of the building, where there was no air, or shade. It was over 90 degrees. Since the weddings were at 7 in the evening, there was no need to make everyone leave the beach area before noon. It was a major inconvenience. The pool area was taken over by kids. Screaming toddlers, overbearing guests, strollers, no chairs, not enough umbrellas, and arrogant pool attendants. I had one that spoke with a Carribean accent that insisted on telling me where to sit, because he did not want to move an umbrella to the chairs that I selected. He reluctantly moved one, but he had no right to dispute my choice. The wait staff at the pool was prompt, but limited at times. This hotel needs another pool for children. If you want peace and quiet, you won't find it at this hotel pool. You will be at the mercy of screaming kids, all day long. I could not make this up. You couldn't hear yourself think at times, and it felt like the walls closing in around us, outside. If you did not claim a chair by 9 AM, good luck. Guests were keeping towels overnite, and putting them on the chairs at 8 AM, before the towels were available. I knew this because I could see them from my suite. This is a poorly run system around this pool. And the man made beach should not be reserved so early in the day for 30 people, making it inconvenient for an entire hotel filled with paying guests. This isn't fair period. The web site should alert guests ahead of time, that the weekends are dedicated to weddings, and there is no access to the limited beach during that time. My husband complained, and we were compensated, because we had some additional issues. Overall, we loved our suite, the staff, and the hotel. But peace, quiet, and a nice beach was not found here. I will return to Key West, but not this resort. We like to relax without rushing to get pool chairs every morning, not listening to screaming kids all day long, having access to a real beach, having more than one pool, having polite pool attendants that understand and speak English without an attitude, have a kiddie pool for children only, have enough chaise lounges, and give the same amount of consideration to all guests, and not special consideration for the small wedding parties. And finally, the housekeeping staff needs to pay attention to keeping whirlpool tubs clean. They are a bedding ground for germs, and ours was filthy. Oh, and I will be sharing my comments on Facebook, because I have many friends that travel to the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Yet”
Reviews.Author: Allerit
Reviews.Content: We went during bike week, a busy time of year. The check-in was fast and easy. The room was extremely clean and the hotel was quiet. Staff was friendly and courteous. Although the location is a distance away from Duval Street, the rest of the accommodations made up for it. We still brag to our friends that this is, by far, the best vacation we've ever taken.

Reviews.Title: “Take the lower star ratings here very seriously.”
Reviews.Author: shutterblog
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this room from April 15-17 for our 15th anniversary. We did so using a F&F voucher from a good friend who is management at a Ritz Carlton a couple of hours from where we live. Wish we'd have just went to his hotel instead! Even making reservations weeks in advance of our date, and calling the hotel separately to let them know it was a 15th anniversary, when we arrived any hopes of a romantic "beachside" vacation were soon dashed. A few comments down a poster mentions "If not for the name 'beachside', I would have had no idea this place was near the water". Truer words were never spoken! This is truly a tale of two hotels. If you book here, get it in blood that you will have a water-view room. We just assumed that like most hotels, no matter what your actual view, if you strain you'll eventually see water. What did we see from our window? In the first room we saw a covered walkway about 3-feet across - and directly in front of that, as far as you could see 8-10 feet in either direction was more stucco. No natural sunlight whatsoever. The room was tiny and depressing. Even the "happy anniversary" card and Godiva chocolates waiting on the night table could not bring a smile to our face. We started to look around for a mini-fridge -- we live in Florida -- we expect mini-fridges on our beach vacation to be standard (especially at a hotel of this price). Nothing. After an 8+ hour drive to the Keys we were thirsty and tired, so my husband set off to find a Coke machine. Guess what? No Coke machine. He ended up going through buildings and the pool area and eventually to the main lobby before he found anything to drink. I thought at one point that I might never see him again. While he was gone, because I'm paranoid about bed bugs, I lifted back the sheets and fitted sheet. I didn't find bed bugs but I found hair all over the mattress cover and fitted sheet. GROSS! We were not in a "make due" situation here. Even at a F&F rate we were spending hundreds of dollars (pre-paid) and it was our FIFTEENTH ANNIVERSARY. My husband finally got back in the room with our Cokes, exhausted, only to find out I wasn't about to sleep on that bed. So he called the front desk to complain not only about the hair -- but the room size, view, and the fact we were spending our anniversary like this. We were told they were booked up and we'd be getting transferred to the same room. A bellhop would be right over with keys. Whatever. A HALF-HOUR later my husband called back to the front desk. We had watched the entire Nightly News cast and had yet to receive replacement keys. We didn't exactly want to hang out in a hairy room. They finally showed up about 10 minutes later and moved us to another room. Again, no mini-fridge. Great. We got everything situated, assured ourselves this bed was clean, and my husband called the front desk to ask where to find ice. We were told there are no ice machines here -- the bellhop will bring you a bag. Guess how long we waited for that? At least another half-hour. So far this was not the relaxing vacation we had envisioned. It was a true pain in the ____. But we were learning that was only part of what was to come. The way these "suites" are constructed, there is one large suite (not the one we had) with a pool or water view. The remaining "suites" and closets are stacked side-by-side dorm room style -- all sharing a main breezeway. Our breezeway had two rooms (A & B) and two closets. The main door to the outside of this breezeway is extremely heavy and slams when the pressure changes. So any time you or your suite-mates (even if you have no idea who they are, as was our case) leaves the breezeway -- the main door slams, shakes the entire set of doors inside the breezeway, and it is impossible to sleep through. Then you have to deal with your suite-mate's door closing as well. And if they have maid-service, but you choose to sleep in -- too bad. Because with the breezeway situation the maid's cart might as well be in your room with the noise and door slamming. Somehow we survived our first night though and decided to reward ourselves with breakfast in bed the next morning. The little card was supposed to be hanging on the door by midnight and we had it out at 10 p.m. Forty-five minutes late the next morning we received a call that they had lost our order and just found the card at the front desk. They rushed the food up to our room because my husband was not exactly nice about it at this point. It tasted rushed. It was horrible. And on top of that, we are not coffee drinkers -- we drink Coke in the mornings. That is what we ordered. They brought up two room temp cans of Coke and two glasses -- but no ice. Our ice from the night before had already melted. So we had to call the front desk again just to get ice for our late breakfast. Another 20 minute wait. As mentioned by countless others, there is no real "beach" here (just rocks and water) and it's a bit of a drive to the main attractions in Key West. These things we could have overlooked if we'd had a nice room with a decent view and felt like we could have relaxed. But to open our window and simply get natural light in the first room would have been impossible. In the second room, we'd only have a view of tourists schlepping their luggage by or going to and from the pool. We had planned to hit the pool bar our second night there and didn't even bother based on the amount of money we'd already spent and the type of treatment we'd received from the staff. I've noticed that managers come in and comment on some of these reviews after the fact to "gloss it over", and they're more than welcome to do so with this post. However, I was sending live e-mails to the friend who helped us get this reservation as this was all occurring so this is not just sour grapes after the fact. We were miserable on the vacation, and depressed to be back home thinking our fifteenth anniversary was so important to this resort they couldn't even bother to give us a clean bed -- much less a view of that Beachside they're so proud to flaunt in their name. If you choose to stay here and get the larger suite in your breezeway, by all means feel lucky. If you get the rooms we had, my sincerest condolences. I wish I'd listened to reviews like mine in advance and went elsewhere! And we didn't even pay full-price! (P.S. It's $17.50 / night to park at this hotel.)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but poor location”
Reviews.Author: ontheroad47
Reviews.Content: I stay in a lot of Marriott hotels. This one has very nice one bedroom with full kitchen and beautifully appointed. However there is barely a "beach"and the hotel is 20 minutes from old town where all the shops,bars and restaurants are. They do run a shuttle but it's once per hourvso guests are beholden to the schedule and lose a lot of time on the bus. As a result I cannot recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: keysagain
Reviews.Content: We stayed for over 10 days.... the suite was great and housekeeping staff was excellent. Had minor problem with room and it was fixed as soon as reported. During check in and out the front end staff was friendly and helpful. The buffett breakfast was great and the wait staff was attentive and friendly. We loved the pool and spent time there everyday. Overall had a great time ..... was very relaxing. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: sunluvinsprstr
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in only to find our reservations had been mysteriously cancelled the staff was uninformed and down right rude. After sticking us in a different room than the one we reserved we thought "Let's just enjoy our stay." That is easier said then done when you wait an hour for every meal in the resteraunt and are harrassed by security guards to leave the pool area when sitting in the "supposedly" 24 hour whirlpool. Also the "beachside" is a small rocky area that is no good for swimming, or anything else. Very misleading. Don't waste your money. Stay on Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: kellygirl63
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights the room was lovely. Anyone who has been to Key West, and if you haven't, should know there really is no beachside. Yes this hotel is situated on the water. The drinks at the bar are expensive and the wait staff there, from my perspective don't really pay you much attention. Although I would have considered having dinner the lack of attention by the bar staff took care of that thought. Had a great musician playing guitar and singing. The hotel is a drive into town and is a little on the pricey side. But I will say that the room was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Stay”
Reviews.Author: Andrearguidry
