Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Marriott for our wedding. We stayed three nights. It was amazing. The hotel room was beautiful. Granite countertops, stainless steel appliances, marble floor, jetted tubs, walk in shower, etc. I really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is not in the heart of Key West, but they offer a free shuttle service to downtown every 30 minutes and return shuttle every 20 minutes after the hour. The staff was nice, our room was clean and the decor was great. I would highly recommend staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Marriott”
Reviews.Author: jacksonk00
Reviews.Content: Really would recommend this hotel. It was clean and had great service shuttle to and from downtown Key West. The staff was excellent! Esp Toni who had really good suggestions for excursions and how to spend each day at Key West. It was really a beautiful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: slt40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel based on the reviews here. We are so glad we did! We had an excellent stay. Loved the rooms, wonderful breakfast buffet, great pool. It is a little far from the action, but it was a quick drive to town or take the hotel shuttle. If you are spring breaking and want to be in the middle of everything, this location might not work for you, but seriously, it is a quick ride in. It is worth it for the hotel, it was really nice and modern and had great service. Loved the pool cabanas! We would certainly recommend this hotel & we will stay at this hotel again. If you book the hotel and want breakfast, I paid for the breakfast in advance, it was a choice on the Marriott website. It was cheaper that way.

Reviews.Title: “Not a resort, not "beachside"”
Reviews.Author: sunnyd_0807
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a combo flight/hotel/car deal through a third party site. We chose this particular hotel because the package was cheaper than some of the other hotels on the island (such as Parrot Key). I guess you get what you pay for. The room they stuck us in really looked nothing like the photos on the website. If not for the name "beachside", I would have had no idea this place was near the water, from the area we were staying in. Our room was very small and dark. The only small window looked out on an exterior corridor "hallway" which had excellent views of other travelers wheeling their suitcases past, but not much else. Honestly, that's the kind of "view" I'd expect of a Motel 6, not a Marriott resort. The hotel was also extremely noisy-- the set-up where we were was a common door immediately off the exterior corridor, than a small foyer with a door to our room on the right and a door to another room directly in front. Every time our "foyer mates" came home, we'd hear the exterior door LOUDLY slam and echo in the foyer, and then the door to their personal room also LOUDLY slam and echo. We did not eat at the on-site restaurant, so I can't comment about that. The shuttle down to Duval street was nice, but only ran once an hour. I would probably spend a little more money and either stay at Parrot Key or one of the B&Bs closer to downtown next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo/Hotel, but not a quite a resort”
Reviews.Author: Gbraverman
Reviews.Content: The Key West Marriott Beachside has some of nicest suites in Key West, which is why we chose it. The suite are larger and decorated superbly and outfitted with top of line appliances. The pool area is nice sized, but not resort sized. The food options are limited to pool dining and a multi purpose restaurant. The lobby is very small and besides the pool and man made "beach", there is little space to roam. There is smallish, but well appointed work out space with a killer view. The rooms are very well constructed and block out any street noise as the resort is located at a very busy intersection. The pool crowd was notably noisy during our stay including some visitors who were not actually staying at the hotel. The crowd in general was a little rough, which was someone of a surprise given the decor/feel of a luxury resort. That said, the service was excellent as well. Finally, there was no spa/store and/or areas to relax except the pool area, but the room size made up for limited common areas/amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: kim1131
Reviews.Content: I had researched hotels extensively before traveling to Key West. I was a little concerned about the location of the hotel. The location was fine, on the water with a (small) beach. That is hard to come by in Key West. The shuttle service worked out great for us with transportation to town every hour. The hotel offers a beautiful pool area with a water view, something you won't get in town. We did stay in a one bedroom suite(water view) and wow was it nice. I am very picky with accommodations and this place had it all...comfortable bed, nice linens, hip decor, beautiful kitchen with a subzero refrigerator. We didn't rent a car and this would have been helpful mainly to grocery shop. We instead walked to the store(just under a mile away). I would choose Marriott instead of the resorts in town, too much chaos down there if you are trying to have a relaxing vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Rooms, Great Staff, Location Drawback”
Reviews.Author: GoneWiththeWind-NC
Reviews.Content: Extended a Miami Beach business trip with a trip to Key West for 2 nights. Must do: rent a convertible for the drive down and allow time to stop and enjoy the drive to Key West. This Marriott is very nice...our room was a one bedroom suite with a great balcony overlooking the gulf. Two baths, full kitchen, dining room & living room area and a bar. The master bath is fabulous with a walk in shower and a jaqcuzzi tub. Just an awesome room - wish we had stayed longer. The beach really is not a true beach but a small "man made" sand area and the pool area is relatively small for a "tropical resort" - but to be honest we didnt' spend a lot of time around the pool area I twas our first trip to key West and we drove our red convertible all over the island exploring (during the day). At night we went to Duval St (taking the shuttle leaving our red Mustang convertible parked!) We enjoyed breakfast both days in the hotel restaurant - nice buffet with made to order eggs & waffles. The hotel is situated right over the bridge driving into Key West - directly off a major bouelvard. If you plan to just enjoy the resort and not hit Duval - it may work out for you but you cannot walk to Duval Street. The hotel provides shuttle to Duval, once per hour. But in the early evening (6 pm) it gets a bit crowed for the shuttle rides and people do not respect that others have been waiting for the shuttle ahead of them...they push right onto the shuttle bus with disregard for the line waiting to climb aboard. Very rude. Once the shuttle was full, the hotel did provide additional transportation which was nice - since about 6 or 8 of us would have been waiting another hour for the next scheduled shuttle trip. This is a situation that could end badly with the wrong mix of people and the hotel should add more shuttles during the busy times or somehow monitor the line. The return trip was not bad if you make sure you are there right on time. The first night we were actually walking towards the shuttle about 30 ft. away and he pulled off. We had a choice sit in the bar at Margueritaville and wait an hour or take a taxi...we were exhausted and took a taxi - $15. As a marriott rewards elite member, I did receive complimenty internet at this property otherwise i think you had to pay. I would recommend this property definitely if you have a family trip...with children and aren't into the draw of Duval street in the evenings. Otherwise, and I love Marriotts and hate to say it, you need to move closer to Duval and all that it offers and find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from the fun”
Reviews.Author: dcoalr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small but has beautiful, modern suites. Unfortunatley there is a very small pool area, and all lounge chairs are taken by 9:00 am. There is really no "beach" to speak of. They do have jetski tours on site, and the guys are great. Only other rental available was one kayak and two standing paddle boards. The food at the restaurant is good, but there is only one option for a vegetarian. The only other close place to eat is a Denny's. The shuttle leaves for downtown every hour, and I witnessed fights break out over seats on the shuttle. The management did call for another van to take the many guests who want to go downtown, but who needs the hassle on vacation? Fights and pushing occur when trying to get on the shuttle to go back to the hotel as well. Bottom line, if you want to stay inside your beautiful room all day and night and miss all the fun, quirky, history of Key West then this is the hotel for you. If you like nice furniture and tile floors, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel, don't worry about the location”
Reviews.Author: conchwannabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights here in early March. Our unit was very spacious to say the least and was what they call a 1 BR Presidential suite, which is what I call the main unit of a 2 BR lockout. It was very well appointed with washer dryer, full kitchen, 1 master bath and also a 1/2 bath near the entry. 2 large screen TV'S king bed and super Marriott Bedding. The one thing we couldn't figure out was that the unit had a large dining room and table with seating for 6, but seemed if the unit is mostly used by 2 people. The unit overlooked the gulf which was worded as gulfview. Excellent view of the gulf with beach area right outside and 1 level below. There was a spiral stairway from the large balcony to the beachfront area which was very convienient. One could really compare the unit to a high end timeshare property, only with daily maid service for linen and cleaning with no extra charges. The pool area was nicely furnished with plenty of padded lounge chairs and tables. Beach area was well regarded by others around us too. Let me add though that the beach is not a typical beach that leads into the water. It is along the water but raised and swimming or fishing is not permitted ,at least not near the units. There is plenty of parking, even more than what is needed maybe? There is a parking garage on site and may be used if there would be a conventiion or the like. Otherwise seemed empty and a bit of wasted space. We did not use the onsite restaurant/lounge ''Tavern n Town'' but did have a couple of drinks from the poolbar called ''Bluebar''. Drinks were $9.00 minimum. I think a bit high by the time you add 20% for a tip,but I guess everyone that stays there can probably afford this. There were plenty of servers working the pool and beachside areas keeping patrons food and drinks refreshed which was a nice touch. All employees were very friendly and willing to accomodate. We had called housekeeping for several items and were delivered promptly As to the bad rap this place gets on the location, not sure why. They offer a shuttle from there to downtown every hour and returns every 1/2 hr. It is on the gulf, plenty of parking,and IN Key West ,so what more do you need? We had a rental car and used it everyday and always found parking downtown.The elegance and views of the place more than makes up for this location issue in my opinion. The only negative that we found was that Beachside can be a wedding destination and they shoo you off the beach 3 hours prior to the wedding. The beach front runs along the length of the facility and the wedding party gets the whole area? They only used about 150' of (my approx guess) of 600-800' total waterfront. All guests have paid a portion of their stay rate to have full use of the facilities. When they tell you you can't be here it did not set well us or with others around us. Facility credits could be a solution such as a free drink at the bar, food item or souvenier for putting you out , so to speak. We will consider staying at the Beachside Marriott again. This is a very typical upscale Marriott property.

Reviews.Title: “DEFINITELY NOT WORTH THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: ginb123
Reviews.Content: $239-329.00 is the rate we spent per night.. This is a converted time-share condo complex. Standard rooms are small, no 2 double bed rooms. They do have suites but we were told none were available. Mattress', very uncomfortable and in need of being updated. Service at this Hotel was very, very, inconsistent from check-in to dining. Complaining seemed to get some attention and results. This is not a beach front hotel! There is a small sandy area used for specifically renting of jet skis, paddle boats etc., but this is an inlet area and no other activities such a swim in the ocean can be done here. I am not typically disappointed with Marriott's but my suggestion would be to investigate the other Marriott's on the island. There are other nice complexes in Key West. Keep in mind you will be spending money to hire a taxi, bus or other transportation to get to activities.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property / Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: kjkro
Reviews.Content: I just spent a long weekend with a group of friends at the KW Marriott Beachside. The property is beautiful! A great pool area and man-made beach that overlooks the bay. We had a 3 bedroom suite which was wonderful..... had a full kitchen, large living room and dining area and each room had its own bathroom. The fitness room lacked.... only one weight bench a couple of treadmills and stationary bikes. The hotel offers complimentary shuttle to Duval every hour which was nice otherwise its a $18 cab ride there. Service lacked all throughout our stay! When you are a frequent Marriott customer you anticipate a certain level of service from their properties. Service was extremely slow at the poolside bar and restaurant. The Front Desk and Restaurant staff were not friendly and made it seem to be an effort to wait on you or to even recognize you. The only staff that would pass you throughout the property and greet you was the housekeeping staff. Guest recognition and helpfulness is what can make or break even the most beautiful property! For this level of hotel I would expect a greater level of service.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place”
Reviews.Author: red0099
Reviews.Content: Very nice well maintained property. The staff is outstanding. One of the best hotels I have stayed in. Big plus!! Hourly shuttle to and from Duval street. The pool and beach areas are very cleand and well appointed. Pool bar has good food and outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Suite”
Reviews.Author: Gralda
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 3 bedroom suite and found it to be absolutely perfect. With a full kitchen, laundry, spiral staircase to the private beach, marble and granite it couldn't have been nicer. We brought my elderly parents and my brother and his wife. We each had our own part of the suite. The pool area is smallish - with some competition for the poolside chairs. The resort should invest in a better set of chairs but in general it's a fantastic property. Key West is not known for it's beaches but we were able to kayak from the hotel and rent bikes to ride around the island. The hotel is located away from the town and is close to the naval air base so you do get noise from the jets but they seem to limit their noisy time to about an hour a day. We really enjoyed Key West and the weather was absolutely perfect the entire stay. This property is well worth a 5 star designation. I was impressed that the manager knew who I was since I am a Marriott Platinum member but I did think they could have offered some additional services for their Platinum level. We did not receive any additional perks. Definitely would recommend the hotel however!

Reviews.Title: “The Resort met my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Hemicuda426
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Beachside for 6 nights with my teenagers in a second room and friends on the next floor up. When the hotel says " Walkway view" you need to know that this means a window that overlooks the walkway, not a patio or a deck. Also, there were not any room available for upgrade, such as a family suite as the place also offers owner occupied condo's. Our Room's were 216B and 219B. both not large but excellent for sleeping and getting ready for the day. The rooms were quiet and very nice with new furniture and excellent bathrooms and King beds. We loved the pool area, especially the sand are near the sea wall that looked North across the Ocean. Food and drink at the Pool Cabana and staff were excellent and not a bad value. The Town and Tavern Restuarant was also nice with live music. My only complaint was if you brought your own Bottle of wine a $25.00 Corking fee applied. This is a bit much when you are dropping $4k at a resort for the week. Free shuttle service to Duval Street was great with Ken providing a free tour on the ride down and telling us restaurants that the local's prefer. All in all a great place to stay. We enjoyed it very much. Thanks Marriott and the Staff. Also the resort is situated perfect for a morning walk or run on the south end of the island along the Ocean.

Reviews.Title: “SUPURB”
Reviews.Author: deaconGreaterBoston
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience we had at the Marriott Beachside. It is set on the water about a mile or so from Old Naples with a shuttle service provided. There is a beautiful pool with bar and restaurant service over looking the ocean. Clean, neat witha friendly staff to serve and help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Key West - Marriott Beachside does it right!”
Reviews.Author: billkeywestfan
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott Platinum Elite customer. I am not biased when it comes to surveys, and I fill them all out. This former "condominium" project fell into hardtimes and Marriott found a opportunity since they sold a property many years ago in Key West. This place exceeded our expectations (comfortable beds, full kitchen, balcony, clean, clean, clean). I have been to many Marriotts and other hotels over the past 20 years on vacation - NEVER have I enjoyed a hotel accomdations that ALSO have a excellent restaurant Tavern 'n Town. I really thought it was the usual "sell" to try the in house restaurant. Not here - it is excellent - Fish, Prime Rib, and Steak! Thank You Marriott for a wonderful celebration! The Concierge, room controller, maintenance, and room service folks are so polite and professional! The only downside it is 3.2 miles from Duval street - but Taxi' are good think in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeTravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 5 days here. It's a short 20 minute (free) shuttle ride to old downtown. Always on time and knowledgeable drivers. Room was very nice w/marble floors, great kitchen, large balcony, soaking whirlpool bath, large shower. All staff members were friendly and helpful. Nice pool and bar staff.

Reviews.Title: “very nice in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: npmtravel
Reviews.Content: very nice room - we had the 3br suite overlooking the gulf. very clean, full kitchen, comfortable beds, good service. only ate breakfast in on-site restaurant but that was very good. only drawback was that it is on the opposite end of the Key - free shuttle to downtown was easy to use, but difficult to get a seat in the evening due to so many guests trying to get back to the hotel - had to call a taxi at $30 for six people

Reviews.Title: “Great stay & property”
Reviews.Author: DestinyUnbound1
Reviews.Content: Great stay and great property. If you are looking to sit down by the beach then look somewhere else. The beach here is a strip of sand. We stayed in a 3 room suite and there was a ton of space. We had 3 couples and two children and there still seemed to be a ton of room for everyone. The restaurant in the hotel was good. If you do choose to stay in and cook, there is a Publix less than 1 mile away from the property. My advice would be to at least eat in town a couple of times as there are some great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could rate this hotel higher”
Reviews.Author: HappyOne38
Reviews.Content: It had so many of the right ingredients but just fell short on a few items. Good points: My darling hubby was so sweet to upgrade our room to a suite and I have to say it was fabulous. Every room was very large, 1.5 bath, marble, crown molding, beautifully decorated. Our balcony was not only very large but it was two floors, the second floor at roof level. The shuttle driver Terry was so wonderful, he dropped us close to our restaurants and was so friendly it set the perfect mood for the evening. Its located close enough to Duval to enjoy in the evenings but being further off of Duval it was very quiet. The problem is, our room was due for an update. The bed was very uncomfortable (we actually got up and slept on the couch some nights) and there were tears in the furniture. We saw that they had a spa but the web site doesn't list the services or prices. We did see trucks with mattresses with them so we are hopeful. We would definitely stay here again, it was a beautiful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beach is a joke and shuttle needs to be better organized”
Reviews.Author: Allgoodonesgone
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights the first part of January. After leaving the Casa Marina and all of the Diamond amenties, we were a little disappointed without any prestige at a Marriot property. All in all it is a very good place to stay. We just missed being pampered at the Casa. We were given a king bed room. Asked for an upgrade, but no luck. We were able to get free parking as a concelation. The bottom line is...ask for everything and you might get some of it. Very disappointed their was no refrigerator, but they were very good about bringing ice on request. I would not even advertise a beach. It is small and not well maintained. It is probably OK in the summer, but not in January. The pool is very nice. Plenty of chairs and employees are very friendly. We were a little disappointed in the shuttle. We stood in what we thought was a line. When the shuttle pulled up, it was a mad dash and people that had just arrived barged right in. These are things that make you remember that you are on vacation and some things just aren't worth getting upset about. Overall, the Marriot is OK. Would probably come back if I could use reward points, but would not pay for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Too Far from the Fun”
Reviews.Author: CarolSmu
Reviews.Content: The initial lack of a smile and formal greeting by the front desk staff was the start of my unhappy stay. The hotel stated it was on the quieter side of town. This is not true as it is right off of HWY 1, so the noise from traffic/planes forced me to keep windows shut tight on beautiful cool winter nights. The only thing that is far way from the hotel is nice restaurants, and things to do. The complimentary shuttle offered was the other reason for my choice. This was also not a pleasant situation as the bus only held 20 passengers. There were always 25 or more waiting to board, so you often had to wait for the another bus. They always sent more transportation, but that meant standing in line forever trying to be the first in line. One time they did give us a complimentary drink for our trouble; however, the establishment did get their money back when we paid for our second round of drinks. My unpleasant check out experience was the final insult that lead to my overall poor review. I must warn all travelers to check their bill thoroughly. They charged me for parking though I had no car. They charged a $1 fee without my permission to a local fundraiser organization I know nothing about. I had to have my bill reprinted three times to remove charges that were unwarranted or unapproved. I did give the hotel an average rating on rooms/cleanliness. The maid service was very good. The room's decor/furniture was above average, but our bathroom doorknob fell off the second day. The pool bar/shuttle staff were the saving factors of my trip. The shuttle staff to and from the airport were very friendly/considerate individuals. Our shuttle driver Ken practically gave you one of the tours for free with his informative talks to and from Old Town. The pool area is clean and well kept, but the beach faces a view of a very large landfill.

Reviews.Title: “If you get a suite it is worth staying but otherwise you are paying a lot for no view or ammenities”
Reviews.Author: FL98
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here and enjoyed it in November 2010. We had a suite that overlooked the pool/cabana area and the ocean. There was a beautiful full kitchen, 1 and 1/2 bathes, sitting area, and balcony. However, we booked online a room with a possible upgrade to a suite in February 2011. When we arrived we were disappointed we couldn't get a suite but we understood it was not guaranteed and proceeded to our room. When we opened the door, we realized it was nothing more that a bead with a tv. The only window was a view of the garage. The room was actually on the ocean but didn't even have an oceanview window let alone a balcony. There was no room for a couch, only a chair and small desk with chair. There wasn't a refrigerator or a microwave. We called the front desk and were told only their suites had a view and the rooms to the left and right of it don't. They were able to get us a refrigerator but no microwave. What a disappointment in a place like Key West. Whoever designed this motel definitely missed the mark. Unless you can get a suite, you will definitely be disappointed. We heard people complaining about this every time we went to the front desk. For some reason the desk chair didn't have sliders on its legs so every time someone moved a chair in a nearby room, it loudly scrapped the floor. We heard this many hours night and day so we don't recommend this as a quiet motel. On the positive side the bed was comfortable and the staff was apologetic about the room. They offer a shuttle every half an hour to downtown Key West which is nice since it can be hard to find parking in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time at the Beachside”
Reviews.Author: GaryWhite40
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 9 night stay at the Marriott Beachside. I am a platinum member and used my points for the basic stay and then paid $50 a night extra to be upgraded to the presidential suites. Wow was that a wise move, the suite, and there are over 12 of them, are stunning, first class furniture, top class kitchen with all the necessary utilities inc washer/dryer and a really alrge dinign area, living area nad sun deck outside. The hotel itself was spot on and the best Marriott I have stayed at, and believe me I have stayed at many around the world. Also worth mentioning is the Tavern n Town restaurant, grreat food, particularly steaks and daily fish specials. Also happy hour two for one drinks between 5 and 7pm and two for one on the tapas as well. thoroughly recommend this palce, will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked, overpriced, and regular rooms extremely small”
Reviews.Author: 2Dragons57
Reviews.Content: When we opened the door to our room and saw the bed right there, it looked like we were walking into a small motel room. We were shocked at the size. The guest room is quite small. Only room for two people to sleep. You will bump into each other as you get dressed. This picture of the room is accurate, but you cannot realize that all that you see in the picture is IT. It is a good picture that goes from one edge of the room to the opposite edge. More positive reviewers must have had suites. You have to get ice, drinks, or anything via room service. No other means of availability at the site. It is a loooong way from all the activities .There is a shuttle that leaves once an hour and while they will drop you off along their route, it only picks up in front of Jimmy Buffet's Margaritaville . EVERYONE is crowded there waiting for the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not excellent”
Reviews.Author: TraveltheworldDude
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year and basically had the same experience - although the food in the Town and Tavern restaurant seems better this year. Pool is nice, hot tub was working this year, and generally the staff is pleasant. Rooms are clean, some are noisy due to proximity to busy highway - we asked to be moved and they did accommodate us, but for the money it seemed to fall short. I used Marriott points for a portion of our stay and that of course is fine, but paying the 300.00 per night for the other nights left me feeling like I paid too much...just my opinion... If you want 5 star this place is about a star short - I would give it a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service at its finest!!”
Reviews.Author: Seldomrest
Reviews.Content: WOW! What a great hotel, kind staff and huge beautiful suites. We loved staying off Duval St and being taken down and picked at our convenience via their shuttle. The food at the hotel is excellent and Joseph & Robert were excellent at giving us great advice on local places to eat that were very good!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: dorismct
Reviews.Content: Loved Key West and The Marriott Beachside, our thoughts are the same as everyone else, once you walk in your suite you don't want to leave. Huge clean rooms. It was great to cook breakfast every day and then head out. We ate a few times at the restaurant on site and it was very good with great service. You sure don't need a paid tour if you get Ken as a shuttle driver, he is excellent! Terry is good also. Please people remember to tip these guys. Pool area is so nice with great service. On another note they have a jet ski tour on site which is very convenient. Jeremy was an excellent tour guide and very informative. ( Don't forget to tip these guys also) Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing but stay away from front desk employee "Randi"”
Reviews.Author: brecksvillegirl
Reviews.Content: The rooms and the free shuttle to/from downtown as well as to the airport are the two best things about this hotel. The staff by the pool and the restaurant was awesome! The two Managers (Tony & Patrick) were GREAT! The front desk girl named "Randi" pissed off so many guest checking in/out that it was unreal! I brought this to the atention of Tony while we were there but we noticed she was doing the same thing to another guest on 1/22/11. She is rude and passes any concern off to a Manager. Key West is a party town with great food! I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: conmeister
Reviews.Content: We walked in the door expecting to stay 4 nights and immediately booked for 2 more. The room was unbelievable, the balcony private and huge. Everything was clean, clean, clean. The kitchen was amazing and fully stocked with dishes, pots and pans. We made breakfasts and one dinner in the suite; it was great. Parking was directly beneath our room, so convenient. I would go back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed there in early Jan. and had such a great experience, we took 3 more couples with us two weeks later.”
Reviews.Author: Launa58
Reviews.Content: So accomodating from the booking arrangements to checking in, to getting us to our dinner reservations in the evening. Unbelievable service. Clean rooms, room service at your fingertips, and the free shuttle service has a driver by the name of Ken that is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Strange layout but Nice Rooms, Shuttle Service”
Reviews.Author: advisetrip
Reviews.Content: The hotel has typically good quality, nice Marriott rooms. The restaurant/bar inside is nice and has good food and ambiance. The hotel has a free shuttle to and from downtown every hour which was perfect. Front desk was helpful and the business center worked well. My only criticism is the hotel is laid out with separate buildings that require a little bit of a walk (although I've walked further through the hallways of many other hotels) and the rooms have windows facing onto the walkways of the open air hallways. I would prefer the windows to face onto a courtyard or pool, rather than having people walk past my windows, but the rooms were excellent quality and quiet. Overall a very good hotel and nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel run by friendly personnel!”
Reviews.Author: Educator35yrs
Reviews.Content: My husband, two adult children, and I stayed at the Marriott Beachside Hotel for several days at the end of December, 2010. We were very impressed with the hotel and the friendly personnel. The free shuttle to and from the airport and to downtown were great! One morning my daughter and I wanted to use the shuttle to get to the airport to pick up a rental car. We told the front desk we needed an airport shuttle. When it still hadn't arrived after only a five minute wait Dante, at the front desk, got a car and drove us himself. We were very impressed. We stayed in a two bedroom presidential suite. It was lovely with marble floors, granite and bathroom counters, and a large balcony. The bedrooms were beautifully furnished. We are Marriott Gold Elite members, but the hotel (which I believe was originally supposed to be a timeshare facility) did not have a concierge lounge. Providing our party with free breakfasts in the restaurant was a wonderful substitution. The breakfasts were great with an omelet and egg station, a wonderful selection of fresh fruits, breads, and pastries, and warm selections in chafing dishes. The cost of staying here was higher than we typically spend, but considering the amenities it was worth it. We enjoyed the pool bar and restaurant. Roxanne, a waitress, actually came over and introduced herself while I was reading in a lounge chair next to the pool. I enjoyed meeting her and she was our waitress when we had lunch poolside later that day. It was great to be served by someone so upbeat and cheerful! The pool is very large and heated. It was nice that there was also a beach although the sand had to be "imported" since this side of the island is surrounded by a reef. The Marriott made a wonderful effort to have the facility actually be beachside. We also really liked Joseph, the airport shuttle driver. A Key West "native," he recommended several places for us to visit. It was obvious he, like the other personnel at the hotel, loved his job. We had originally reserved two rooms at the Fairfield Hotel, but when the Marriott Beachside with two bedrooms became available we changed our reservation. Renting a 2-bedroom unit with the free shuttles actually saved us money. Would we stay here again? You bet. Thank you to the management for running such a wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was on a business trip instead of at a fun resort”
Reviews.Author: jongable
Reviews.Content: I never really felt like I was in Key West when I was at this property. It is about 3 miles from downtown and even though it is at the water's edge, the hotel really does not have a beach. Also, be very careful about what kind of room you book. This hotel is a coverted timeshare. They took 2-bedroom units and converted them to 1-bedroom suites and standard hotel rooms. The suites look really nice, but the standard hotel rooms are not up to Marriott's "resort" standard. The property is a bit noist too given that it is right on Rt-1 (the main business strip on Key West). On a positive note, the staff was very friendly and the shuttle service to and from town worked out well.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful find in Key West”
Reviews.Author: DHSCUBS
Reviews.Content: Not having stayed in Key West inb several years, I was pleasantly surprised (and impressed) with the high quality of the rooms, poolside service, restaurant and friendly efficient staff. Our group of about 20 lived around the pool and the wait staff was woustanding, providing food and beverage as needed. The meeting room was perfect for our size group with all the amenities needed. Since we were a few miles fromn "downtown" Key West, we made ample use of the complimentary shuttle. The drivers were just like personal tour guides and provided ample information. Always on-time for pick up also. The rooms were massive suites, with excellent furniture, bedding and a great kitchen with high end appliances. I could have easily lived full-time in this unit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: gotayj
Reviews.Content: Lots of Europeans I was shocked did not matter they were great and service was great ....Scott the Bartender was Awesome the layout was great it was a good distance away from duval so so you can really get the best of both worlds this is my 2nd time coming back here after three years love it

Reviews.Title: “worthy of a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: AR1900
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice - truly what a Marriott should be. It's only slightly more pricey than other places in the area, but the difference in terms of quality is huge. Definite value for the money. The suites are very large and spacious, very elegant and clean. Everything is meticulously kept and it creates a very nice atmosphere. Staff is very courteous and professional, as well as prompt. The restaurant for breakfast is beautiful and worth taking a look at. It's a little ways away from Mallory Square but that is definitely a good thing because it provides some peace, quiet and shelter from Key West's tourism drag. Shuttles take you there anyways, so it's actually a positive in my book. Definitely stay here

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: minalachatte
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Beachside was a great place to have our weekend getaway. I'm a platinum Marriott member and I was treated very well. As other reviewers have mentioned, it is not near the action on Duval St or the waterfront, but there is a shuttle that runs hourly until 11 pm to Margaritaville. They also will drop you off at other locations downtown if you ask. And a cab ride back is about $15 if you end up stumbling home at 4 in the morning. The one bedroom suite we had was amazing: great balcony with real patio furniture (not plastic), two bathrooms, a whirlpool tub, duel sinks. The kitchen is well-equipped, so if you want a quiet night in, you can entertain all your friends. The staff was very accomodating and the concierge was extra helpful in getting us on a sunset cocktail cruise! The pool area is excellent and bar service is prompt and friendly. The only drawbacks are the expensive parking ($18 a day? Really? This isn't downtown Miami!) and the location being far away from the action (but at least it's quiet as a result!) I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an oasis away from the madness of Duval St.

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious, expensive, and not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: rebelfarmer
Reviews.Content: I usually use Marriott hotels when travelling but this one fell way below their catagory 6 rating. Beachside was a misnoma - a strip of sand put there by the company led to a nasty bit of water, no beach and certainly not a place to swim. Our room couldn't have been closer to the main busy road. It was classy but totally impersonal. Two doors which clanged shut noisily separated us from the nicer ( and more expensive) suites. No fridge; air conditioning which blew down directly onto the bed; and two windows which looked out onto the walkway....not my idea of a luxury hotel! Yes, the pool was lovely and the hotel bus which took you downtown hourly was nice. As for the rest, you can keep it!

Reviews.Title: “Pure heaven!”
Reviews.Author: beachestoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything one could ask for. Pure luxury. The 1 bedroom ocean front room was simply to die for. Grantie kitchen countertops with a very modern design. Bedroom and master bath were stunning. Marble everywhere. Separate shower/toilet. Huge double sinks and a big jacuzzi tub. Bed was very comfortable. Free shuttle bus brought you back and forth into town. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet & Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Gkoop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriot during the final week of "Fantasy Fest" not knowing how the location would play out. The hotel amenities were outstanding - the suite we stayed in very nicely appointed - it felt very much like staying in a nice home. The only disappointment was the location of our room, in which case the balcony looked mostly at the side of one of the other buildings. We tried to change rooms, but since we needed handicap accessible for my father, there was apparently nothing else available. Most of the rooms have a nice view of the lushly landscaped pool or the gulf (which would have been our preference even at the premium that would have been charged). From my perspective this room should have been discounted because the lack of any view. On the positive side, we were treated very nicely by the staff. My father is wheel chair bound and the attention he received by the staff (particularly the pool attendant) was very caring and appreciated. During one evening, there was a bad storm that knocked out the elevator stranding my father in the room until early evening. The Marriot manager on duty tried very hard to find a workable solution (even volunteering to bring in paramedics) and did their best to make sure my father was comfortable, sending up free room service and removing that day's charges from the bill. The hotel location worked well for us since we could easily drive into Key West and escape back to quiet when we wanted. It is expensive, but most of the other options we looked at were as well. All in all, I was very satisfied with our stay and would book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible towards Platinum member”
Reviews.Author: RowBird
Reviews.Content: As a Marriott Platinum member, I have seen my fair share of Marriotts across the globe. This one is awful! 1. Rude service at the pool bar (when it wasn't busy). Something along the lines of "it's over there. go get it yourself." 2. Lied to by the waitress regarding bonus points. 3. I'm in a rush, and I'll write a full review on the frequent flier sites when I return home. I planned to stay there 3 nights, but I checked-out after the first night. If the managers are reading this, then take a lesson from South Beach Marriott or JW Marriott Marquis (even the Courtyard Key West treats Platinum members better). I'll definitely mention this to my frequent traveler buddies.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: NJshorebeachgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed a total of 4 days and 3 nights. Highly recommend this hotel along with the onsite bar and restaurant. We stayed in the 2 bedroom Presidential Suite and was very impressed with furniture, layout etc... Lovely pool area especially the double lounge chair; could have stayed there all day! Great happy hour at the bar by the pool. Staff very accommodating; couldn't do enough for you. The only thing that I was disappointed in was the daily parking charge other than that you won't be sorry if you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: NJSHORECPL
Reviews.Content: Y husband and I would go back here in a heartbeat! Our room was bettter than our home! The floors were marble. We had a huge kitchen with dining area! There was a powder room in the foyer with the washer and dryer. We had a living area with a flat screen and balcony with lovely wicker furniture. There was a private rooftop deck for our personal use....if only there would have been a couple of chairs up top :) The bedroom had a very comfy king size bed with flat screen. The best - the huge bathroom! there were two sinks and a jacuzzi tub. In a seperate room there was a toilet and very latge shower!! We spent every afternoon and the pool and enjoyed the happy hour. We never had an issue finding chairs. The waitstaff were very prompt. The front desk staff and the drivers bent over backwards for us! The drivers took us for free every hour downtown! We utilized them daily. It was only $17.00 to get a cab back late at night. the shuttle ran until 11pm. No problem for us! Again - mu husband and I would stay here again - anytime! And we really hope to! We would only say the two downfalls - if that - were no wireless internet and no furniture on the roofrop patio. Again - such small minor things. Please go down and stay here! PS - I took about 50 pictures of our room....

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.. but not great.”
Reviews.Author: SCTvGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had never been to Key West. I used priceline to get a good rate on a 4-star hotel. I was pleasantly surprised that a Marriott Hotel accepted our $150 a night rate during Fantasy Fest week. (A Key West annual festival) The rooms are clean, trendy and have those fabulous Marriott beds and pillows. (The best!) However, many of the rooms are not "beachside.." Most of the rooms look over the parking lot! Not cool. The hotel has a fantastic pool and pool-side dining area. The pool furniture is high quality and staff make sure you have nice towels and serve drinks. There is also a small sandy area where you can rent a jet ski. They were setting up for a beachside wedding that was very nice. The REAL benefit of this hotel is the complimentary hotel shuttle from the airport, and to/from downtown Key West. It runs every hour! A HUGE value, seeing how this hotel is 4 miles from downtown you wouldn't want to walk it. Overall-- we were pleased with everything except the view. I'll chalk this up to my fault because I was not clear that i wanted a view. Then again, not sure that Priceline gives you that option? Key West was A LOT of fun, even for sweet, southern girls like me!

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the best hotels, anywhere”
Reviews.Author: BEACHMAN103
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week vacation at the Marriott Beachside. Our room was a Presidential suite overlooking the gulf and was magnificient. This hotel was as nice as any we've stayed at, anywhere. The on site restaurant is top notch and the service level everywhere was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: amd918
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Marriott Beachside in Key West for four nights. We were very impressed with the staff. Joseph (poolside) was absolutely outstanding. Very good at his job and very accommodating. The poolside waitresses were also very friendly and efficient. Scott the cabana bartender was great as well. Everyone was very helpful with restaurant suggestions and places to go. I highly recommend trying the hamburger at Brazalina (and the ahi tuna salad). Pepe's was good too but pricey for the atmosphere (handwritten sign on building, small "house" type of place). I booked the hotel using my points so, of course, we got just a standard room. We didn't open the blinds often because the windows went out to the open hallway and anyone walking by could see right in. The room was small but comfortable and very clean. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Key West. One thing they do forget to mention is that you can't really swim at the beach and from the beach you have a perfect view of the prison and dump (so pool view room is probably better than an ocean view). Definitely take advantage of the jetski tour. It was a lot of fun and, although we didn't see dolphin, others that went before and after us did.

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: Walesvisit0r
Reviews.Content: Friendly helpful check in and then the great suprise of not "just" an upgrade but to a really smart and huge apartment style suite. The excellence went on in that the standard breakfast menu was made up of unusually good quality items and a very helpful waitress, The free shuttle bus to town means you can have a drink with dinner without worrying about the drive home.- and the driver was full of suggestions of where to try first. The pool area was good-a minor issue that the sandy area is a dockside not a beach but there is a wonderful state park nearby if you want sea swimming . We would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: cameryjax
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I experienced a wonderful stay at your hotel for six (6) days. The hotel manager (Tony) was very hospitable to our room needs with a wonderful room overlooking the pool area and the water. The food service manager (Rick) and the bar manager (Sean) were more than accommodating to our Key West entertainment requests. Housekeeping and pool staff were very helpful with everything. A nice surprise to find the beds turned down and chocolate gently laid upon the pillow. Thank you for all the special attention from the Marriott Key West Beachside Staff !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great Food, Awesome service at pool”
Reviews.Author: zeke14
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with 10 couples. Check in and the front desk was slow in general. However, the service at the pool, restaurant and meeting services was phenomenal. The bartender in the hotel was a little rude. he seemed to be too busy spending time with his friends that were there at the bar to serve us. Ganna, Joe at the pool and Paula were fabulous!! Rooms were awesome. washer and dryer a huge bonus!

Reviews.Title: “We just finished a 4 night stay at this...”
Reviews.Author: JaneEyre704
Reviews.Content: We just finished a 4 night stay at this hotel & we were very pleased. We had a huge suite overlooking the Gulf of Mexico. The rooms were beautifully decorated & the furniture was not your average hotel furnishings, but lovely, high-end furniture to compliment the stainless steel appliances & HUGE granite counter-tops in the full kitchen! Even the large balcony was furnished with expensive, large comfortable chairs. The super-high ceilings (w/ ceiling fans throughout) added to the elegance. The ONLY draw-back of this location was there is no access to swimming in the Gulf @ this hotel. The property does have a jet-ski company giving island tours...which we highly recommend. It was so much fun viewing Key West from the water. The pool was great too. Always a chair available. There are waiters to bring drinks & food as you lounge. We used the shuttle service often & had the pleasure of getting an island tour, on our way to Duval street from the friendly & entertaining driver with a lovely head of white hair (I think his name was Ken, but my husband disagrees). Our trip was amazing and whatever we asked for was immediately taken care of. We would definitely stay at the Marriott again!

Reviews.Title: “I got seriously ill from the black mold there.”
Reviews.Author: OLDYANKEE1956
Reviews.Content: we went to this hotel in feb 2010 from ohio. when we walked across the carpet in our bare feet, they were black from the mold in the carpet. we tried to get a refund but manager said no refunds. when we got back to ohio i had to go to doctor and he said i had a lung infection from mold. i was off work 2 weeks. you could see daylight from around the door and hear noise all night.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: harrisonjh
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough positive things about this hotel. We were there for a wedding and made it into a mini-vacation. We were 20+ people and the pool was a great meeting point for us all. I would highly recommend the hotel for family reunions, weddings, any large group of family and friends. Here is one example of the service at this hotel, my 15 year old son left his passport in the room and only realized it when we got to the KW airport. My husband called the hotel, long story short, we were only steps away from boarding the plane, and an airport employee handed us my son's passport! The management went above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property with just the right level of services”
Reviews.Author: KidKalik
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Marriott Beachside. The stay was just right for us in terms of mix of relaxation and enjoying the night life of downtown Key West. We upgraded to one of the single room Presidential Suites. The room was fantastic - our only complaint was that we didn't enjoy it much as we were on the go most of the time. The poolside staff were fantastic. We rented bikes on site each day and rode the 3.5 miles into Key West, enjoyed ourselves and then road home. The ride is flat, with lots to look at along Smathers Beach, etc. Many folks think that the property is too far from downtown - and that might be the case - however we had no problems and we got a lot from the expirience of riding each day. We also took part on one of the Jet Ski tour. The guide was friendly and knowledgeable. I would spend the money to do the trip. The breakfast buffet was really good, the hotel was clean, and the staff was friendly. Enjoy the Key's!

Reviews.Title: “Very small room.”
Reviews.Author: janeelis
Reviews.Content: Unless you get one of the big upgraded suites, you will hardly be able to move around. By the time we added our suitcases and computer, etc., there was no room to really get comfortable. The bathroom has very little counter space and is located right next to the bed. The one bedrooms have one window where people walk by and can look right in. The room was very clean, once we asked them to replace the big stained footstool that previously had something spilled all over it. We did enjoy the bar with live music and good food but a very nice room is my priority.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever, Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: turnerdi
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of hotels and this room took my breath away! It was fantastic and well worth upgrading from the standard. This suite was immaculate and bigger than most apartments. The bed was amazing, kitchen had the finest appliances, and the balcony was to die for. We spent a couple hours each evening just taking in the warm ocean breeze. This room had everything I could have asked for. We did laundry, it was nice to take clean clothes home! Happy hour was excellent. I had no complaints about the pool. We didn't find it to be cold or dirty at all. Concierge was SO helpful. We booked the on site jet ski tour which was awesome! We saw a shark and a pod of dolphins super close. Chris was a great guide! Also enjoyed a sunset cruise. Thanks Toni for your help! We were only going to stay one night but we begged to cancel our other reservation so we could stay another night. This place was pure luxury. Hotel shuttle was great. Was nice to stay a little further away from the chaos, yet be able to enjoy it when you want. Thank you Marriott, this is just what we needed. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality Hotel and Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Creditgirl
Reviews.Content: Booked 4 nights here through Virgin Holidays. The room was a standard one on the front of hotel overlooking the road but there was very little noise from it. Although situated quite a way from downtown(Duval St etc) the complimentary shuttle bus was very useful and ran til 11pm. Had dinner in the restaurant one night and it was very good, the bar was well patronised most nights so had a good vibe and it had a happy hour which helps! Just wish the weather had been warmer as the pool area is very nice and would have liked a swim but it was freezing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: 1TravellerGirl
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to the Keys, the first week of May & this resort was one of the best experiences of the trip. We stayed in the 1 Bedroom Presidential Suite, 1 King, Resort view, Whirlpool, Balcony. We LOVED: the decor, the bedding, the full modern kitchen, the dinner table that sat 6, the extra powder room, the in-room laundry room, the large balcony with stairs to the pool, the big flat-screen TV, the luxurious bathroom. The room was cleaned daily, beds made, toiteries replenished quickly. The Buffet breakfast was EXCELLENT!! We regret not having enough time to try the happy-hour at the bar or dinner although the hotel restaurant had rave reviews in the local mags. The heated pool was perfect so was the pool-side bar - the bar tender made strong drinks! The little man-made beach and small pier are perfect for relaxing away from the crowds. The lobby and public restrooms were beautiful and very clean. Front desk staff were always very friendly and very helpful. The location was just a few minutes drive from Duval street. This was never a problem because of the "Free" Shuttle that ran "hourly"!! We just needed to be a bit more organized with our itinerary than if we stayed off Duval Street! A bonus: the drivers were great local guides - very friendly, helpful & accommodating. For those late nights out, the taxi ride back to the hotel was only $17. We drove from Miami to experience the drive down Route 1 drive and stayed from Sunday to Wednesday. Our one suggestion to the hotel would be to provide discounted parking at least during weekdays and off-season. We can't wait to go back to the Keys and we would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: Rocco_G13
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 3 couples who booked last minute after concerns with a cruise/weather situation. It was by far one of the best resort hotels we have ever stayed at. The 3 bedroom Suite was even better than the photos on their website and the staff was first rate as was the in- house restaurant. Our travel deal included free parking, a $25 gas voucher and we even received a breakfast comp for the group for both days of our stay, thanks to Dante at the Front Desk. The 3 Bedroom Suite is over 1500 sq. ft. and there is plenty of room for 6 people without bumping into each other. Each of the bedrooms were extremely comfortable,spacious,spotless and quiet. The bathrooms are very large and well equipped. The kitchen is first class with Sub-Zero and Kitchenaid appliances, granite counters and marble floors throughout. The balcony overlooks the pool and has a view of the ocean. I would recommend this resort as one of the best in the Keys as far as suites/rooms, staff, restaurant, value and overall ambiance. *****

Reviews.Title: “In a Class by Itself”
Reviews.Author: YoCoop
Reviews.Content: Magnificient accomodations away from the hustle and bustle of Duval St. Upgraded to a Presidential Suite and well worth it. Full kitchen, living room, dining room, balcony, king bed, washer and dryer. No need to rent a car with the shuttle running at the top of every hour to 11 p.m. Drops you off in front of Margahritaville on Duval street. This hotel was by far one of the best we have ever stayed in. Outstanding staff at the front desk, especially Dante and the concigiere was named Raymond, also a great guy for service. The restaurant was fantastic, our server was Fatima, and she was teriffic. Great food, breakfast, lunch and dinner. Prices are what you might expect at an upscale hotel. Our favorite hangout was the swimming pool; just fantastic. The attendant sets up your lounger with towels or an umbrella, or if you request a cabana, he'll handle that also. The pool was clean and heated; seems strange in Key West but after two heavy rainstorms overnight, we were grateful for the heated pool. The pool bar has happy hour from 2:30 to 7:00; drinks are $4.00. Our bartender was Scott and he mixed the best Pina Coladas and Bay Breezes. The waitress service and food were also top notch; never a need to leave your chair or the water. Needless to say, this was the biggest part of our hotel bill. In back of the pool area is a little man made beach; not too bad but don't expect a natural beach because Key West is all coral reef. You can also rent jet skies at the dock and take a leisurely tour of the island or just use the skies for speed. Our stay only lasted 3 nights and the worst part was leaving this paradise. We were considering a cruise for our 20th anniversary, but we will now seriously consider going back to this location. By the way, we took a shuttle from Ft.Lauderdale airport to our hotel, a distance of 4.5 hours. I didn't feel like driving that distance so we took the "Keys Shuttle". It stops at Miami airport, Key Largo, Islemorada, Marathon, and then on to Key West. Our driver was Mario; simply a great driver. He took us door to door; round trip, at less than the price of a rental car. All in all, this ranks as one of our top vacations ever and we are grateful to the staff at Marriott Beachside in for making it so.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort, absolute luxury feel to the entire hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bretts11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort for 5 nights with my wife on our honeymoon. We were impressed by just about everything the resort had to offer. We were upgraded from the standard king room to the one-bedroom suite. The room included 1.5 baths, a full kitchen, dining room, large balcony, and a jacuzzi tub. The room was excellently maintained by the staff. Definitley no cleanliness issues here. We were also provided vouchers for free breakfast for each day of our stay in the hotel restaurant, Tavern 'N' Town, which was great. The shuttle to Duval Street is often packed, but luckily the hotel calls extra taxi's and picks up the bill for guests. Internet access inside the lobby is terribly slow, I wouldn't recommend even trying. We frequented the pool-side bar most days and found it to be very delightful (bartender Ben was especially helpful). The bar has a "happy hour" that is something like 5 hours long, which is the majority of the time it is open. The beer is only $1.50 during this time, opposed to the $5 regular price. Cocktails are also half price. We booked the jet ski tour that leaves from the Marriott Resort beach. I would highly recommend this tour. It takes approximately two hours to travel around the entire island, with frequent stops to point out landmarks and breaks to just play around on the jet skis. We were able to book this through the pool-side concierge attendent. The pool area is great too, with private cabanas that can be had first-come, first-serve. Parking is a bit pricey compared to other hotels in the area (the rest appear to be free). The charge is $17.50 per day for self-park.

Reviews.Title: “Will Return very soon!”
Reviews.Author: s2lulu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (newlyweds) drove down from Miami for a weekend getaway. After reading the reviews of the hotel and then staying at the hotel all I have to say is DONT LISTEN TO THOSE PICKY PEOPLE! This hotel is just GREAT!!! Our check in (Ryan) was so pleasant and even said congratulations on our honeymoon when we walked up to the desk. Our room was not ready yet, but he and another co worker were able to find a room clean and ready for us before guaranteed check in. Our room was amazing! One bedroom suite, marble floors, Jacuzzi tub, huge balcony, beautiful kitchen...And the list goes on. We were completely in love with the hotel from start to finish. The pool is great, and the drinks are even better. They have happy hour from 230 to 7 every day; we got 6 drinks for 25 bucks. Our bartender Scott was very pleasant. We wanted a relaxing weekend and we got exactly what we were looking for. If you spend a little more for the suites, trust me, itâ€™s worth it! We have been telling all our friends this is the place to stay. If you are looking for a place near Duval or downtown, this is not for you, if you are looking for an awesome deal, a getaway and great service, this is the place! they do offer a free shuttle to Duval so no worries about taking a cab, if you do itâ€™s like $14 bucks (my suggestion, they should do two pick ups within the hour). The only negative thing I would say is the Concierge was not warm and friendly. He kind of was looking at us like "oh great here comes another tourist, what do they want" type attitude. We quickly shook it off and booked snorkeling with him anyways. All in all, we cannot wait to come back; we are already planning a weekend trip in three weeks! Thank you for a wonderful time! Xoxo

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected despite a rocky start...”
Reviews.Author: Hotelier1111
Reviews.Content: Booked a one night stay in the Presidential 3 bedroom. Upon arrival the front desk agent tells us we booked a 2 bedroom. I show him confirmation stating otherwise, and the manager later comes out and apologizes and says the hotel overbooked and they will need to put me in a 1 bedroom and 2 bedroom...with some free breakfast thrown in for my entire party the next morning to smooth things over. So after that rocky start, we found the two suites to be quite nice. Views of the gulf of mexico were spectacular...and the suites do have a high end look to them. The shuttle to Duval street fills up quick, but they'll run a second if need be, which is helpful. Breakfast was actually really good too. I work in high end hotels and can tell you that this Marriott gives exceptional value for your dollar. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Property, Wonderful Stay, Quite Pricey Though”
Reviews.Author: Rao_NJ
Reviews.Content: Awesome rooms, made me feel right at home, Make sure you get a poolside or beach facing room the others just dont make the cut, we were first checked into what I would call a closet for $190 a night, which is still quite expensive, and we upgraded to a poolside for $50 more and it was well worth it, Just absolutely adored the room, had a kitchen, the best bathroom and a balcony view of the pool, Only flipside like other travellers say there is no real beach and you cant swim its just a stretch of sand to sun yourself so dont be fooled by the beach!! Key West has a lot of water activities so we didnt really miss the beach!!

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: rieanna
Reviews.Content: You cant even call this a hotel. It is more like a luxuary condo. It has 3 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms at 1500 plus sq ft. All decorated beautifully, comfy beds, great bathroom, master has jacuzzi tub, marble floors through out, granite and stainless kitchen, and CLEAN. Looks clean, smells clean because it is cleaned. The staff is fabulous, friendly and willing to help you out at all times. The price is great, much lower then other resorts and you get more benefits and attention here. Thats why we keep coming back, it never lets you down. Stay here, you wont be sorry!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere, tackless guests, small dingy rooms, apathetic staff”
Reviews.Author: quoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel over the 4th of july weekend, and weren't very happy with the hotel. We stayed in a standard room, and this was a huge mistake, the standard rooms are tiny and dark, overlooking the parking garage, and not at all worth the over $200/night we were paying. The rug in our room was also stained with a mysterious black tarry substance, which really should of been cleaned up before we arrived, and the staff offered no apology for when we reported it. We called and asked to be upgraded to a suite, but as the hotel was full, we could not be accommodated. The pool was overrun with screaming children, and tacky 'jersey shore' types. One girl at the bar was even loudly talking about how her friends took photos of her spread eagled the night before - not really what I want to be forced to on my vacation. The staff seemed apathetic, the pool bartender seemed insulted when I tried to order a dark and stormy, and then ignored us for a good 10 minutes when we attempted to order something else. We had originally chosen this resort as it was a bit further from the downtown area, and supposedly quieter, but Aa the grounds and guests are so noisy anyway, there's really no benefit to staying here. Next time I go to key west, I'll be staying in one of the boutique hotels downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place! ...but be careful...”
Reviews.Author: bdw330
Reviews.Content: I travel quite often through the year, and use Marriott for my travel needs. I love Marriott and their great hotels. As you can imagine, I am rewarded for my loyalty. In this economy, it is great to get some perks for being away from family and friends. The Girlfriend and I wanted to get away to the beach for a week. What better place than the Florida Keys? After doing some research, we decided to use my reward points for the Marriott Beachside. I had plenty of the required points it asked for. The website also said that it would be an extra $80/night (upgrade fee) for a three bedroom suite. Fine, split between 4 people, that is nothing. It was a steal, compared to some of the hotels down there. Plus, we had a great view, kitchen, and tons of room to move. I printed out my confirmation, and moved on with my life. I did notice, however, that the confirmation had both, $80 a night upgrade fee, and a $200 a night upgrade fee. I was quite confused and decided to call Marriott. The first time I called, a lovely young lady assured me that it was the $80/night fee, not the $200. This put my mind at ease and I resumed my life. When it came closer to our check in date, I called the corporate number again. I had a very nice man tell me not to worry, that we would only pay an $80/night upgrade fee. To be even more confident, I even called the Hotel itself. They, for the third time, confirmed that we would only pay $80/night. Are you starting to see a pattern here? We checked inâ€¦ At check in, we were greeted with smiles, received free breakfast tickets for every day we were there (which they did not have to do), and was given assurance for the 4th time, that we were only responsible for the $80/night upgrade fee and incidentals. This hotel was magnificent! Great View! Great Food + Drinks! Pool was awesome! Staff was friendly and accommodating! Everything worked and was Clean! We had a wonderful stay! We checked outâ€¦ Guess how much they quoted me that we had to pay? â€¦$200/night upgrade fee. After all of that!!!! Obviously, I asked to see the manager on duty. He said to get my receipt and come back down. Did thatâ€¦ I even brought my room key holder, which had the rate of $80/night printed on it. This place would not budge! They could not even tell me why 4 people confirmed the lower price with me. I asked if we could call the corporate number. I think the manager called the â€œin case a customer is yelling at you, call this numberâ€� hotline. I was told that I was wrong, and that they would have never told me that. So, in other words, they called me a liar. I had to pay $1000, instead of $400. I would have stayed and argued all day, but I had to catch a ride back to the mainland. This totally ruined the rest of our trip, and then had to come home early because of budgetary reasons. There was no record I talked with four different people, even though I was told there would be. No one could tell me why I had to pay the $200/night upgrade. NO ONE!! I asked the hotel to get back to me and tell me why my confirmation sheet said one price and the Hotel demanded another. No one has contacted me and Marriott still avoids the question when I ask them. No one can give me a straight answer!!! I am giving this hotel a 3 star rating. If I am compensated for my troubles and get an explanation, then it will increase. I am a very generous person that never complains and is not out to get stuff for free. Change your ways, Marriott Beachside.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its best!”
Reviews.Author: wgbetts
Reviews.Content: This hotel by far exceeded our expectations. It is very spacious and luxurious. IF you can believe it, the resort is even better than the pics lead you to believe. We loved it! However, Room service is really pricey. And on the down side you have to pay $17.50 for parking per day. But it is by far the most luxurious hotel in key west! Marble bathroom with a jakuzzi bathtub thats the size of a small swimming pool! Groumet kitchen, Not 1 but 2 private balconies. OMG! We will stay here again. It is soo worth the price you pay. The free shuttle downtown is a plus +++. Daily maid service and bath and body works toiletries. Even had a washer n dryer n suite, so no laundry to do when we got home. Big screen tv's. Im already missing it!!!! Cant wait to go back :-)

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: silver49022
Reviews.Content: Stay somewhere else!! We have stayed at countless Marriotts and this is hands down the worst experience we have ever had. If you enjoy spending your vacation at a low budget establishment then this is the place for you.. We had a two master bedroom suite and it was horrible! We got locked out of our room with the key card 4 times during our stay and had to wait at least 20 minutes for someone to let us in. One time we had to wait an hour... The pool was filled with loud un behaived children. Do yourself a favor and stay at a motel 8 & have the same experience! We also were locked out of the fitness center 3 times.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with exception of pool service”
Reviews.Author: kywest
Reviews.Content: Our stay was for five days. Wonderful hotel, breakfast buffet is outstanding, we ate there everyday. Beautiful suite; spacious and relaxing. The housekeeping, concierge, front desk and restaurant customer service was wonderful. The pool, we were very disappointed with. It was dirty, clearly hadn't been cleaned. I hope that was just due to large number of guests. They were setting up behind us for a wedding and one of the setup crew was smoking the whole time, the smoke kept floating our way. The pool attendant was the rudest I have ever seen, he moved some people who had already been sitting in some chairs for some time, he said they were reserved by 6 people the day before. How do you reserve pool chairs? It was rudely done. They didn't have enough pool towels three days straight. We will try a new hotel next time we are in town, as well as recommend another place to our friends. Pity, outside of the pool, it was a great hotel, but the pool experience is important to us..

Reviews.Title: “Our room and view were so beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Paris09
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this hotel and what a wonderful time we had. We have 3 small children and the suite we had was perfect. It was a three room, three bathroom suite and the kids giggled with excitment after every room was previewed. There was a room with a double bed with a plasama tv, a room with 2 twins and a tv and the master suite provided lots of luxury. The view was of the gulf and it was sooooo pretty. We only wish we had stayed longer. Our time at Key West was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in a questionable location”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleIllinois
Reviews.Content: We've always had good experiences with Marriott and this trip was no exception. We had a nicely decorated large 3 bedroom oceanfront suite on the 2nd floor. But this hotel originally designed as condo's that apparently would not sell is in a tough 'beachside' location right on the outer edge of the island with a view of the landfill and very close to the road with its road noise. Decent pool, excellent breakfast buffet and very nice upscale furnishings. Have to pay to self park, and pool ran out of towels one afternoon we were there. But in general, I would recommend this hotel but know what the pros and cons are.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel! Highly Recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: bogdig
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Marriott Beachside on July 4th for a 2 night stay. Check-in was seamless, we were directed right to building 3 where we parked in the garage located below the building. We took the elevator up to the 4th floor (3 floors of rooms and garage on ground floor). We opened our door and were very impressed with our room. We booked the 1 bedroom presidential suites (all suites are considered "presidential", they do offer typical hotel rooms, but they only have a hallway view). Our room was roughly 900 sq. feet with a full kitchen, dining room, bedroom, and 1.5 bathrooms. The room is also equipped with a stackable washer and dryer. Being on the top floor, our balcony had a spiral staircase up to a rooftop deck (there was no patio furniture on rooftop deck, but the main patio did have furniture). I would highly recommend the top floor room... The bottom floor room had a spiral staircase down to the ground, and the middle floor only had a balcony. Our room overlooked the beautiful pool area. The hotel was located a little far away from Duval and Front St, however the hotel does offer complimentary hourly shuttles downtown. We also brought bicycles with us... We used them once to pedal downtown (it was roughly 3.5 miles each way, and in the July heat was not that enjoyable of a ride). Overall this hotel exceeded our expectations, the rooms were huge and quiet. The shuttle met our needs to go back and forth from downtown. The pool was clean and warm. There is a "beach", but it is built on top of a retaining wall, so their is no direct access to the gulf waters. We found this slightly annoying until we found out that Key West has no natural sand beaches, and the one beach they do have (Smathers Beach) is entirely man made. The pool was more than adequate and the lack of gulf access did not negatively affect our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Defintiely Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: JessicaAmmons
Reviews.Content: My huband and I decided to spend our honeymoon at the Marriott in Key West.....we compared it to lots of other resorts but some of the prices of other places were outrageous. The Casa Marina and Reach Resort had similar room prices, but I kept reading about all the little charges that people unexpectedly received when they checked out. Being the frugal person that I am, I did NOT want to be unhappy at the end of my honeymoon because of lots of little charges. We knew the Marriott charged for daily parking, but that was fine. Most places did, it wasn't uncommon. The fact that they provided a shuttle every hour worked perfectly for us, and was ALWAYS there. Just make sure you're ready to leave at 5 til the hour and ready to come back to the hotel from downtown at 15 after....they don't hit the 20 minutes after every time, but they're pretty close, and will come get you. It beats having to find a parking spot downtown and then paying to park there too! When we got there, they asked if there was a special occasion. When we said honeymoon, they gave us the choice of complimentary drinks (soda, a half bottle of wine, etc) and some type of food. We opted for the pint of Haagan Daz ice cream, and it was sent up immediately. Although the pool was busy with lots of children, I can't complain about it at all. It was big, and I regularly had staff come ask if I needed anything, such as food, towels, an umbrella, etc. Our only complaint was the price of dinner the one night we ate in the hotel. But, I guess we can't complain too much because when we said it was our honeymoon when we made the reservation, they gave us breakfast vouchers for 2 mornings worth, which was really nice. We stayed in a suite which had a view of the pool and ocean and was very pretty. We also paid a little extra but figured if we were down there, why not go for the view! All in all, we had a great time, enjoyed our stay, and would definitely go back there and/or recommend to any friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: vacationguy2010
