Reviews.Content: I was there from June 19 till June 26, Overall: very beautiful Hotel, it is a 4 star hotel, The Best Thing: the Restaurant --- By Far one of the best Restaurants I've even been, We ate there four of the 5 nights we stayed there.. the food was just so well done. it has been rated to be the 2nd best restaurant of all the Marriott in North America.. The Worst Thing: The beach --- or should i say the Lack of it. Key west is not known for its beaches.. **Service: was excellent we loved the staff and they did they job **Rooms: beautiful clean , spacious.. **pool: was clean **checkin/checkout : smooth .. except be careful that they charge for parking .. i didnt know that.. but i talked the manager and asked him to waive it and he did. saved 100 dollars right there! ** no bugs as far as i saw

Reviews.Title: “Better places to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: hotelsnob4u
Reviews.Content: The check-in and check-out were aweful. No customer service skills at all. We booked a standard king room and contrary to other reviews were not given a complimentary upgrade even though only 1/3 of the hotel was booked. Prime rooms sat empty the entire time we were there. The standard king room is off of the 1 bedroom unit. It is a shoebox. The smallest room I have ever stayed in the Keys. The worst part is the window looked out onto the hallway (very Motel style) and you couldn't leave the blind open as people are always walking by. To get anywhere in the hotel, the pool, the lobby, the shuttles, the beach , the restaurant, you have to walk through the garage. That gives this hotel a motel or condo feel to it. My husband and I go to Key West every year for our anniversary. This hotels only acknowledgement to our anniversary was at check in when the agent rudely said since it was our anniversary he would let us upgrade to a 1 bedroom suite for 100.00 per night. The pool was no fun, the beach was aweful, not worth walking out to and the view of the beach is ruined by the landfill mountain to the right. We had to call down to have our room cleanded every day as it was not done by the time we came back from the day at 4:30pm. We have stayed at many other places on Key West. If you are looking for a good Key West vibe, pampering and a nice resort feel go to the Casa Marina or The Reach.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful suite & pool, limited beach”
Reviews.Author: magmom51
Reviews.Content: We used Marriott points to book at this resort. We had a very plush one bedroom suite with complete kitchen and balcony. All linens and decor were wonderful. They provide local transportation to Mallory Square throughout the day. But there's really nothing close by to walk to. You would need a care to explore Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: hjslaw
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Key West and having no reservation decided to check out a few places based on the TA reviews. We started with the Marriott because it's right at the entrance of town. Front Desk was nice and immediately offered a special rate for three nights. We were shown the suite on which I will comment later and then decided to think about it while checking out some other hotels. We were at Casa Marina , very nice but apparently the front desk and their computer did not find all available rooms (see my separate review) so we moved on. To make it short, Southernmost is very nice if you pick one of the newly remodeled rooms which are gorgeous but come at a stiff 400$, Reach Resort has also nicely appointed new rooms but the lobby area and the ways to the rooms are not five star and show some fatigue. For lesser money the Paradise Inn looked absolutely ok and well located but looking for some more pool and outdoor space we headed back direction Marriott. On the way we checked out the Parrot Key which is a beautiful property albeit the sister hotel in Marathon, the Tranquility Bay where we had lunch before, was more impressive. Back to the Marriott: We checked in and took our car down the way to the parking which is conveniently located underneath the room levels. Some reviewes complained that this gives the place a motel like atmosphere but I would rather call it a condominium style. You don't have to carry your bags from the parking, help was offered but we didn't need it. The stairways and doorways were all very clean and albeit not posh looked very nice. The one bedroom suites are vast. They have a full kitchen, dryer and washer which is very convenient if you are on a multi-stop trip. Great bed, superb bathroom. Nice balcony with a separate sundeck on top, however you would have to carry the loungers up the stairs if you want to bask in the sun on the roof. We had a view to the pool which is big for Key West standards and a partial view to the gulf side of the ocean. Yes, the beach is manmade and not suitable for swimming but with a car you can easily access other beaches within 10-15 minutes ride. The restaurant served excellent cocktails and very decent food. Small downsides are the lack of a minibar and that room service due to the size of the property takes very long to get to your room. It is also not available 24/7. Overall, this is a very good hotel for the traveller who is mobile. They also have a shuttle to downtown but as with all shuttles you know that they never run when you really need them. I highly recommend this place if you are looking for great accomodation and like to live independently while at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Get away”
Reviews.Author: JohnBrentwood
Reviews.Content: This is a nice resort. Not 5 star but everything you need. We stayed in the ocean/bay view king suite. Full kitchen with sub zero fridge. Nice view. Not ocean but about as good as you are going to get in Key West. They have a man made beach beside the pool. Cabanas, pool service, great pool bar, huge pool with lots of chairs. Really a nice property. The Hotel is approx 3.5 miles from downtown. The shuttle leaves every hour on the hour and picks up downtown at 20 after the hour. This worked perfectly for us. We only ate at the restaurant in the hotel for breakfast. The morning buffet was good. I would certainly stay at the resort if back in Key West. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic but far away”
Reviews.Author: creazyara
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoyed my stay at Key West Marriott. Beds are great, staff very responsive, good food at their restaurant. Hotel is located right at the town entrance so it is pretty far away from downtown. I hope they have a shuttle:). They have a nice little pool area and no real beach but its OK.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to be on the quiet end of the island...”
Reviews.Author: la8780
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty new. It is near the airport, and away from Duval, which was perfect for us because we were there during college spring break. They have shuttles running every hour and they were packed - get in line early! Definitely upgrade to the suite if you can - the rooms are huge, and they have a full kitchen, separate dining area, large sofa, and a great balcony facing the pool. Be sure to ask for a room that doesn't back up to the main street - it is very busy/ noisy. The standard king rooms are pretty nice, but much smaller than the suites. Suites share a small entry-way with standard rooms, but have separate locks, which would be ideal for a family with older teenagers or college-age kids. Don't expect a beach - there is only a tiny patch of sand - but the ocean views are beautiful. The pool is great, except for the multiple weddings booked at or near the pool while we were there - three in fact, in one weekend! The food was ok. The restaurants were typical hotel fare. We dined out every night. The concierge seemed clueless about the pricing of restaurants, what to wear there, etc. She also had no idea that Mallory Square had been closed down, even though that is a huge tourist spot. Overall, a fun place to stay if you are with a group of couples who want a quieter experience in Key West. I would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Marriott Beachside with our 1 year old.”
Reviews.Author: jhberarducci
Reviews.Content: First a few things about us. We are frequent travelers and use Trip Advisor extensively to select accommodations for personal travel. This was our third vacation with our 13 month old son. I selected Marriott Beachside because they offered one bedroom suites with a kitchen and they were well rated on Trip Advisor. The hotel was lovely, the staff attentive and the pool was very enjoyable. Overall, I found the accommodations to be fabulous. However, I have a couple comments that I didn't read in others reviews that I think are noteworthy: 1. This hotel is at the intersection of Rt 1 and N Roosevelt. This is a very busy intersection...and consequently, fairly loud from a street noise standpoint. If you are in Building 2, which is directly next to S. Roosevelt, it can get kind of loud, especially if you are in a room closer to the lobby. However, you don't hear the road noise from the room, only from the balcony. I was kind of surprised that this had not really been mentioned in any of the other reviews (that I read). 2. The rooms are beautiful and have marble floors. The marble floors look nice, but are kind of dangerous from a toddler standpoint - we had a couple faceplants and head knocks that resulted in some bumps and bruises. The minute you spill anything on the floors they become very trecherous and slippery. They are also impossible to keep clean. I found myself wearing socks because the floors were rather gritty. Housekeeping would clean them everyday, but it seemed as if as soon as they cleaned them, they were gritty again. Overall, I thought the hotel was great...just a couple of minor things I wanted to mention.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and comfortable place to stay to avoid Key West madness”
Reviews.Author: cnalsc
Reviews.Content: We started our Florida tour with two nights in Key West at the Marriott Beachside Hotel. We had the standard room, which had lovely furnishings and was quite comfortable and mercifully quiet. Lighting was good in the bathroom and there was plenty of bathroom storage and counter space. The staff was very helpful and accomodating. We didn't use the pool, gym or beach but they all looked nice. The courtesy van to Duval Street made it easy to access the tourist area. Two warnings: portions in the restaurant are enormous, and some of the clientele may tend toward the spring break boozy types, so you might want to avoid at certain times.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...place was awesome”
Reviews.Author: ronc815
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Marriot from May 5-7th and we were blown away. We had a standard room but it was beautiful and modern and we loved the parking directly under our building. We had a great time at the Tavern N Town and the manager was awesome! Breakfast was good as well and our waiter Rodrigo was top notch. We Will be coming back every year and using this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a fantastic stay in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelerPhoenix
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 6-night stay at this hotel, our 2nd time in the last year, and was impressed again. This is truly a great hotel away from Duval. Rooms are spotless, quiet and very well appointed. Staff is conscientious and service levels are great. We had the one-bedroom suite which came with a washer and dryer - a great extra in the Keys. I travel over 100 nights a year for business and this is truly an outstanding hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Pool”
Reviews.Author: Dana4U
Reviews.Content: Once again we had a great experience at a Marriott property. Everything about this trip was relaxing and the hotel staff are very attentive. We flew into Key West and the airport shuttle was there five minutes after we called. Check-in at the front desk was smooth and efficient. The shuttle drivers into the city were friendly and curteous. I always rode shot-gun so I could talk to the shuttle drivers and get the low down, if you will, on local happenings. Pool wait staff are prompt but not pushy. Housekeeping comes twice a day with fresh tools. They clean the room in the morning and then turn down service in the evening. Very friendly housekeeping staff as well. Concierge got us dinner reservations each evening at the restaurants we selected and at our requested time slots. This place is a well oiled machine and the attention to detail and outgoing demeanor by the entire staff is among the best we have experienced (on par with Four Seaons). Keep up the great work! We look forward to our next stay. Oh yeah - great room location. Had room 116 and the view and location were awesome. We will be submitting a similar review directly to Marriott as well.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: wishIwerestillonvaca
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Beachside 4/17-4/24 and LOVED it! We are from Michigan and when he asked me where I wanted to travel to celebrate my 40th birthday I said someplace warm and relaxing. We checked other Marriott properties in other locations and decided on the Beachside. We booked our room on points and paid a small fee to upgrade to the one bedroom suite. We were NOT dissappointed at all! Our room was beautiful.. it was on the third floor with a private roof top sunning area above our balcony. We had a gorgeous view of the ocean and spent a LOT of time resting, reading and napping in the comfy furniture out there! Good going with the ceiling fan out there!! Made it nice & cool in the shade! Inside the room was so spacious and comfortable. Full kitchen including a washer and dryer (came in very handy!!). Dining area, living room, bath and 1/2 and master bedroom fit for a king.. the master bath was wonderful too with the HUGE tiled shower area and jacuzzi tub. Not one thing was forgotten in laying these rooms out! We thorougly enjoyed the pool and beach area and spent a lot of time laying in the lounge chairs reading and sunning. The pier on the beach was often a nice quiet place to go and watch the water for while. It was so quiet and relaxing that it was hard to believe that we were just off the main route on to an off of Key West. The shuttle service to Duval street was very convenient and while we missed the last run a couple of nights having too much fun downtown the cab fares weren't too bad to get back to the hotel (Under $20). The drivers were always entertaining and had a lot of information about the area and suggestions on things to do and see. The maid service was wonderful.. cleaning our room top to bottom ever day! Even hand washing dishes if there weren't enough in the diswasher! I asked for extra wash clothes one day and had plenty every day after that! Very friendly and accommodating!! Being Marriott Plantinum members we were given free breakfast buffet every day of our stay and it was very good. Made to order omlettes, delicious fresh fruit (LOVED the pineapple) and tons of other selections. We also had our last dinner at the Tavern & Town and it was incredible. Pretty pricey but worth it! The Key Lime Pie was the best I had the entire time! We used the fitness room one morning we were there but decided after that to take morning walks on the nice wide sidewalk along Route 1 and see more sights. We signed up for the Jet Ski tour that is on site and really enjoyed that experience a lot. We even saw dolphins! I can not think of one thing I could or would complain about for this trip.. except to say I had to check out and come home. We hope to someday get back to the Beachside. We have never felt more relaxed coming home a vacation.. not to mention having great tans ;) Thank you Beachside.. Keep up the good work!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service! Gorgeous, spacious suites.”
Reviews.Author: xina1019
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Key West last week for our babymoon. We read reviews here that shared how helpful the staff is and what to expect with the free, hourly hotel shuttle. We also were advised about booking a suite vs. a room, which we did. Thanks! Every staff member we encountered from the booking process through our check out was courteous and helpful. We appreciated the convenience of the hotel shuttle, although guests got very testy when waiting for the vans. Every time we left the hotel to go to Duval Street or to return, the hotel brought two large vans and most times, everyone fit. The beach is small and there's not swimming access, but it was perfect for us. We loved the cabanas (we never had trouble finding one) and the pool was such a great temperature. I enjoyed staying by the beach or pool until late afternoon and then heading to Duval Street for dinner and to walk around. The suite was amazing! It's huge (apartment sized) and new. We had a full kitchen, a living room, a dining table, a balcony with furniture, a giant bedroom, a whirlpool and two bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but noisy”
Reviews.Author: aidansgrammy
Reviews.Content: Even though my companion & I were only there one night, the resort was beautiful but a little out of the way from downtown Key West. We were part of a group who had been there two night prior to our arrival. We arrived in Key West on Saturday via the Key West Express and all we wanted to do was rest. The shuttle from the ferry station was a far walk (with luggage) to Margaritaville on Duval St, the scheduled pick up location for hotel guests. Fortunately, the shuttle arrived about 5 min after we got there. We checked in and after trying to find our building, finally got to the unit and tried to rest up. Because the buildings are so close together with a "courtyard" in between, everything echo's. Between housekeeping pushing carts across the bumpy hallways and the kids yelling on the first floor, needless to say we did not get any rest. We had reservations for dinner at a restaurant on the water, and were guaranteed there would be two vans available to take us downtown. When the first shuttle van arrived, other guests got on and they didn't have room for us. After complaining to the front desk, they ended up calling for 2 taxi vans to take us downtown. The hotel picked up the tab, but apparently the same thing happened the night before. When you want to return to the hotel and if you miss the last shuttle at 11:20 pm, or if they don't have room for everyone, you have to take a cab back to the hotel. This runs anywhere from $20-25. Our group had 7 room booked, and at the price/room, the hotel should have provided what they said they would when the rooms were booked. The rooms were beautiful, but between all the noise and the infrequency of the shuttle, I would stay closer to town and probably depend on other means of transportation to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Addition to the Marriott Family!”
Reviews.Author: urbnchic
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 8 days in Key West, where we stayed at the Beachside Resort. We had a 3 bedroom, 3 bath which was very spacious and well done. We could not have been happier with the suite. It far exceeded our expectations. We had a resort view (pool view), with our own stairs to the pool. That was great because the kids could go down to the pool, and I could see them directly off my patio. The downside that we don't remember reading ANYWHERE, or that is NOT posted, is the pool is 24 HOURS! Luckily my children's rooms were not closest to the pool, but our master suite was, and on 3 different occasions, we were woken up at 1:15 AM, 2:30 AM and 4:00 AM!!!! In our opinion, there is NO reason for the pool to be open 24 hours. The main reason we chose the Beachside was the location...away from Duval and all the noise. Although security took care of the each phone call, it was distrupive to say the least. The suite offered wired internet, that didn't work for the first few days. The staff was great to respond each time, but just a hassle to deal with. For the amount you pay per night, you should have wireless in your suite. Overall, the resort was wonderful. The small problems we had won't deter us from staying here again. But I would recommend they change their pool policy. Open 24 hours, seriously?!?!?

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: milesfriend
Reviews.Content: We were here on a delayed honeymoon. We were upgraded to a suite. The suite was unbelievable! It was big and bright, and had a nice covered deck overlooking the pool and the sea. The service at the hotel was extraordinary. We ate breakfast in the restaurant and it was very good. We would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Luvin2trvl
Reviews.Content: I have to say, my fiance and I were a bit nervous of having our wedding party stay in the front of the island, but it was the best decision we had made. We just came back from our wedding n Key West and have received nothing but the best reviews from all of our guests. We had everything from large families, to couples, to individuals traveling down for a few days and they were amazed at the room accommodations. The 1 bedroom suite we stayed was decorated beautifully and lets not talk about the jacuzzi :) I can't say enough about how friendly the staff was and how accommodating there were up to the last detail. I would recommend the hotel to anyone looking for a great getaway and close enough to the madness we all know of in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive Descriptions-Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: momwithtoddler
Reviews.Content: The "beach" water is not swimmable (there is a big No Swimming sign). Its murkey, fishy Atlantic water that is 6 feet below the sand and pier level of the "beach". The heated pool was an ok substatute. I thought I booked a sutie but got just a bedroom (for $237)!!! If I knew what I know now, I would have stayed someplace else. The buildings are scattered accross the grounds giving it a motel feel. . When we got to our room, the first thing we noticed was the brown stains on the blanket, The room attendance got it out right away but the damage was already done. Its far avawy from Duval St and main attractions Other than that the room was just ok, not worth the price. The web pics are very deceptive. I would not recommend staying here. The food at the restaurant was the only good thing-fine cuisine at its best, but anyone can dine there, you don't need to be a guest. Save your money!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Marriott in Key West”
Reviews.Author: kuvinnie
Reviews.Content: The Beachside Marriott is the nicest of the brand on Key West. We upgraded ot the one bedroom suite. We were lucky to have the top floor with the spiral staircase to your private roof deck. The upgrade was worth the money. Our suite had a full kitchen, dining room/living room, with a master suite. Our view was above the pool. The hotel has a free shuttle service(on the hour) to downtown Margarittaville-takes about 15 mins. And then the return leaves(from Margaritaville at 20 mins past the hour). This is a great benefit but it was always packed. My wife and I rented a 2 person scooter from the concierge for about $120 and was great. Highly recommend a scooter to those who stay at the Beachfront. You can see more of KW and easy to park.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: buffalobuts
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Marriott Beachside for our 20th wedding anniversary. Pros: Great bed. Clean rooms and well appointed. I didn't have to ask for anything. Pool was nice and the poolside service was great and plenty of towels and no problem finding a lounger. The hotel is set up in such a way that you feel you are far removed from the hustle and bustle of the busy street right outside the hotel. Food at the restaurant was very good, but a little pricey. Cons: Parking - they charged almost $20 per day - totally unecessary. Location - it is miles from Duval, but the hotel does a great job shuttling guests back and forth every hour. Price - we used priceline and paid $210 (plus taxes/fees) per night for a regular king room - no view or extras, so I thought maybe $150 per night would be a more reasonable rate for our room type. They do have suites, but when using priceline, those are not offered. (tried to get a free upgrade for our anniversary, no chance - but they did offer us 2 free drinks and a choice of snack) Overall it was a very nice stay and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: hangovergirl67
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Key West Beachside Hotel. We had a great time. The accommodations were really wonderful. We had two bedrooms 2.5 baths and full kitchen. Very nicely done. Large bathrooms, large deck, flat screens. The concierge and staff were very helpful. We had a sitter 2 nights-which they recommended so my husband and I could go to dinner. She was very sweet-a nanny during the day. Kids loved her. The location was good for us-especially with it being Spring Break. We were able to get out of the craziness when we needed to-since our boys are 7 and 3. Also enjoyed Town & Tavern and our bartender. I think his name was Richard. Blue Bar staff great as well. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MrsMuldrow
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great!!! My husband and I really enjoyed everything. We stayed in the one bedroom suite overlooking the water in room 526A. It was like home with extra amenities. The staff was great and we also enjoyed a jet ski tour on the hotel property. We will definitely be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharmCity79
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were married on the beach at the Marriott Beachside in February, 2010. Our experience with the hotel, including the wedding portion and our guest room, was absolutely perfect. The one-bedroom suite was AMAZING. Great porch with great view, clean room, comfy couch, full kitchen, great beach and pool. The service was great, the food was good, the grounds are beautiful. We had several deliveries come in during our stay, and each was quickly brought straight to our room. As for the wedding itself, everything was exactly right (Thanks, Angela D)! The ceremony and reception on the beach was set up beautifully, all the various vendors were coordinated by the hotel flawlessly, the food was delicious, staff members were plentiful and helpful. I cannot say enough good things about the Beachside. We will return there in the future, and I recommend it for group functions and/or vacations in lovely Key West! They went above and beyond to make sure we had the perfect day. I do suggest flying right into Key West, instead of driving from the Miami area... the airport is only a mile from the Beachside and the shuttle will pick you up.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service and Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: wmandmj
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first visit to Key West. 3 couples traveled to enjoy the sun and have some fun. We had first class accomodations and our requests were handled professionally and promptly. The shuttle is fantastic.....and prompt. We had a 3 bedroom suite, oceanview. Everyone was amazed at the size of the suite and the amenities it offered. We would definitely return. Thank You Tiffany for all of your help. The coffee pot was used daily and much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “SO AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: LisaM40
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay in Key West at the Beach Side Hotel and the room was just beautiful! We had a one bedroom suite and would definaltley go back. I would choose the rooms on the 3rd floor because they have stairs to a roof top balcony. I just loved Key West and the Marriott was terrific! I would recommend Wi-Fi to this hotel, being stuck at the desk was the only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: NCTraveler245
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a quick getaway. We used Marriott points and at first we were placed in a small, virtually windowless room that was very dark and appeared to be a moderate hotel room. We were fairly disappointed and decided to ask the front desk if we could be upgraded since we had gold status. They explained that the hotel was full and my husband said he understood but if they had any cancellations or if a suite became available to please call him. He went to the bar for a drink and the front desk clerk came and found him to tell him that a suite had become available. The suite was unbelieveably huge and beautiful. There was a full service kitchen with everything you would need, a full and a 1/2 bath and a spacious living and bedroom. We also had a balcony with comfy patio furniture to sit outside and overlook the pool from. Overally, we had a great stay. I definitely recommend the hotel if you are staying in a suite and are okay with being a 5-10 minute drive from Duval Street. The hotel shuttle was a great perk.

Reviews.Title: “its a marriott!!!”
Reviews.Author: olenabklyn
Reviews.Content: Marriotts are great, nice clean rooms, flat screen tv, free wifi, great bathroom. Nice pool area, and nice lil beach. It was a little cold, so we didnt go into water. i would probabaly suggest just hanging at pool. Free shuttle to duval st, which is nice no need to drive. Just a few annoying things: you have to call for ice, no do it yourself. waiting like 40 min.. not fun. And almost $20 for parking.... WTF...

Reviews.Title: “Better Options in Key West”
Reviews.Author: hypnoticrichard
Reviews.Content: First it is 2010, and so I ask the question: "You seriously have wired internet at a 400 a night hotel, and so I cannot use two laptops nor surf the internet in bed??" Second: This is Florida. You seriously mean to tell me the hotel has no Ice machines and I need to wait 30 minutes for room service to bring me a bucket of ice? third: The location sucks. it is not the most serene part of the island, it is right at the entrance and the furthest point from anything. Fourth: The name "Beachfront" *IS* misleading. I noticed the courtyard calls itself "Waterfront hotel". Much more accurate. Beachfront implys a beach, and although the small beach created for sunbathing is nice, as are the pools, there is a BIG difference between BEACHfront and WATERfront..... Do not arrive expecting a "beach" as one would imagine a beach to be. Fifth: Parking is $17 a night. Parking seems to be a problem on the island, but not at the hotel, they have plenty of parking. So why charge a parking fee? because they can. Sixth: The hotel is actually a converted apartment/condo/timeshare thing. everything is spread out in different buildings like an apartment complex or motel. That was OK but a little weird.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: 1Laura
Reviews.Content: We came seeking sun and found so much more! My husband and I were sorry we were only able to stay one night. We stayed in a King room with no view but the room was lovely and very comfortable. We appreciated the friendliness of the hotel staff. We took the hotel shuttle to town and after enjoying the sights we looked forward to relaxing in the gorgeous surroundings of the pool and beach at the Beachside! The only downside was the $17 parking fee. We would definitely love to return.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: onetightwad
Reviews.Content: Wow!! We were blown away with the gorgeous suite when we arrived via motorcycle. We had rented a Harley-Davidson motorcycle in Miami (after flying in) to drive down to the Keys. It took us about 4 hours and maybe because of our ages (50's) it seemed longer!! My achey and tired bones were overjoyed at the sight of the big deep jacuzzi in the room and the cotton robes. The room was spotless!! The staff had thought of everything except scented bath oil. The room was the size of a small apartment and very exquisitely decorated. Had I known there was a washer/dryer in the closet I wouldn't have packed so heavy. Remember, we came on a motorcycle with just saddle bags for our gear/clothes. I wished we had planned to stay longer after I saw the room.The kitchen was so nice that I felt like throwing a meal together and coming from a woman who hates to cook that is something!! We didn't have any nice clothes with us to dine out so we decided to walk west on Roosevelt Street which has an ocean view the entire way. About 1 mile down we came to a grocery store (Publix) that carried a large selection of wine. After dinner in the suite we walked around the grounds. They are beautifully cared for and there is a small beach area with a small pier. It didn't look like an inviting place to swim, mainly because a bunch of dead fish were laying on the shore. We did ask about it and were told they had died because of the freezing cold spell Florida just had. We had noticed the stench on our drive down and had wonderd about the bad odor. The bed felt so good after the long ride and the soft, quality linen and plush down comforter were heavenly . The unit number was 219A and I don't know if all the units are similar or not. We did not have a water view but after a day on the bike we had seen enough of the ocean. The newness,cleanliness, no smoking and no pets policy were high on our list. We would definetly return. The Marroitt team did a tremendous job in designing,decorating,planning and caring for this lovely resort.

Reviews.Title: “It's all true!”
Reviews.Author: dkrubes
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the hotel for 5 days and 4 nights. Everything you read is true. It's a great place and well run establishment. Rooms are awesome. Service is outstanding. I'm a platinum member so I get spopiled alot, but this hotel seems to spoil everyone. From calling up for a DVD player, to a toothbrush, to dishwasher soap, to Washing machine detergent. It all cam fast and with a smile and with no hands expecting anything. The restaurant is very good. Breakfast is lovely and everyone is attentative and happy to serve. We were there when it was very cold....very, very cold. we managed to sit at the pool, but I'd have more to say about the pool if the weather had cooperated. Its a quick trip downtown, away from the hustle and noise. If I were a family or couple looking for more peace and quite....this is the place. If i were young adults looking to party hard, I'd have to be prepared to take cabs back as the sguttle stops running at 11:20PM back from Duval. Fitness center was small but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms, Lovely Resort”
Reviews.Author: anne7134
Reviews.Content: We planned on staying here for one night, but when we saw our room, we rearranged our schedule so we could stay for two nights. We stayed in a two bedroom suite with marble floors, a subzero refrigerator, a washer dryer (stocked with detergent and dryer sheets), comfortable beds and a beautiful balcony. Our suite was just over 1000 sq ft. The hotel is not in downtown Key West, but the shuttle was convenient and easy to use. The front desk staff was kind, helpful and friendly; they went out of their way to help us find the perfect neighborhood Cuban restaurant for dinner. The beach is not a good swimming beach, but the pool is lovely and comfortable. Great poolside bar too!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: cjnabq
Reviews.Content: We were in Key West for a family reunion, and decided to stay at the Beachside because of the reviews on this website. Also, we did not want to stay right in downtown Key West, and liked the idea of the free hotel shuttle into town. Right from check-in everything about the hotel was great. We were upgraded to a suite for the entire week of our stay. It was beautiful - granite countertops in the full kitchen, fantastic walk-in shower and jacuzzi tub in the bathroom. On our first day, we needed to drop our hire car off at the local airport, and the hotel sent the shuttle out to pick us up afterward. Joshua Horton, the front office manager, and Patrick who works on the front desk were so helpful and friendly - nothing was too much trouble. If we are ever in Key West again, we would definitely stay at the Beachside.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PlainJenny
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in Key West for 10 nights and away from Duval St. to relax... This hotel was great! We got the suite and it was really awesome. It was a luxury one bedroom apartment! Full kitchen and laundry room. It was very specious unit. The price was cheaper than small rooms around Duval St. Yes, the hotel is about 4 miles away from the Duval St but it is well worthed to stay here. They have shuttle service every hour that we used it at nights. We had our bikes with us so biking to downtown was the best option. It takes 20 mins to reach Duval St. Bike trails are by the water so it is very relaxing bike ride. Hotel staff were very friendly. They cleaned the rooms very well and even did the dishes! Lobby was very helpful on our questions. They gave us good tips on where to go and have good time... Hotel's restaurant was seriously really good. One of the best Key Lime Pie you can get on the island! (we tried key lime pie every day at different places). I got steak which was really good. And if you have two dinners bottle of wine is FREE! We are looking forward to stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms, Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: wonderlust86
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married in Key West and stayed at the Key West Marriott Beachside Hotel. Our room was gorgeous. Marble floors, compfortable bed, amazing bathtub. The only thing about the room I didn't like was our window view looked out into the outdoor hallway. The pool and pool area is extremelly nice. There is a little outdoor bar, pool, hot tub and little loungers under tents for your leisure. The staff were very friendly, however I had trouble getting room service to bring up ice to our room a couple of times. *** The bad thing about the hotel is that it is on the opposite side of the island from everything. They do offer a complimentary shuttle but anytime you want to go out to dinner or anything for that matter you have to wait for the shuttle to get back to the hotel (It leaves at certain times) My suggestion is stay at a nice place like this but closer to Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “First Class resort--with great folks...”
Reviews.Author: irishduane
Reviews.Content: I knew--coming in, that my stay at your resort would be during a "slow" time of the year. I arrived from Minnesota--so I was looking forward to great WEATHER! Additionally, I was staying on Marriott points--so I was traveling, rather cheaply. To the issues: 1. You were kind enough to upgrade me to a suite. Roman(front desk)was kind enough to accomodate me. Igor and Ashley were also stellar with helping me--with my silly/mundane/touristy questions. 2. The suite was simply the BEST suite I've ever stayed in! It was amazing! 3. Your maidservice staff was "first class!" They were prompt/attentive and wonderfully pleasant. Because I had a "private" exit to the pool, I forgot--a couple of times, to keep my front door unlocked--so they could do their jobs. When I called the front desk(due to my oversight)--they cleaned my room within 10-minutes. Amazing! 4. Your shuttle drivers were prompt/timely/and professional. I believe one of them was Billy(?). 5. The bartenders at the Tavern-n-Town were prompt and attentive. I don't recall their names, but they knew when I arrived(early evening), that I was ready for my Cosmopolitan. 6. Donna(pedicure gal)was soooo nice--with her lovely British accent...I enjoyed my hour with her(and getting my feet scrubbed/tickled). 7. Lastly...and most importantly...Rachel and Ben were two of the best bartenders I've ever had the priviledge of interacting with--on a vacation. Ben was fun/funny/informative--and professional. Rachel is on-par with Ben...and(and from a single man's perspective) gorgeous, too! She is a sweetheart. Both of them encouraged me to "come back again--we'll be here." These two are special folks!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: ckypop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott in the beginning of December with 2 friends, whom which one of them works for American Airlines so he has a Platinum status at the Marriott's. We booked 2 rooms and got upgraded to a Suite immediately. We were a bit confused, but after checking with the front desk, we were assured, we have the same rate. The room was huge! It had a full kitchen, 2 flatscreen TV's, a conference table, a coffee table with a nice couch, a separate room with a queen size bed and 2 bathrooms, which one of had a bathtub and a shower. We also had a balcony that had lying chairs facing the courtyard on the 2nd floor. The great thing was, you could access the courtyard by going down the stairs on the balcony, so you wouldn't have to walk out and around. The front desk staff was attentive and professional, checking us in within a minute, but for some reason, gave us 3 extra room keys. Since I chose the couch to sleep on, I called the reception and asked for some extra pillows and a blanket. The room maids came up in a bit with a rather strange blanket that was pretty uncomfortable (it was like a big rag) and I was handed it over in a sealed plastic bag. That was a bit odd. The phones were cordless, making it easy to place calls, but a bit difficult to make the phone work and the handset was a bit too quiet. They also have a tikibar, a pool, jacuzzi and chairs next to the pool. The beach was pretty much something to laugh at with a small strip of sand, literally maybe about 25 feet wide and 10 feet tall. But Key West isn't known for its beaches anyway, so that's nothing surprising, nice try anyway. There was a nice pier with a view to the sea. Our friend stayed in the next room, which connected, and was a lot smaller, but still very nice. The downside was the Internet connection - they offer complimentary DSL, but no WiFi in the rooms, just at the pool. Fortunately enough, my laptop's wireless card is pretty good, so I caught a good signal from the pool when sitting on the balcony, not sure about the upper floors though. The hallways are a bit motel-like, they are on the outside and you have to walk to your room. A weird thing was, the balcony doors seem to be unlocked, as we got drunk one night and walked back into our room from the balcony stairs only to discover our friend disappeared with everything taken with him. Turns out, we went in the wrong room, which was completely unoccupied and nobody would probably have ever known if we stayed in the newlyfound Suite. We just walked out the door back to our own room. They also offer a complimentary shuttle to Duval Street, where all the action is, which leaves every hour and comes back at 11pm latest. It's quite far from Duval Street, so it's hard to get to the center of action without taking the shuttle if you're planning on drinking. Breakfast was good, they had servers to bring you coffee, tea and bacon and eggs if you wrote down your wish. I really enjoyed the cake there. Worth the visit!

Reviews.Title: “1st time Marriott stay ... worse experience ever!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: badguju
Reviews.Content: Well for my 1st experience staying in a hotel like this the day after thanksgiving... i would expected a bit more out of a hotel.... at 1st i thought i was getting a deal.... being in key west for an over night stay!!!! the room was ok.... thought i would use the internet.... not even wireless like other hotels.... had to use a land line.... and the best part bout it.... it did not even work.... call the operator and they said that they would send sum one in the morning which does me no good since i leave in the morning..... plus for the amount of money i paid.... i would at least liked a breakfast.... and they charged 20 $'s for parking and charged a tax i never even heard of.... and i got there @ 9:30 pm and checked out @ 8am the next day.... this is my 1st and probably last time ever in this hotel.... i would not recommend this hotel to anybody.... SORRY MARRIOTT... THIS STAY WAS NOT WORTH $200..... AND THATS MY PERSONAL OPINION.... i think i will stick to holiday inn or best western.... i at least get my money's worth while i stay there.....

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: JaneFLA78
Reviews.Content: Since we live in Miami, we drive to Key West quite often. We absolutely love this hotel. It's really clean, and everybody is really friendly. The rooms are gorgeous! The only downer about the hotel is that it's not close to the Key West action... Oh and that parking is $17 a day. However! They do have shuttles departing every hour to Duval. There's also the Coch tour operator right across the street. Since we drive down, it isn't a big deal for us to be right on Duval. I now only stay at this hotel when staying in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to stay in hotel”
Reviews.Author: abst14
Reviews.Content: This was the nicest hotel.....It was built in 2007 and still looks brand new. It's spacious and beautifully decorated. The suites are apartments with subzero appliances, large dining room, sectional sofas, large TV, jacuzzi's....more than we were able to utilize the two nights we stayed. I wish I didn't have to leave the hotel to work because it was very enjoyable. The only downsides are: If you get an ocean view you are far from the lobby. In a totally different building which makes using the business center or the lobby gift shop inconvenient. The night shift staff was not very attune to customer service - she couldn't access the copy machine or have any input as to why the printer wasn't working even when I explained that I needed some things done by 8 am and was told by the evening staff that the night staff could help (I wasn't going to arrive until 11 pm) She didn't even attempt to help but agreed that I could leave the documents and the paper I provided to make the copies and a note to call me at 730 am to come down for it. I also asked for a 715 am wake up call. At 6 am she calls to tell me they're ready. I would love to return to this hotel and spend time enjoying the resort.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: k51773
Reviews.Content: I met a group of friends in Key West we stayed at the Marriott Beachside. We had reserved two king bed rooms and were upgraded to a suite! The suite had a full kitchen, a dining room, living room, balcony, and half-bath. The suite was large and comfortable for our group. The pool was huge with many lounge chairs surrounding the area. There was a large hot tub and fitness center, too. There wasn't a real beach, just a sandy area near the water with a sea wall. There was a restaurant on premises, we only ate breakfast there. The breakfast buffet is pricey at $16.95 and not worth it if you are not a glutton who fills their plate to capacity several times. We found it best to order a single entree off the menu. You have to ask for the menu. We thought that breakfast was included in the room rate but when we arrived we were told it was not. We were there during fantasy fest and all of the rates were at least double what they usually are a week before of after the event. The hotel is located about 4 miles from Duval Street which was a good thing, as it gave us a place to escape the manic pace at fantasy fest. We would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Serene”
Reviews.Author: suze_9
Reviews.Content: Just got home and want to go back.... Our third trip to Key West, first with out children who are both in college. My husband and I both loved this hotel. I worked in the hotel business many years ago so i am a bit judgemental. Perfect hospitality, very clean rooms and beautifully decorated. I now want to redo my bathroom. The pool is quite romantic in the evening. We are already planning our trip nex year and will certainly stay at this very fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best...Friendly Service and Amenities Can't Be Beat”
Reviews.Author: cubsfan6263
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this place...I had a one bedroom suite, and it felt more like a home away from home than it did a hotel room. You have everything you need to be self sufficient - glasses, silverware, china, refrigerator/freezer with an ice maker, even a washer/dryer with detergent provided! Getting downtown is no problem at all with the free shuttle vans they offer - and if one fills up, the staff will immediately pull a second one out. Speaking of the staff, I can honestly say I didn't have one bad encounter with anyone. I have to give high regards to Matt, the bellhop/shuttle driver. He took the time to answer my many questions about getting around downtown, and was very knowledgeable. Also to Igor at the front desk for his excellent customer service skills. Both were extremely courteous/professional. The restaurant on site (Tavern 'N Town) is excellent...I recommend the baked chicken breast with truffle mashed potatoes, and Key Lime pie for dessert. Can't wait to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: travelingpatFlorida
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a getaway weekend. Had not been to the Keys before. This hotel is out of the Duval Street tourist area but they offer van every hour until 11 p.m. so that was not a problem. Only a short 10 minute drive to Old Town on van. Stayed in a gulf view suite which was gorgeous. The pool was beautiful. Did not use restaurant so can't rate that. The service and all the people working at this hotel were great and very accommodating. Small man made beach area - not really a swimming beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: nylenia
Reviews.Content: WEetook a family trip to Key West with my year old son, and this hotel was the perfect place for our family. The suite was beautiful with a view to the pool. The staff was really friendly and help made our vacation a good one. I will definetely will recomend this place. We can't wait to go again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: jma9
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Marriott Beachside with my wife. We were aware that the hotel was fairly far away from Old Town. We rented a moped and that made it much easier. We ended up staying in a 1 bedroom suite with a fantastic AAA discounted rate. The room was one of the nicest I have ever stayed in (I am MR Gold). The staff was very helpful and friendly. We had breakfast at the restaurant and it was excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone as long as you are aware that Old Town is a hike.

Reviews.Title: “Great place great manager ask for Joshua”
Reviews.Author: brandonlane
Reviews.Content: We travel constanly as pilots so when we went to Key West on a spur of the moment getaway we had not booked rooms. We went to the beachside Marriott and the Manager Joshua was one of the most pleasant, knowledgeable and helpful front desk persons either of us had encountered in quite a while. We had beautiful waterside lodging in their residences. The whole place is first class and very accomodating. We used the shuttle to go to the downtown area and back. We ate at A&B on the waterfront. Josh was right eat before six and our bill was half price. We ate at the pool bar at the Marriott and the food was very good.Nice Nice place We will be back Thanks for a great exerience!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: lzfowler
Reviews.Content: We knew going in that this was not close to downtown, but opted to stay here using our marriott rewards points to stay here, and then they upgraded us to a suite. Going during hurricane season does have some benefits. Our suite was bigger than anything we've stayed in before. It also had a full kitchen. Everything was very spacious and very confortable. The suite looked new and was well taken care of. We had a back balcony that overlooked the pool, with the ocean in the distance. The balcony had a spiral staircase down to the bar and pool area. The staff was very attentive and took great care of us. This suite was the most beautiful and fantastic place we have ever stayed. On top of the hosptiality of the staff, we would stay there again without a second thought. We had made arrangements for a rental car, and very much used it. We were there in the off season, so parking downtown was not a problem. The hotel does have a free shuttle to downtown that runs every hour, but we found we did lots of walking from the pickup/dropoff point and used the car for going downtown after the first day.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantasic Marriott Stay”
Reviews.Author: Diamond222
Reviews.Content: Key West Marriott Beachside is a beautiful hotel. One of the best run Marriott's I have stayed at.. (I'm a Marriott Groupie) We stayed for the week. I used my Marriott reward points and reserved a 3 bedroom pool view and I had our family upgraded to 3 bedroom oceanfront. Great room!!! 1 king, 1 king, 2 singles, then a pull out couch in living room. Coffee on the balcony every morning, looking at the Key West water and listening to the birds is my kind of vacation. I have 5 children. From college down to elementary school. This was our family vacation before school started. A great place to be to have time together. Beach is small, but the beach chairs are thick pads and when sitting in them, you are on your own private beach, literally. The pool is also perfect in every way. The pool service was excellent and the poolside food was delicious. The restaurant on site is also 5 star and perfect for a romantic evening (we left kids in room). We did rent a van since we landed in Fort Lauderdale (cheap tickets for 7 pp) which made touring Key West easier (But a good 4 - 5 hours drive). Duvall street is just a long street with lots of shops. We are not really into that sort of stuff, but a great place to walk after dinner with the kids and get an icecream cone from one of the shops. We did a day at Fort Zachary Taylor Park right there in Key West. A beautiful place with picnic tables and a beautiful beach and great rocks to climb for the kids. There is quite a bit of chunky like coral on the beach in some areas. But overall a beautiful park. The fort was a great afternoon little walking tour (right next to beach). Kids also loved this. We also spent a day at Smather's beach. This beach has soft sand and you could walk from one end to the other end in a short amount of time. So we walked back and forth several times and sunbathed. Nice relaxing day. Parking across the street was free. This Marriott treated us like I expected to be treated. Anything with the Marriott name should be run like this hotel. Cleaning service every day. The service provided us an ample supply of coffee for the coffee maker, shampoo and toiletries. The maid service also set up my children's stuffed animals so nicely on the beds, which they were so excited to come back to see how they were set up. Nice job! We brought a suitcase of our own food from home, but there is a large Publix Grocery store only minutes away with everything you could possibly need. I made all our meals in the room. I made several calls for things I needed, like a spatula, a cookie sheet, and an extra blanket, etc. and room service was there immediately. (7 pp need lots of things). The room service people were very nice about my many requests. I really appreciated that. The workout room is small, but nobody every used it much. The machines are set up in front of the windows looking out over the bay. A beautifully set up work out room. Nice shower room too and all the equipment was in excellent working order. Excellent hotel. We loved it and would go again. Overall and Excellent Family Vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: TripADave
Reviews.Content: This is the first hotel as you enter Key West. The rooms were very well furnished and maintained. We had reserved a 3 bedroom / 3 bathroom suite for 6 friends. One of the BR was small but it was as described on the hotel website so no surprises. The living room was roomy; one time we had about 12 adults in the room but it did not feel too crowded. The balcony off the living room is quite large and could easily sit 4-6 adults. The pool side was great and very clean and well maintained. The only downside is that there is no beach as advertised on the hotel website. It claims to have a 'private beach' but it is absolutely useless. The bay water is really dirty and you probably wouldn't even want to step in. Overall, a beautiful hotel was excellent rooms and service. A bit pricey but worth the extra $$.

Reviews.Title: “Nice... but Families Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Booder
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Priceline (name your own price)-it was one of the few "resort level" hotels in the area. We got a terrific price but there was a huge catch...our teenage daughters had to sleep on the floor! Be aware that if you book through Priceline that what you will receive will be: one room (part of a closed off suite) with ONE queen bed. This was not one of the options, as the hotel staff reiterated several times upon our check in: it is the ONLY option. The room was beautifully decorated and the bathroom was roomy, however the accomadations just do not work for a family of four. Luckily we were only staying one night so we made the best of it. There are NO typical "2 double beds" to a room situation unless you call directly to book the suites.-at an enormously increased expense. The amenities and pool /common areas were nice and the staff were professional. This hotel would be fine if you are a couple looking for a romantic place to stay, or have a young baby with a pack n play. However, if you need a second bed, you should call ahead to verify-particularly if you book online.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Snookbait
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, extra clean rooms, and a beautiful view of the Gulf. A true gem of Key West. Their restaraunt was great and very reasonable. Downtown was a $12 cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended - Clean and Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: weaselette32
Reviews.Content: The hotel is accessible to everything and has a beautiful view of the bay with a fairly decent beach. The rooms are very clean and well decorated. The service is top-notch. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting luxury with the comfort of home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort-room info”
Reviews.Author: Blonde49380301
Reviews.Content: We were there on our anniversary and used awards since my husband is Platinum. They did nothing special for our anniversary and originally placed us in a â€œstandardâ€� room. Beware that all standard rooms are part of a 2 room condo, with the standard room being the 2nd bedroom. All standard rooms have the same â€œviewâ€� NONEâ€¦.you look out your window to a concrete wall. We had arrived late the 1st night so we felt we would address the room situation the following morning. We did speak to a manager and he found us another room with a view which was overlooking a man made beach and the gulf; much more romantic for an anniversary. To make clear on the room set ups. When you unlock the door from the outside you walk into a very small foyer, straight ahead is another door that unlocks to the 1 bedroom suite with the full kitchen, living room, dining room & separate bedroom/bath. To the right or left depending on the location is the door that unlocks the standard bedroom which is fairly small with the one window that overlooks the cement wall. My advice is to make sure you ask or reserve the 1 bedroom suite. What I understand is that you can upgrade for 60.00 and get both rooms. We ate breakfast buffet daily ($16.00), the pool food was good but service could be slow, we usually just walked to the bar and ordered. Didnâ€™t eat dinner the restaurant so canâ€™t comment on the food, but another couple did and they said it was good. We did cook a few nights in the beautiful kitchen. We went to a fish market and bought fresh grouper fish off the boat and baked it with garlic butter and blackened spice along with a bottle of wine on the patio watching the sun set; very relaxing the best fish I ever ate! One last note, if parking a car the elevators are not marked and you can search for a long time trying to find them. That was a frustration for us and many.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: blondie801
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 days and 2 nights in early Dec (before the rates went up for season) for about $150 a night. It was absolutely gorgeous, and everything a honeymoon resort could be. The rooms were spacious, the tub and seperate shower were beyond our expectations as well. There was a shuttle downtown so we were able to catch a ride whenever we wanted. There was a full kitchen with top of the line appliances and even a tiny balcony where we could go out and look at the pool area. We did purchase the breakfast buffet in advance and for my husband it was well worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhhh, was okay...”
Reviews.Author: Rauzer
Reviews.Content: Nice place with an outstanding 4 star restaurant. Restaurant was so good that I ate 2 dinners and 2 breakfasts there (yes, of course it was expensive, but everything in the Conch Republic is...) Hotel was only half-full on my visit, but no upgrade from a room overlooking the street. Salt-water pool was nice, but crowded in the afternoon. Yes, I would recommend it without hesitation. My room was never cleaned during my two-day stay. I returned to my room at 3:00 PM and housekeeping had not been there. Highs: Room furnishings, quality, restaurant, "newness" Lows: Room size, somewhat busy-noisy location, housekeeping diligence

Reviews.Title: “Dont Expect An Upgrade...............”
Reviews.Author: TC11FL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just as it looks on the website. If you want a upgrade to a ocean view, be ready to pay for it, they are not eager to give you any upgrade at all. One of the best things about staying here is the bus that takes you to downtown Key West. There isnt alot of room on the bus so get there early. We paid for a suite, and it was the best. The bed was very comfortable but the maids are stingy with the toiletries so, you may have to go to the front desk to get something. Try and get breakfast buffet tickets when you check in otherwise you will be paying $16.95 per person. The pool was saltwater and it was very refreshing. While you are swimming there is a tiki bar where they will come serve you, but it doesnt stay open that late, wish it would of stayed open later. We paid 191.00 a night which is comparable for the area, but they and other hotels in the area offer a walk-in rate, so you may want to just wing it and see if you can get a better rate. There as a man that got a 80.00 rate for walking in, so that may be the way to go. All in all the hotel is very clean the suites are beautiful, but you are paying for it. I feel it was a great deal since the bus runs every hour. Saves alot on taxis. If your looking for a place with no children this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: momwithopinion
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in Key West, I was a little concerned about the location of the hotel. It was in a busy business area, not very tropical. I booked online with Marriott and didn't realize that they only offered king beds and we have an eleven year old, but that was no problem. They found us a "room" with a sofa. Opening the door, I was floored! We were given the most beautiful one bedroom suite. Usually the pictures on the website look so much better than the real thing, not this time! Ten foot ceilings, flat screen tvs, dining area, full kitchen, washer and dryer, 2 bathrooms.....truly AMAZING! The entire staff was wonderful. They offered great advice about some great local restaurants, which beach to visit, etc... The pool was beautiful with plenty of comfy chairs and umbrellas if wanted. The beach is man-made, but perfect for an hour or two of fishing. My son caught a hermit crab, two starfish, and several minnows. (Moms and Dads know that these are the things that make a vacation special) The location is pretty far from Duval Street, but the hotel offers a free shuttle which was actually enjoyable. Everyone on the shuttle was friendly and chatting about where they were from, where to eat, etc... Duval had lots of t-shirt shops and bars which are fun, but at the end of the night a nice, quiet, luxurious hotel is where you want to sleep. We stayed at the Loews Miami before driving to the Keys. It pales in comparison to the Marriott Beachside Resort. This Marriott is perfect for both couples and families. It is very family friendly, yet also very private and romantic. A great choice all around!

Reviews.Title: “A Top-Notch Place”
Reviews.Author: GingermomAllentownPA
Reviews.Content: Went for 4 days--2 nights were with Marriott points. Asked for an upgrade and they gladly gave it. What we got was a beautiful condo that overlooked the gardens surrounding the pool. The condo was very big, decorated beautifully and very comfortable. I would go back there in a heart beat. It is not located in the heart of Key West, but that was fine with us. We enjoyed the peace and quiet of being away from Duval Street. We had a full size sub-zero refrigerator and there are grocery stores very close. They have a shuttle that will take you downtown every hour and picks you back up until 10:00 p.m. The driver was very nice and informative. The pool is very nice and not at all crowded. Beach area looked nice although we stayed in the pool area. I don't believe there is access to the water from the beach, but that's the case with the majority of the hotels in Key West. Did not charge for parking and the parking garage is right under the building so very convenient when loading/unloading luggage, etc. All in all, I was very happy with this hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay - would do it again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: jpick1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days in late May. Room was lovely - about 900 square feet, with living room, full kitchen, marble tile floors, granite countertops, stainless appliances and washer/dryer. Very comfortable bed, 2 flat screen TVs mounted on walls that we barely used. Nice jacuzzi tub and big shower. 2 bath rooms. Overall, a very stylish and elegant room. Didn't eat dinner there, but the breakfast buffet was excellent, a bit pricey at 18 bucks, but you pay for quality. Only negative was they did not have any more Ethernet cables at the front desk. They said they'd bring me one and never did. But I was able to get a decent wireless connection from the pool hot spot. If you are the kind of person/people who want to be in the middle of the action in Key West, this place isn't for you. It's right at the north end of the island off of Route 1. You need to drive a couple miles to get to Duval. But personally, we didn't want to be downtown; most of the hotels down there looked seedy compared to where we stayed, except for the super pricey 5 star joints like the Westin etc. It was not a big deal to drive downtown and find parking. There are plenty of $10 lots, and you can usually find an open spot somewhere or meter parking. We drove downtown and parked 5-6 times at least. No big deal. Overall, we highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, clean and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Marmiesue
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 nights at this resort and thoroughly enjoyed it. It is a somewhat smaller Marriott thatn we're used to but this was a benefit - not so far to walk to anything around the resort. The rooms were very nice with pretty decor. Our balcony was right on the beach and at night we would sip our wine and enoy the atmosphere. The bartender at the pool was very friendly and directed us to some new drinks and some excellent restaurants. We had a free breakfast every morning at Gus's Grill where you could have fresh omelelets made. We did not have any dinners there as we preferred to drive out in the evenings and try the local restaurants which were very good. The Keys do not have the hustle and bustle of the bigger cities in Florida which made it a very casual, calm vacation and we will definitely be back to this Marriott. Although there is a beach on the property we did not swim in it as there was alot of plant life growing in the water but the sand was incredible with lots of palms trees for shade, some tiki huts and some hammocks and plenty of lounge chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: cdom
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was exactly what we were looking for during our "babymoon". We lounged at the comfortable pool, ate lunch at the pool bar, my husband used the gym, the concierge had good recommendations for local attractions (however tripadvisor is better) and overall the stay was excellent. The restaurant was great for breakfast - they gave us free buffet coupons for our entire stay! Our last two nights they upgraded us to a suite which was perfect - one of the nicest Marriotts I've ever stayed in and I've stayed in a lot. The shuttle to Duval was nice but we ended up renting a car in the end so we could kick around during the day. We enjoyed the drive out to Bahia Honda state park and loved our snorkel tour with Danger Charters. Use Danger if you prefer a more intimate snorkel tour over the groups of 50. This was our first trip to Key West but we will definitely return and stay at this Hotel again - next time with a baby!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Great Service, Lacking important Amenities”
Reviews.Author: katAtl
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a nice hotel. I travel all over the world for Work and stay in Hotels from 3 star to 5 star so I hope this reviews is helpful. The Rooms are fantastic Great bed, bathroom living room etc.. But I used points and we had a horrible location. I guess that is what you get for points. One weird thing, our room only had a coffee pot that made instant coffee, we had brought our own coffee grounds and couldn't use them so had to go out to get coffee. Now the rest of the resort, the pool is okay nothing special, the little bar next to the pool has good food and good service. One very disappointing thing was, we were there for a weekend and both days they closed the beach at 2:00 for weddings. I went there for the beach which is nothing to write home about. Another good point is they do have a shuttle that takes you to Duval street which is nice. Overall if you are not beach person than the resort is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great value!”
Reviews.Author: jplating
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights for Memorial Day weekend, this hotel is great. We used points for our stay but paid a few extra bucks to upgrade to a presidential suite which turned out to be a full condo! Great high end kitchen and washer/dryer, hottub, etc. Overall a great hotel, give it a shot! They have a shuttle to downtown that runs every hour all fday till 10PM too. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: CWils
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Florida had to include a trip to the Keys. I used tripadvisor to research hotels and the photos of this resort and its list of amenities drew me in hook, line and sinker. I was hoping that my room would look like the photos. Much to my delight, the room far exceeded my expectations! I stays in a 1 bdrm suite with a gulf view. The room was luxurious, spacious, and immaculate; full kitchen, dining room, living room, bedroom with a very convenient 1/2 bath in addition to the main bathroom. The balcony was by far worth the price of admission. The patio furniture was clean and comfortable; one of the most calming parts of the vacation. The other great part was the jacuzzi tub! It was huge! Having candles on hand to further the calming experience is highly recommended. The bedding was, as always, extremely comfortable. Some of the best of any hotel! Honestly, the room and amenities were so nice, I didn't see much of Key West! I do plan on going back some day and staying longer: to enjoy the hotel and the Keys! I cannot express enough how much I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ravennymph
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here on our honeymoon and we had an amazing time. The hotel room was fantastic. We stayed in a one bedroom king suite with a gulf view. The room was beautiful and we would have loved to to stay there forever. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. My usband enjoyed snorkeling in the gulf and the pool side bar was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great value- beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Odan745
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriot for 3 nights for our first trip to Key West. It is a beautiful hotel, and the rooms are pretty spacious and are very clean. The pool is really great- try for a room that has a private staircase going down to the pool if possible. The staff was very helpful, as Orbitz lost our reservation and the resort manager offered to honor the rate that Orbitz had given us even though the rates had gone up almost $200/night. The restaurant was good, but there are other much better places to eat around the island. Also- there is no ice machine, so whenever we needed ice we had to call room service.

Reviews.Title: “We are moving in!”
Reviews.Author: Pook09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay so much we have decided to sell everything and move here with our family. We loved our stay, we love Key West and were so impressed with the resort we are moving. Can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: MarcJordan
Reviews.Content: This outstanding property appears to have been built as a timeshare. Most of the buildings consists of 1, 2 and 3 bedroom suites with a few normal guest rooms mixed in. I was upgraded to a one bedroom unit due to my Platinum status in the Marriott program. The room was incredible and was the size of an apartment. Marble adorned the floors and bathrooms (of which there were two). We were placed in a room on the first level of building 3, which faced the pool area and our lanai had a circular staircase down to the pool. The kitchen of the unit contained high-end appliances such as a Sub-Zero fridge. Pots and pans are also supplied. The location of the hotel is just out of town along North Roosevelt Avenue. There is a very small beach area, but don't construe this as being a beachfront hotel. The pool area is very nice as well. The hotel provides an hourly shuttle into town for those who want to leave the designated driving to Marriott. Although the Marriott site says that self-park costs $20/day, there is no such charge and there is ample parking under each building. Valet parking, which doesn't make sense to me since it would mean having to walk to the main building, does cost $20 per day. Service was very good and courteous and the check-in was quick and efficient (thanks to Billy). Joe the concierge also gave us good tips on where to eat. In a nutshell, I can't wait to return to this property and it would be my number one choice when I return to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and wonderful "oasis" on the east side of Key West”
Reviews.Author: ScubaGuy_9
Reviews.Content: My wife and 8 month old recently did a long weekend at this Marriott. It was clean and beautiful with a nice pool and private beach. Not on the west side by Duval Street, but almost better: 1/2 mile from airport and around the corner from US 1...if you plan on traveling north to other Keys at some point. We were upgraded to a suite facing the pool as we are Platinum members. The rooms are clean and spacious. The staff was helpful in every way. The breakfast at Tavern N Town was excellent. The pool area was large with plenty of space for all. Marriott recently bought this hotel which used to be privately owned, so it feels like an upgraded regular "city" Marriott. (It is a Category 6). This was a great trip for us and our infant loved the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Girls getaway weekend”
Reviews.Author: kelliprettypink
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great. Went with my 18-year-old sister. Parking is covered so left car there and took the free shuttle to Duval St. Room was fantastic. Everything was great except for poolside service - drinks not good and COULD NOT get a staff person's attention to order food, which is overpriced. When I did go to bar to order food bartender 'forgot' to put order in when I came back 45 mins later to check on order and she kind of blamed me and didn't even apologize. SO - pool service left a lot to be desired. Also another downer- no fridge in standard room. Had to order ice everyday for the cooler bc there is no ice machine either. One more downer room service forgot a few things when we ordered bfast in. But I guess that can happen anywhere. So everything except for pool service and the lack of fridge was great. Room prices are great considering it's a luxury hotel. Hotel is just as pictured in the photos which is a plus. We didn't want to get out of that comfy marriot bed which they're known for. I looked at a million places it seemed before deciding on the marriot and am happy with the vacation. This place is for you if you're looking to relax during the day and take a short ride to Duval street to party and shop.

Reviews.Title: “Classiest "hotel suite" ever”
Reviews.Author: RoadJunkie
Reviews.Content: As with some of the previous reviewers, we were given an upgrade at check-in. Even so, when we walked in I thought there had to be some mistake. This was not a hotel suite - it was a condo, and it was gorgeous. Everything was done in travertine tile, huge rooms, looked to be brand-new appliances in the full kitchen, including a stainless steel sub-zero fridge, beautiful furnishings, I could go on an on. I viewed the location being away from Old Town as a plus, considering it took no more than 10 minutes to get there from the hotel, and you didn't have to worry about any noise from Duval St. As other reviewers mentioned, we experienced issues with the pool area. We went down at 9:45 am and every chair was already being used. It's not that the pool area is tiny; it's just that since Key West is not particularly known for its beaches, people are making use of the pool. The private beach at the Marriott is nothing to write home about...it has a nice view of a landfill across the water. (But if you want to try a beach in Key West, try the one at Zachary Taylor State Park - very nice, but take some water shoes, the coastline is rocky). Staff couldn't have been nicer, and we were given a card to get a free buffet breakfast during each day of our stay, which was great. The free parking underneath our building was also a very nice unexpected perk, because their website mentioned a $20 per day parking fee. We are already making plans to go back sometime before the end of summer, I really want to do a snorkeling trip. Sunset at Mallory Square is all it was hyped up to be. And when we go back, we're determined to get the same room we stayed at the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms, staff”
Reviews.Author: lovesgoodfood
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest suites I have ever stayed in - very modern, clean, open, and beautifully decorated. The location was a bit off the beaten path (Mallory Sq/Duvall St), but we had a car, and the Key is only 2x4 miles, so not a problem. Also, the taxis weren't expensive and more fun that getting a DUI! I never used the free bus, but saw that many folks did.
