The beach is not really a swimming beach - but, as stated in other reviews, KW is not known for beaches, so - good try Marriott. The pool was small and a bit crowded, but the staff was excellent. The suites need just a few items to make them perfect - paper towels, salt&pepper, sponge, coffee maker (that makes more than 1 cup at a time), and a broom. I was surprised to see there was no Key West Tourist book, like in almost all other hotels. There is a great FREE publication that would have been helpful - "Walking/Biking Tours of Key West" by Sharon Wells that we picked up at an art gallery. Every staff member, from check-in to housekeeping was nice, smiling and helpful. The workout room was very nice and I liked the fresh fruit! All in all, it turned out to be even better than I had thought.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: KJackson
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a suite/full-blown condo because it was our 5 year anniversary. FREE Parking! Really nice pool area and bar. Small beach area that now includes a swimming area not previously available at this hotel according to other reviewers. Not in the middle of Duval Street so you can get away from all the noise. Would not suggest eating at the restaurant as it was overpriced and there are lots of better alternatives. Otherwise, everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel rooms amazing, resort lacking some essentials!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler83
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were amazing. Our room was a 'upgrade' with a balcony, full kitchen, dining room tv, small bathroom on the side, washer/dryer, separate bedroom with a king size bed, hot tub, and shower, Our friends room on the other side of the resort was the same lay out. We later learned that many if not all the rooms are suites, so we aren't sure if the 'upgrade' was standard! The staff was incredible, nice, helpful. Both couples have 'status' with Marriott so we received a free AMAZING breakfast every day that was a wonderful way to the start the day! The free shuttle drops Marriott guests right downtown on Duval street (many shops, restaurants, attractions) every hour and picks up right there as well. The drivers were very kind, gave tours, descriptions of the island, and offered recommendations on restaurants/sites to see. Our only complaints was the pool was very small, there never was enough chairs (for the 6 day vacation we were never able to get a chair by the pool), and we often had to wait for 10-20 minutes for towels. Also, 'beachside' is a very generous term. It is beachside, but you wouldn't go into the water. You have to go to the other side of the island if you want to go in the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - but heres a tip”
Reviews.Author: dp123
Reviews.Content: Needed a place with 2 rooms as was travelling with a mate so decided on renting an apartment within the Marriott complex. These are separately owned apts but you get all of the amenities of the resort. The one we stayed in was even nicer than my apartment at home - it was amazing - (apt 117) - - it is rented by some company called Truman Annex Real Estate. It worked out nearly as cheap as getting a twin and was an amazing apt with its own private access to the beach. I wonâ€™t say any more about it but you can see the photos. Yep you are a few miles from Duval st but it is a $15 ride in a taxi and it believe they have shuttle buses - we had a car so didn't bother. One of the nicest beaches in the area is the nature reserve about 30 miles up highway 1 called Boca Honda or something - it has the name Honda in it - absolutely amazing - just take the turn to the left when you get to the T once you enter the part - serious turquoise water. A drive â€“ but worth it â€“ just b4 the 7 mile bridge which everyone should drive anyway as it is amazing As to the hotel â€“ check in were excellent, the apt was unreal. Own separate suite for the 2nd bedroom with their on door key. Jacuzzi in the primary bedroom en suite etc â€“ you get the picture As I said to my mate â€“ nicest apt I have ever stayed. Way nicer than the rooms I have stayed in in the 4 seasons but the resort is not 4 season standard â€“ just the apt (condo for US readers) Resort is grand/OK but the loungers do fill up fast and pool area small. Free parking and great waffle house opposite Oh - Duval St is nuts - was there for Paddys - me and my mate had such a good night too us 24 hours to recover

Reviews.Title: “Whats not to love”
Reviews.Author: traveling20
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for of 25th Wedding Anniversary. We were upgraded to a suite. It was like an uptown apartment. Beautiful clean rooms with a view of the beach and pool. Granite countertops, sst appliances with travetine floors, flat screen TV's and wonderful bedding. Very well done. The weather was absolutely beautiful. There was a wedding on the beach on Saturday night with a great DJ. Didn't crash the wedding but enjoyed the music. Wasn't close to Duval Street but the free shuttle ran every hour back and forth until 10:00 p.m. Was nice to get away from it all. The hotel was like a resort within a resort. The resturant was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: emmd_9
Reviews.Content: My husband and i booked the Marriot for one night thru priceline. We got a decent deal compared to other hotel prices we looked up on Key West. We didnt know exactly what to expect but the hotel is very new, clean, and feels a nicer then a 3 star. Our room was small but beautifully decorated and one of the cleanest I have ever been in. The only downside of the hotel is the location. It isnt near the heart of the Key West but a shuttle service is offered every hour. The shuttle seemed to fill up quickly but when it fills they offered us a ride in the hotel's suburban. The dining room/bar area is beautiful and we had a delicious breakfast there. The pool area is fantastic. While I have read some criticism of the hotel's "beach" area Key West is not known for its fantastic beaches so it was just as nice as any other hotel you would find on the key. The staff was friendly and accomodating We would love to stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: spark3075
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Beachside Resort & Conference Center and am 150% satisfied with my stay. I went with my sis for a relaxing weekend and the Marriott lived up to their promises. We booked our room through priceline and unfortch they couldn't uppgrade since they were sold out. But that's ok, the room was nice, spacy and clean. The location of the hotel is not in the heart of it all, but the shuttle takes you there. The last pickup is at 1020pm from Duval Street, but a cab ride back costs $15 one way. We drove to key West from Miami and there was no charge for parking ... another plus!! The restaurant in the lobby offered 2 for 1 drink specials from 4p-7p as well as 1/2 off tapas ... another plus!! The pool was a bit cold, but that was due to the weather being cool the weekend we were there. There were plenty of lounge chairs available as well as clean towels. I ventured off to see the beach and yes, it's a non swlmmable beach, but great place to sun yourself. I never made it to the fitness center as it was a R & R weekend for me, but there is one on the premises. I highly recommend this hotel for those who want to visit Key West. Leave you car parked there and jump on the shuttle to avoid the high cost of parking on or near Duval Street. Oh and you can't miss the Drag Show nightly at bar 901 at 9p and 11pm. $5 to get in and totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort in Key West”
Reviews.Author: emiller444
Reviews.Content: I am going to echo all the good reviews. We were upgraded to a beautiful suite - 1 bedroom, 1 1/2 bathrooms, living room, dining room , balcony overlooking the pool, 2 flat screen tvs, washer and dryer, full luzurious kitchen with granite countertops, nice cabinets, and high end stainless appliances. The staff were all friendly and helpful - the person at the front desk who upgraded us, both concierges, the shuttle drivers, and the maintenance man who came to adjust the temperature of the unit. We were there during a cold snap the very beginning of February so did not use the pool, which looked very pleasant. We had a car but did not use it during our stay. The shuttle van runs once an hour to the Old Town and that was much more convenient than finding parking. Although the hotel is on the water and has a sandy beach with chairs, it is not a swimming beach. We couldn't have been more pleased with all aspects of this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful suite and great service”
Reviews.Author: parrot21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for a conference, during a very chilly stretch in Jan, 2009. We booked the resort with a conference rate, for a king-sized room, but the front desk personnel were more than accomodating and upgraded us to a king suite, gulf view, for no additional charge. My philosophy for upgrades is always, "just ask". Generally speaking, good hotels will accomodate you if there is room. The suite was exquisite, fully-equipped kitchen, very comfortable living area, very comfortable beds. My only complaint would be the bathrooms - if you have any physical limitations, the shower/tub is very high and would be difficult to get in and out of. If you are staying here for any length of time, be sure to run to the Publix, which is located only about 1/4 mile down the road to stock up and use the kitchen. It beats pricey breakfasts and lunches out and the kitchen is beautiful, with everything you need. We never met anyone who wasn't more than willing to be accomodating. Our conference had a reception poolside, and although the pool bar closed, they re-opened and fully stocked the area to accomodate our group, with friendly (not hostile) servers. The concierge directed us to a great local spot for lunch, which I would highly recommend - Hurricane Joe's - it is within walking distance of the resort. Although it was chilly, we did manage to make use of the pool facilities, which are lovely. Service at the outside restaurant is good, food tasty and fairly reasonable. I agree with previous reviewers - no need to rent a car - we made extensive use of the shuttle service, which was always prompt and taxis into town are inexpensive as well, and very safe. We dined out frequently and each meal was better than the next, but I would highly recommend Santiago's Bodega (very good tapas restaurant) and La Trattoria (an Italian restaurant on Duval Street) that was phenomenal with a wonderful server and a great wine steward. We took the trolley tour and I'm not sure it was worth the pricey $25/person plux tax. Yes, you can get on and off the shuttle all day, but there were times we waited at least 20 mins for the next shuttle. It was informative, but I think we could have used our time better. First time visit to Key West and although we weren't convenient to town, for a relaxing experience, this resort does it quite well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: tennistraveler21
Reviews.Content: Our room at the Marriott in Key West was awesome. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a suite when we arrived, which had a full kitchen, dining room, living room, and 2 bathrooms. We found it to be quiet, comfortable, and luxurious. The pool area looked very nice, although we did not use it. The Marriott is located away from the center of town, so you will need to drive to get to the main areas (10-15 minutes). Also, although it is located along the water, it is not a swimmable beach area. The only problem we encountered was that the hot water did not last very long.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back - Relaxing but easy access to the heart of Key West”
Reviews.Author: msalow
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service....We did use our Marriott points but they were unbelievably gracious about it. They treated us as if we were fully paying customers. Great pool, lovely restaurant....Also, the free shuttle downtown allowed us easy access to the party and fine dining scene (there are a large amount of high end gourmet restaurants...you should know that!) I really like this location....I need an awesome pool area but also ability to get to the heart of things ....this had both. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: DiscoveryTraveler
Reviews.Content: Really good deal via Priceline. Excellent location and facilities. Did not have internet access cables available. Clean room, but a bit small. Very good shuttle service to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous modern apartment/suite”
Reviews.Author: MarleenLee
Reviews.Content: Two weeks before arriving, this hotel became a Marriott, so it is now under new management. This may mean a few changes...The most remarkable thing about our stay was that we got an enormous luxury apartment (living room, gourmet kitchen, dining room, king bedroom, one and a half bathrooms, balcony with a view of the water) for the price you would expect to pay for a regular room in central Key West. You may not be so lucky. The rack rate was $900, but I called the property direct and they gave me an excellent rate, including breakfast! Wow. They offered a shuttle service, and without it, staying there could have been a pain, because it is four miles from the main drag. Expect to pay around $15-20 for taxi fare if you don't catch the shuttle. We were there over New Year's and it was very busy. There were some people stranded at the shuttle stop because the van wasn't big enough, and this problem needs to be addressed, because some folks got pretty mad about that. The pool is nice, but don't expect to be able to swim in the ocean. The hotel has a strip of fake beach, but it overlooks kind of a swampy boating area not suitable for swimming. We didn't eat at the restaurant except for breakfast, and that was fine. Overall, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Hotel with an Unforgetable View”
Reviews.Author: PittpantherPK
Reviews.Content: Recently my girlfriend and I had the absolute pleasure of staying at the Beachside Resort and Conference center in Key West Florida. To say it was anything less than magnificent would be a downright lie. We rented an Oceanfront suite on the Gulf of Mexico side a 1 Â½ bathroom, king size bed, fully furnished with a balcony & refrigerator. I was pleasantly surprised to find the pictures on the website do not do the hotel justice. The main thing is to be aware that the check-in is at 3:00 pm & late checkout is at 12:00 pm. Our flight arrived early and our room was not ready. While this was a little disheartening the staff held our luggage and even provided us with a lift to Duval Street in the complimentary shuttle which runs on the hour from 8:00 am till 10:00 pm. The drop off point is Margaretaville which is in the middle of Duval Street. This is very convenient for getting around and the staff even provides maps so that you do not get lost. The staff is very courteous and extremely helpful. We did not take advantage of the room cleaning service so I cannot comment on the staff. However the hotel staff was extremely curteous and even secured us a ride from the hotel to the airport which saved us a 12 dollar cab fare. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone considering a visit to Key West. The views are spectacular and if you like to jog you can take your pick of jogging on the Atlantic or Gulf sideâ€¦ah the choices. An unforgettable trip to say the least, complimented by a wonderful hotel experience at the wonderful Beachside Resort and Conference Center. On a side note they were in the midst of a name changeover to occur after January 1, 2009 to the Marriot, so this review is prior to the switch. Mention the AAA card and get extra savings!

Reviews.Title: “Below expectations ...”
Reviews.Author: delfing
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at the entrance of key west but a very short drive to downtown. The bedroom was just ok, probably the best part was the bed, really comfortable, as usual for Marriot. The bathroom was also ok. However, it seems the hotel has very different kind of rooms and we must have got one of the worst, just a small bedroom with the bathroom, not a kitchen, or living room or even a mini bar in the bedroom. The only window of the room was facing an outdoor corridor which gave access to other rooms so you had to choose between privacy or natural light, and having all the day long the window closed and the lights on was not so convenient. In addition, the room was quite close to the main road and it was quite nosy, and in the corridor the noise was terrible. The common areas, pool, gardens, and so on were find although the pool seemed a little small for the size of the resort. Front desk staff was just fine, nothing special and the service from the bell boy was quite impolite. He just told us this is your building, take the lift and you will find your room in your second floor, and not even offered to take the luggage. It was my first time there, and it looks there are different categories of guests, as we saw some other people received much better service. So, probably, unless you are a regular customer of the property I would not recommend for first time visitors or tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Very Understanding management”
Reviews.Author: NCtraveller27
Reviews.Content: We were all set to go and just the night before came under the weather with flu and had to cancel the booking. Normally the hotel charges $150 as a penalty but upon learning about our situation the hotel management happily agreed to waive the penalty. This was the week after Thanksgiving, so it was not as if they were heavily booked and would find last minute reservations. Very few times have I seen such a courteous hotel management.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Worth The Money”
Reviews.Author: SavyTravlr
Reviews.Content: Could not have been more pleased with our stay at the hotel. We arrived at 11:30 am and checked in without a problem. I advised them our daughter decided to come with us. They were so accommodating, they upgraded us so that "we would be more comfortable" - their words. What a surprise when we walked into the unit and discovered they had upgraded us to a 3 bedroom. We had more than enough space. The pool was great, the hottub was perfect. The service at the pool bar was fabulous. This was definitely one of our better vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again and again”
Reviews.Author: BRWyatt
Reviews.Content: I will put it very simply. I will stay at this resort every time I come to Key West which is quite often as long as they have availability. When I first found this location, I was looking for a decent place to stay at a decent price. I stay in Key West 6 to 8 times a year and while I love luxury, I cannot afford to stay in the $300-$500 resorts when I go so often. This Resort turned out to have the luxury I would expect from the higher priced resorts but at a much more reasonable rate. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. I absolutely did not feel like I was staying in a hotel, which Beachside Resort is not, but felt like I was staying in home or condo. This was not a small room with a small kitchenette or a bathroom that is unusually shaped because they tried to fit everything into a small space. This was real luxury. I live in a big house and the master bath here was as big if not bigger then what I have in a big 5 bedroom house. The kitchen was absolutely a complete kitchen of the best cabinets, appliances and marble counter tops. In the one bedroom suite, the bedroom is a completely seperate room from the Kitchen/Dining/Living room and was bigger then any hotel room I have ever stayed in by itself. And finally, the living room and deck were both beautiful and comfortable with LCD TV's and cushioned patio furniture. The rooms however are not the only suprises. The pool area was so beautifully appointed with its very large swimming pool, comfortable lounge chairs including double lounge chairs for the romantic couples, unbelievable landscaping, and Cabanas with curtains when you want a little privacy. Ask the bar tender at the poolside bar and restaurant for a chocolate milk shake or anything else not on the menu. If they know it or you can describe it then they will make it. I have stayed many times in Key West directly on Duval Street thinking that I wanted to be as close as possible to the action. This location is even better. They have a shuttle running between the resort and Duval that is free and you do not have to listen to the motorcycles and screaming all night long like you would if you stayed on Duval. You can stay and party on Duval as long as you like and then go to a extremely comfortable and quite room when you are ready for a quite and luxureous bed. I read a lot of the reviews before staying here and was concerned about the bad remarks about the beach. They are right that the beach area is not for swimming. The sand does not run into the water as it is held back by a retaining wall and the water is not what I would normally swim in. But for laying out in the sun it is fantastic. They have a few hammocks available for those wanting to really relax and the sand is soft with no rocks unlike the real beaches on the south side of Key West. I normally much prefer the beach to the pool when going to any beach resort but this beach has the benefits of both as it is directly between the pool and the ocean. You can enjoy both at the same time. You don't have to leave the pool and go a couple hundred yards to get to the beach. They are right together. Lastly, the restaurant was fantastic. They had some very unusual dishes and I strongly recommend the Ahi Tuna. Yes prices are high as you would expect at any hotel or resort but not extravagant. You are in a tourist area and prices everywhere are a little higher then normal. I eat at the hotel restaurant at least 1 or 2 times whenever I go. I cannot vouche for there breakfasts though as I love cooking breakfast in the room and never made it to the restaurant at that time. As I said at the start. I will stay at this location again and again. I cannot give a stronger recommendation. I was so impressed that I am actually checking on this review that I am willing to be contacted which is something I have never done before.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but dirty and service lacking.”
Reviews.Author: crissy08
Reviews.Content: The units are beautiful but the tile floors were very dirty and after maid service several things were not replaced like one of the robes, the kitchen towels and all the toiletries except for a shower cap and q tips (there was no shampoo, even on the first night). We also had a bulb out in a bathroom. When I called to bring it to their attention, no one returned my call although a manager was on staff and I left the message on her voice mail. At check out, the housekeeping manager on duty appologized but offered no compensation. She said someone had gone to our room to replace a lightbulb and bring something but that the "Do Not Disturb" sign was up. If they had called back we would have been expecting them. I would not stay here again. They don't pay attention to details, don't seem to care about making your stay comfortable or if you come back. Another thing, we din't have a good view of the sunset, even from our private roof top. We were in unit 132.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!!!”
Reviews.Author: bgmg83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Beachside Resort to celebrate our 25th anniversary. We were given a complimentary upgrade on our room and when we walked in, it was amazing. The "room" was a one bedroom condo complete with a full size kitchen, dining room, living room, bedroom and 1 1/2 baths. The room was spotless and had all the comforts of home! The staff at the hotel were wonderful too. We had dinner at their restaurant, Tavern N Town and it was fantastic! We both had the Filet Mignon and it was delicious. We had dinner at Morton's in Chicago and this was much better and alot cheaper ($250 for dinner for 2 at Mortons; $150 including tip at Tavern N Town). Overall our experience was unbelievable and we highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Key West. As other reviews mentioned, it was on the quieter side of town, but with the shuttle service they provide it was not a problem for us. My only wish is that I didn't stay at Beachside longer. We stayed in Ft. Lauderdale and Miami for a few days before staying in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Kikiskiski
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic. The one bedroom suite we stayed in was beautiful. Granite counter top, Sub Zero Stainless appliances. It had a great stair way off the veranda to go to the pool. The pool was clean and very nice. Staff was wonderful. If you want to stay right in Old Town Key West this isnt the place for you but they do have a free shuttle hourly to Old Town and they pick you up. This is by far one of the best places I have stayed and will return again as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, They need an Ice Machine and Bucket”
Reviews.Author: gowestman
Reviews.Content: We were there for three nights and I have to say I was impressed with place. All modern room with large tub, and trey vaulted ceiling. Impressive thick towels. The king bed was very comfortable and the service was friendly. I do have to admit that even if this is a resort, they should have ice machines and buckets available to the guests. I ended up going to the convience store for a 10 lb bag of ice, because I was afriad of the 4.00 delivery charge plus the cost of the ice and glasses. Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again, if the price we got was available again. Oh yes, the Tavern restaurant was fabulous. A little pricey but outstanding food and service Tim and Sally Atlanta, GA

Reviews.Title: “Suite Heaven”
Reviews.Author: kerryc1133
Reviews.Content: Im sitting on my balcony at the Beachside writing this review. We pre-booked a one bedroomed suite through Expedia and got an amazing rate of $152 per night. The photos on the hotel website look great, but we all know thats not always what you get. Well this is the exception!!! We have a little private entrance and then into our suite. When we opened the door we dropped our bags and ran around checking everything out. it is totally amazing and I would reccomend it to anyone. Its huge, 2 bathrooms, huge comfy kingsize bed, flat screen TV's in the bedroom and living room and the kitchen is very high spec with everything you could need. Underground car park is a bonus and the pool, cabanas and little private beach are great to relax and watch the sun go down. We only intended to stay 2 nights but are currently on our fourth and final night....we go home tomorrow :( If your looking for a little luxury, great service, great location and much more you wont be dissapointed. OK, back to my frozen marguerita and the sunshine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: tkmflorida
Reviews.Content: I went to the hotel for my 20th anniverary it was beautiful. However on my last night there I fell asleep on a beautiful cream sectoinal in living area. I woke up showered then began to notice a few red dots on my leg then arm. I waited for husband to check out an hour into trip found legs arms and back were itching like crazy. Had to stop get medicine. I called hotel to inform I thought sand fleas were in room they stated thanks for calling they will take care of it. Went to Dr when returned home it was bed bug bites. Called hotel informed them and they refuse to admit and say there was not a problem . I advise anyone who goes do not sleep on sofa. I dont think they are easy to get rid of so it would need in depth exterminating and all furniture will need to be removed and destroyed. If you had any problems w/ bites in a specific room please write a review. I know I got them there b/c I did not sleep anywhere else and they only come out in certain times of early morning and it takes time to start to itch. Please leave email and I will respond.

Reviews.Title: “My second time staying at beachside”
Reviews.Author: PatsRule1
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at Beachside and just like before i had the best stay of my life. Very friendly and luxurious. Im pretty disappointed the two guys from Boston are not caring for the pool anymore. they were really good guys with alot of knowledge in their business. You can tell the pool is suffering from whoever is caring for it know. Other than that its a great resort!

Reviews.Title: “Not fun”
Reviews.Author: tpennell
Reviews.Content: We did not like our stay here. Thought it was going to be great, but it was not. Next time we come to Key West we will stay somewhere else. It was not what is was built up as.

HotelInfo.Name: Key West Marriott Beachside Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 3841 North Roosevelt Boulevard, Key West, FL 33040
